Review_title: BEST ROB VAC (in this price range)
Product_review: ¬†I purchased the Roborock E4 over a month ago.

I've only noticed a few minor issues with this vacuum. Sometimes it doesn't do the entire area and I have to run it a 2nd time, but it gets it all then. Haven't figured out why it does this yet. I have a area rug and it doesn't even slow it down, my husband thinks it does a better job on the rug than the hardwood floors!! The bin is large enough to hold everything left on the floor from 3 large dogs, 3 adults, 2 kids and multiple people coming and going. As I'm in a wheelchair this thing is a LIFE SAVER for me!!!! I also ordered the "mop" setup and will be trying it out soon. I have to admit I caught this on sale for 100 off but this machine is worth the full price to me!!

¬†We have had this little vac for almost two months and I thought it was time for a review. I‚Äôll start off by saying it isn‚Äôt a roomba and you can definitely tell that by some of its quirky motions, the biggest being that our carpet is a little longer and causes it to ‚Äúsee‚Äù an object and clean around it. I addressed this with customer service and they were prompt with replies and helpful to let me know it was an issue with our carpet length. Overall though even with that issue it still clean our carpet thoroughly every time, just takes a bit longer than expected. It has no issue making nice lines in the carpet and picks up a full bin every time. We have two dogs that shed and three young kids so we run it daily. Overall I‚Äôm very happy with this purchase and hopefully it will hold up for quite some time. It does an okay job mapping the house but without Lidar control this was expected. We don‚Äôt review many items but I wanted to let anyone on the fence with this unit know it‚Äôs worth the purchase! Also I‚Äôll add that it regularly finishes a room then goes to the next doorway to start another and have only had it not make it to the dock a couple times when going to recharge.

First of all, I used to be a person who saw a robot vacuum's being not worth it. There are a couple of reasons for this like price and overall cleaning. That was the case until I found this little bot, for only $250 you get a great bot.

Review_title: Gets stuck on EVERYTHING. Constant supervision required. Disappointing...
Product_review: ¬†Grabbed this on Cyber Monday and was really excited for the first cleaning session. Got it set up pretty easily in the app and then let it go to work. I walked away and moments later I heard a loud grinding noise, followed by several notification alarms on my phone. The Roborock had gotten stuck on the threshold of my hardwood floor doorway and couldn't figure out how to simply back up or turn around. I manually repositioned him and walked away as he resumed cleaning, but several minutes later I heard an even louder grinding noise followed by another notification on my phone. The Roborock had rolled into my bathroom rug and got stuck. My bathroom rug has rubber anti-slide grips underneath, so I was kind of disappointed that the Roborock couldn't manage to roll into the rug without lifting it off the ground and shoving it across the floor.

The robot suction power is great, it cleans really well and doesn't scatter debris around. it will also automatically increase suction to high once detect carpet and will clean until the battery reach low level then go back to the dock and recharge to resume cleaning from the same spot it finished. It's accuracy is really good as long as it was not manually interrupted or placed in different spot.

Review_title: Very impressed how the robot cleans adequately
Product_review: I just bought the Roborock E4 3 weeks ago. I was very skeptical at first on how a vacuum robot could clean and vacuum the hard floors and carpets in my home. We have 3 rabbits, so it means a lot of small hay left on the floors and carpets and some dry rabbit poops around the litter. That means I have to vacuum 3-4 times a week the whole house and this is time consuming. I first tested the robot downstairs. I was surprised on how it handled the rabbits fur balls. I was watching it go and it really covered the whole floor where it could go and even the edges. I then brought it back upstairs in the kitchen where there were rabbits fur balls, some toast crumbs (from breakfast) and some sand (coming from shoes when going in and out). It was the best time to test it and see if it vacuumed all the small debris. I started it and went downstairs. After 26 min, it was finished as I got the notification. I went upstairs and at my surprise, everything was gone, cleaned. The last test I performed was to put the robot in the rabbits room where there's a carpet. There were a lot of small hay on the carpet and some rabbit poops. This was the ultimate test. After 20 min, the robot was done with the cleaning so I went to look and there were no more poops and just some hay left on the carpet. That's to say that I've got a Shark Rocket vacuum and I have to pass more than once on the carpet so all the hay is vacuum so I can say that the Roborock E4 does a similar job. Looking at the robot, it goes in a Z shape pattern and knows where it's been and where to go. It's not a random pattern like the cheaper robots. Only one concern. When the robot cleans the edges, the side brush speeds up and sometimes, instead of throwing the debris in front of the robot so it can vacuum those debris, it throws the debris too far towards the center of the room. Since the robot starts with the center of the room and finishes with the edges, some debris that were thrown in the middle are not vacuum and since the robot finishes with the edges, it goes back to the charging station after having done the edges, leaving some debris in the center. That's why I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5. In all, I'm very satisfied with that vacuum robot and at this price, it does a good job with its double gyroscope and OpticEye system.

Review_title: Move cords out of the way and let it do it‚Äôs job!
Product_review: It picks up so much from my dog that I thought was clean... He shakes causing hair floating in the air and settles on the floors. I wish I had bought one years ago!! Love it! üòä

Review_title: It is better than we ever  thought it could be.
Product_review: We just love this robot. We have a dog and lots of carpet and it works like a dream We vacumned the carpet before we used the Robot. We had to empty the Robot four times, even though it had just been vacumned. We love that it goes under the couch and chairs---no need to move anything, Works great on our hard wood floors too.

Review_title: FLEXING MUSCLES...My New Cleaning Man Rocks
Product_review: After over 20 hours of research and reviews, I could not gave been more pleased going with Roborock E4 as my very first robot vacuum. Paid about $170 out the door after applying $75 reward points, $110 coupon on top of cyber sale price.

Review_title: It works well getting pet hair up
Product_review: It works well for cat hair and dog hair. I'm happy with my vacuum
Looks prettier than the picture shows, the matte black design looks very cool.

This review is long, but if you‚Äôll take the time to read it, I think you‚Äôll find a lot of useful information about the Roborock E4. It is a good alternative both in price and performance to the random navigation robot vacuums, which just bounce around. Budget robots feature random navigation as do the less expensive models of Shark and Roomba. The E4 uses internal navigation to move around your home leaving straight lines and covering 99% of a room.

I wanted to love this vacuum. It works great. After several attempts, the device finally connected to wifi, but then it will drop from wifi periodically and then it takes several attempts to reconnect. Roborock customer service responds pretty quickly, but by email only. There is no customer service phone number. Sadly, I have to return the vacuum. I don't have the time to repeatedly attempt to reconnect to wifi.

This product cleans okay but it has issues. I bought it July 28, 2020 and it has never been able to dock by itself. It will look all over the house for the dock and be within 6 foot of it and still not find it. I have to pick it up and sit it down within a foot of the dock. Last month for over two weeks it would not connect to the app and it finally started connecting again and updated. Last week it has started running against the wall or any object and it will spin around and around in circles and then give an error 8. I can pick it up and move it then start it again and it will finish cleaning. I have cleaned everything on the vacuum that can be cleaned. I really regret buying this, it should last longer than 3 months.

Purchased the E4 just over a week ago and have used it every day. It has worked great so far and I have no complaints. The first time I ran it, I followed it as it cleaned the entire house so I could locate trouble spots. I Had to adjust a few things to keep the sensor on top of the machine from causing it to get stuck. Uneven floors would allow it to move under furniture at one point, but then not have the clearance to exit at a different point. Transitions seamlessly from wood to tile to area rugs. Although it does not like really small light weight area rugs. Then again, no vacuum does so not really a big issue for me. It sometimes will clean the same area twice, but I think that has more to do with the cats and dogs taking issues with it and knocking it off course. Which brings up my favorite part of this machine. It slows down when it senses a obstacle in front of it, which in our case is usually our older slower moving cat. Overall very pleased so far. 1600 sq ft floor, all hardwood and tile with 3 dogs and 4 cats.

Review_title: Good Cleaner If You Can Get It To Work Correctly
Product_review: I like the cleaning power of this vacuum it does a good job of suctioning things up. I‚Äôve had a few problems with it that I‚Äôve not been able to solve. I‚Äôve reached out to Roborock customer service several times and had no reply so just having to use it the way it is. Within two runs, my vacuum has been covered in scuffs, scratches, and paint. It runs into everything and doesn‚Äôt stop. It just keeps pounding itself into it which has caused the vacuum to look terrible. Nearly every time the vacuum runs, I have to chase it down when it‚Äôs done cleaning to take it back to its base. It will run until it dies looking for the base. It‚Äôs not blocked by a lot of things or difficult to reach. The vacuum goes to three different rooms looking for it‚Äôs base but not the room the base is in. The vacuum also decides what rooms it wants to clean that time. Some runs, it will completely ignore a room. It‚Äôll take five more runs to get it to go into that room. Lastly, I‚Äôve been unable to get the app to do the things the listing here says it will. I have been unable since purchase to make (or get the vacuum) to create a map. The app disconnects from the vacuum constantly so I don‚Äôt even use it at this point. If these issues were worked out, this would be a great vacuum.

Love this Roborock E4 , I‚Äôll be honest I‚Äôm sort of embarrassed showing the picture that I have posted. But I wanted to show you how well it actually works. I have two cats and a dog and we vacuum every day. I have area rugs and a tiled floor. I know, by the picture you wouldn‚Äôt think so, LOL. But I must admit the robot got into areas that we do not normally vacuum, like under the sofas, wall units ,beds and cabinets and produced what you see in the Photo. I love the fact that it actually increases the suction power when it goes over the rugs and reduces power when it goes back onto the tiles. Unlike other robots it doesn‚Äôt blow light items or hair around the floor from It‚Äôs exhaust , it‚Äôs designed with a diffuser where the air comes out of. I also like the fact that it connects to Alexa. It also has the option of mopping as well, But I haven‚Äôt used this feature as of yet. I had the shark robot vacuum which worked well but not as well as this one. But I will warn you if you have carpeting with black borders or just black carpeting it will avoid the carpet thinking it‚Äôs either an edge that it can fall off or the stairs. I have a Carpet with black borders and I was able to override the cliff sensors by applying white paper over the four sensors that it has. But keep in mind that I live in a single level home. If you have a multi level home I would not recommend covering the cliff sensors with white paper. I love this vacuum and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a high end budget vacuum cleaner that is extremely reliable and has mapping capabilities as well. I paid $239 and it‚Äôs worth every penny. I am very happy with the purchase!

I have had this vacuum for a few months now and had it running every morning. As a vacuum it does a decent job. The navigation is ok, better than the simpler vacuums since it mostly does straight lines but not as good as the vacuums with LIDAR navigation.

Review_title: Spend the money on a better system
Product_review: Do not go for this one, the price is tempting, until it constantly gets stuck and you have to baby it. recently i have been finding gears from the vacuum falling off after only a month of use.

¬†For whatever reason this will not work on carpet. I‚Äôve tried 6+ times in my basement with zero luck. It moves around the same area for about 5 minuets and gives an error saying objects in the way. Will be sending back unless this is resolved.

Had this for about a week now, and I'm really impressed with it. It has great suction, and actually gets in spots we have to work more to get. I was amazed how much this thing was cleaning up each day. The app is easy to use and lets you setup a schedule, shows you a cleaning map, etc. Very happy with it so far!

I purchased this after LOVING the E35 so much. From my online research, the E4 was pretty identical except that it didn't come with the mop function, which I didn't need for upstairs since it's almost all carpet. I was SO excited when this came...set it up and charged it immediately. I've run it upstairs on low pile carpeting about 4 or 5 times now and it is absolutely HORRIBLE! The noise level is fine, not too loud at all. But it doesn't pick up anything hardly at all! Not even paper hole punch circles, not thread pieces, not random pieces of small lint/papers/debris. You can see the marks in the carpet from where it was, but the debris is literally still there. It just goes right over it and leaves it there. I'm not sure if they would take it back after it being used 4 -5 times, but I deeply regret having purchased this and wish I would have just bought another E35. It sucks at sucking! :(

It doesn‚Äôt work. The app repeatedly freezes and doesn‚Äôt allow anything to initialize. There is no ability to communicate. I could upload a video here of the worthless thing tentatively and repeatedly going over about three feet in the middle of an open room without touching either side of the wall or hitting anything on a regular carpet. Then it goes to sleep. It hasn‚Äôt managed to do one single empty room.

Review_title: It Came Used and Dirty/Second One is Great
Product_review: As soon as I opened the shipping box, I could tell the original seal had been broken. Inside, the vacuum itself and all the separate parts were dirty. I'm pretty upset to think dirt, germs, and possibly critters (bedbugs, roaches) could have hitched a ride into my house. I've asked for a new replacement, but if the next one comes in the same condition, I'll be pretty peeved. This exact circumstance was mentioned in a prior review, so I guess it's an Amazon thing that happens from time to time.

Review_title: Compared to iRobot i7, this is about 75% as good at a quarter of the price.
Product_review: I have both this and the Roomba i7. These are both amazing machines. I had a 5 year old roomba and wow, the new gen has come a long way!!

Review_title: Should have bought this years ago!  Love it!
Product_review: EDIT AFTER 6 OR 7 WEEKS OF USE:

This review is mainly regarding the phone application for the Roborock E4. The vacuum itself does a decent job. It initially liked to beach itself on my shag rug, but thankfully it somehow figured out the rug and now avoids it. The vacuum also likes to get stuck in a corner in my bedroom and keep on the same path until I move it. It‚Äôs a bit annoying but that area is now the cleanest corner in the room.

Review_title: Best model I‚Äôve tried so far
Product_review: I have tried comparable models from Deebot, Roomba 600 series, MooSoo & Kyvol. I can honestly say that the Roborock has the most, and best, features. While the Roomba was definitely best at raising the nap of the carpet, it was very limited on the extra functions, at least for the ‚Äúunder $700 models.‚Äù

¬†Love having this robot vacuum!!! This has made my life so much easier and less stressful. I live with two roommates and my level of cleanliness is a lot higher than theirs, so instead of stressing over the fact that there‚Äôs crumbs all over the floor after it was just cleaned, I just turn on Fred (we named him) and I come back to a clean kitchen and living room!

¬†I got this robot vacuum when it was a ‚Äúdeal of the day‚Äù on amazon. I got it for a great price! After purchasing, I ALMOST canceled my order because I thought the price was too good to be true and it was going to be crap and I wasted my money...but after doing some research, I thought ok, I‚Äôm going to give it a try. I AM COMPLETELY IMPRESSED!!! I have 2 shedding dogs (one being a pure bred husky), a cat, and 2 kids. This little vacuum has saved my sanity!! It picks up SOOOO much! The video I posted was after I vacuumed with my kerby vacuum just a couple hours before!! I definitely recommend this vacuum! Best decision I made!

Review_title: MMI, or Lack Thereof -- One Awesome Disappointment
Product_review: I purchased this robot vacuum, the Roborock E4, largely on the basis of it rated suction value and the "Outstanding" reviews appearing on these pages., I have had the vacuum for about 3 hours, most of which time was spent in setting up the Mi Home app, Alexa, and the vacuum. What a disappointment. There is very little, if any, coordination between or integration of the users manual, the Hi Hone app, and Alexa. Alexa is understandable, but there is no excuse for the lack of integration of the Roborock E4 and the Mi Home app. The instructions in the users manual are brief, cryptic, and unsatisfactory for any normal human. The Hi Home app likewise is cryptic, hard to read, and hard to follow. The user interface is totally inadequate. I wonder if any of the vacuum developers have even bothered to try to use this app with this vacuum. By dint of perserverance I did connect the vacuum to my Wi-Fi network and get the vacuum to connect with the dock. I also sent the vacuum on its first cleaning mission. However, forget about programming the machine and the Mi Home app to operate within a given area, such as the living room, or a bedroom. There does not appear to any provision in the MI Home app to do that. I don't know where to glowing reviews for this vacuum originated. Perhaps the reviewers purchased a different vacuum then I did or they have not tried anything other that manually operating the vacuum. I have yet to try this vacuum as a vacuum. Perhaps my opinion will change once I have done so. Right now, the Roborock E4, Mi Home app, and Alexa combined are " One Awesome Disappointment."

The first thing I noticed about this vacuum is the large dust bin. See in my picture next to the can of Pledge. After running the robot vacuum on a regularly vacuumed carpet it picked up a good amount of embedded dust and dirt. This robot does not have mapping or no-go lines like some of the higher-level models, but I think this is reflected in the pricing. Overall I am happy with this vacuum and will use it to keep my pool table chaulk free.

We bought two of the Roborock 4's. One upstairs and one down. They vacuum really well and we have a Great Pyrenees anda St Bernard so hair in our house is amazing, even though I brush them. These vacuums keep up with the hair very well. The only problem we have had is they sometimes get lost when going home. I bought my son one Roborock 6 and a 4 for his new house. He loved the 6, super fast and never gets lost. We returned the 4 and bought another 6 for him. The highlight of the Roborock is the dusbin can be thoroughly cleaned. I feel good about that. We use them daily and the house has no dog hair. Super job.

Review_title: Everything is said it was.  Very pleased with my purchase!!!
Product_review: I bought this thing to hopefully help with the massive amount of dog hair my two labs shed on a daily basis. It can get overwhelming at times. I could make a new dog with the hair every other day. So I googled top rated robot vacuums for pet hair and this machine came up. The price was good and the reviews were good. The set up was very simple, you down load an app, register it, then connect to the wifi, maybe 10 minutes total, then let it charge up. Well 2 days in and I am very pleased. I have to empty the tray several times during its cleaning session but that isn't any problem and was to be expected. It have about 1800 sq feet of tile flooring that it cleaned very well. I kept the bedroom doors closed that have carpeting, so I can't speak for how it would handle the rooms, but it cleans the few throw rugs that I have strewn throughout the house with ease. No more sweeping for me, this thing kicks butt so far. Oh and its pretty quiet as well. I just let it run as I watched TV and it did its thing. I would definitely purchase again if need be. If you have pets or kids, I don't think you will be disappointed with your purchase.

I live in a small townhouse with a cat and a golden retriever, so fur is all over the house. Not to mention the dirt that we track inside from our walks. Every morning, I run the vacuum and it picks up and all the loose fur, not to mention the litter my cat scatters everywhere. I even run it one more time in the evening to pick up the dirt brought in during the day. It allows me to get other things down while I know the floors are getting cleaned. The battery life has been great.

I am going to preface this review by saying that I did not expect this vacuum/mop to be as effective as my regular vacuum or floor cleaner and it is not. However, I am quite impressed with this little guy. As many others stated in their reviews, I cancelled my cleaning service due to covid and I admit, I wasn't that good at cleaning my carpets and floors as often as I should. I took that money I saved by not having a cleaning service and bought myself "Geoffrey" (thanks for the name, Fresh Prince). I was amazed at how much dirt "Geoffrey" sucked up after 1 pass. While he did miss a few spots, he was able to get to areas I cannot reach with my upright vacuum, such as under the bed. The reason I took 1 star off was for the mopping. I attempted to mop with the provided mopping pad but all I got was a wet pad, no dirt. I stuck a thicker wet mop pad using velcro and let it go for another pass. I was amazed how much dirt I was on the pad following the 2nd round. I don't think the mop pad is thick enough to truly "mop" the floor. Small detail but I wanted to mention it to make others aware. In summary, I would highly recommend this machine!

Bought it to help with dog hair and foot prints on floor... first one lost drive wheel in 3 days... was replaced by Amazon... just started new one yesterday will see how it holds up vs the other robot upstairs thats 3 or 4 years old now and still running...

It‚Äôs really good for the price. Really impressed but after a month of using it, it started completely missing rooms. Some days it would skip my room and some days it would skip my entire HUGE hallway. It‚Äôs pretty annoying having to start is all over again.

The product seemed a decent quality but I tried every conceivable thing to get it to connect to Wi-Fi and it was unsuccessful. Many others have had the same problem so should‚Äôve listened to those reviews.

Review_title: Mop function is useless if you have any rugs on the floor
Product_review: This product should not be sold. If you have a area rug on your floor it's useless.
If you are on the market for a robot vacuum, I can highly recommend the Roborock E4!

The description states this vacuum has mapping and even shows the app with mapping. This vacuum does NOT have mapping using the software mentioned in the instructions. We returned a different brand of vacuum that had mapping and it stopped working. So we returned it and specifically purchased this vacuum to try another brand with mapping. Don't buy this one. False advertisement. Also the instructions talk about wet mopping. This device also does not have wet mopping.

Review_title: Not as effective as I hoped.
Product_review: Tried it for 3 days. Does an good job with vacuuming. But has consistently missed 2 full bedrooms and one half of another bedroom. There is no way to make it go to those rooms. Disappointed.

We have had this a couple of months and had to return it. If you have to hand vacuum all the places this thing misses, then why run it? I did one room and then ran my dyson upright to see what it missed and even though it picked up some, it still left enough for half a container on my dyson. It blows some debris out of its reach and then doesn‚Äôt go back to clean that. I had a deboot, that lasted for 3 years under heavy use, and it was great until my son broke it. This thing never mapped or went in a straight line, just went off diagonally wherever. I bit the bullet and bought a roomba for more suction power and overall better reviews, even from close friends. Just remember, you get what you pay for in this instance.

Review_title: Nice device/Alexa and App seem like false advertising
Product_review: We really like our Roborock vacuum. It cleans our downstairs while we sleep today. It covers about a thousand square feet in 2 hours or so. Does a great job on carpet and hardwood, doesn‚Äôt scuff anything, and cleans up pet hair from 2 dogs and 2 cats. We only do spot cleaning nowadays and it‚Äôs nice: 1 less thing to do.
The robot vacuum post that you didn't know you needed! TL;DR

This cleaner is advertised to have app supported remote control. App (on the Android) is completely useless. It wants access to location (considering this is an app from China, we will pass). What is the point of location services? Ridiculous. All the app needs to do is connect to the vacuum that is in our house, not somewhere across the world, so why location services? Not giving it full access to the phone means limited functionality? That's fine, except that it will not connect to our robot at all. So effectively, WIFI is a waste of battery, and the advertised WIFI/APP is something that the vendor should take out of the cost as it's flat out does not work.

Review_title: Loud, app is absolutely novice, but does a surprisingly good job of trouble-free cleaning
Product_review: Was on the verge of returning this. First impression was the utterly novice garbage app with Chinese characters everywhere. I'm guessing roborock paid bottom dollar for software 'talent' and passed the savings on? Can't integrate with Alexa because the app is gibberish. Zero stars on that count.

Review_title: Works fine but App is worthless
Product_review: I waited a long time to get a new robo vacuum and thought this sounded great based on reviews. Sure enough it works great but DO NOT believe them about the app. I is a total waste of space on my phone and does not work at all. Absolutely useless. You can still get some benefit from this if you're willing to manually start it. But again DO NOT believe that you'll be able to control it with the app. It absolutely does not work.

Review_title: Excellent robot vaccuum & mop at an affordable price. I'm astonished honestly.
Product_review: Best purchase possibly ever or at least since my Dyson purchase. I am astonished at how well this little guy cleans up everything. We have predominantly hardwood floors throughout our home but many area rugs a dog and two bunnies that can create quite a mess. Not to mention the 3 girls, one of which rides horses and brings home all sorts of dirt,dust and fur and a husband who loves to cook, tinker and leave messes everywhere because he's too busy creating and thinking, all of which I am ok with but I also work a lot and run my own business. So not a lot of time for cleaning honestly. We have it set on a cleaning schedule at night while were sleeping. I have it run nightly to clean up the day's messes. I've noticed it has also significantly cut down on the amount of dust our home/we produces likely improving the overall air quality in the home. The mop feature works very well and I run that every other night just to keep things tidy overall. I still do a deep clean once a month myself but have noticed a great improvement overall in our floors cleanliness. I would suggest buying more mop cloths if you end up using this feature as much as I do. With kids you will want to use it. It really does a good job mopping surprisingly. I'm honestly shocked.

Review_title: Good price and features, not so good on medium pile carpet
Product_review: Overall a very good product. I bought this model because it goes in straight lines to clean and not in a random pattern. It will map your house using its optic eye which is why there is only one side brush. And I believe if it runs out of battery it will recharge and resume where it left off. My house is too small so it always finishes at around 60% battery.

I run this robot daily and sometimes twice daily if the dogs have tracked dirt in or out. It‚Äôs unbelievable how much dirt it picks up daily-mostly dog hair and dander. It has completely changed the way I clean. I run a broom behind doors and in some corners about once a week and the robot does the rest. The mopping feature cleans the dog prints and small spots. I put hot water in the reservoir to start. I leave rugs in place even when using the mop feature. It‚Äôs such a small amount of moisture that it has not had any impact on the area rugs. I cannot speak for carpet because I have none. The app is reassuring because it shows the cleaning path after each cleaning session so I know it has not missed a room like my old Roomba used to do. I put it in gentle mode when I want the robot to be nearly silent while cleaning but otherwise I use the balanced mode for faster cleaning. The battery lasts for the entire cleaning unless I put it in turbo mode for a faster cleaning. I use the robot for the first floor which is about 1800 sf. It occasionally wedges itself under a kitchen cabinets but not every time. I have to close the front door during cleaning to keep its wheels from getting suspended. I tell everyone about this vacuum because I like it so much.

Review_title: of the 5 different robot vacuums I've had these are my favorite!
Product_review: I've had 2 different roborock models, 2 different eufy models and the irobot 675. my Roomba was amazing. had it about 3 years and it still runs like new. biggest thing I didn't like about it was that it got stuck constantly and about once a week didn't return to it's base. the eufy models had this problem as well. both brands get long female hair stuck in the brush like crazy though as well! my gf has really long hair and the roborock models do a great job of not getting tons of hair stuck in the brush. I went with the roborock E40s overall because of the lack of maintenance they require. I have 3 levels, one bot on each level. I have a small dog sitting business and even when I'm fully booked with long hair dogs these can go easily 3 days without having to even think about them. you can tell when brushing out the filter that it does a great job of catching fine particles and the filter can even be rinsed well with warm water.

Bought this just a couple months ago. It never did connect to my phone or WiFi and I contacted them but did not want to deal with it so I just let that slide and would press start on the device every morning as there is not a remote. It suctions well and cleans in rows instead of bouncing around which is great but has now quit charging. I have cleaned it and tried many things to get it to charge fully. When I load it onto the dock it will say charging and even look like it‚Äôs charging but when I come back to try to use it it says error 12 not enough battery. Maybe mine is just defective I don‚Äôt know but I would have loved it if it would have ever connected to my internet and would still love it if it would just charge.

First use and I very happy with my choice. I looked for the best mid level vacuum for weeks, reading and watching reviews. I always ended up back at the E4. I had concerns over the spare parts shortage but I ordered a OEM roller brush with the vacuum. I also ordered additional parts directly from China, off ‚ÄúAbay‚Äù. It is replacing a old, worn out ECOVACS Deebot M81. I wanted another ecovacs because mine has been through a lot and it still works, however ecovacs doesn‚Äôt have any mid level bots to compete with the E4. I wanted something with navigation without breaking the bank. This is it!!! The application is fine, people are complaining that the application setup is hard to do, absolutely untrue. Just make sure you phone is connected to the same 2.4ghz WiFi that you choose in the app. Application has much more to offer than the ecovacs app. The bot talks to you which seems very professional. My entire floor is hardwood and watching it clean in straight lines and when is pauses to think about where to go is amazing. Just like the big money lazer bots. I do not know the durability or customer service aspects at this time but I do believe it is the right choice for the money. The roomba E5 was another option but the roborock wins in all categories. Huge battery, huge dustbin, navigation, price. For the 250-300$ range I do believe this is top dog.

This vacuum is terrible. Goes right over small pieces of dirt that should be easily suctioned up and leaves the dirt behind. Battery seems to last less than an hour. Doesn‚Äôt clean at all. I didn‚Äôt open it until a few months after purchasing and what a mistake that was!!

Just to give you some background, I got this because I have a cat and dog (both shirt hair) who shed like it's their mission in life. My husband also is unfortunate enough to be allergic to pet hair and me sweeping daily wasn't enough so I decided maybe its time for some help. He had mentioned getting a Roomba in the past but he's also hella booshy and seems to think we have this kinda money. I happened to come across some money I could spent and, as if it were meant to be, this little buddy was on a flash sale! I bought it without a second thought (after doing research).

I have both this product and a Roomba... Up against each other, the Roborock wins hands down. It doesn't get stuck as much, it doesn't get hair tangled in it as easily, the sweeper is nylon so it's fantastic for hardwood floors, it learns the layout of the house faster... The list could go on. I have two long haired, double-coated dogs and this robot vacuum keeps up in a 1500 sq ft house! I do have to run it daily and I sweep/mop at least once a week, but it cuts down on the time I spend cleaning tremendously! It does great on carpet and hardwood floors. I haven't used the mop function so I can't speak to that... It does tend to rearrange my smaller rugs, but I just have to remember to pick them up before I run the Roborock.

Review_title: Does a decent job for the price
Product_review: We like it because we have to vacuum every day to keep the dog hair to a minimum and this device takes the drudgery out of it. The dogs are fascinated by it and like to follow it around.

Review_title: Great product! Good suction, smart and thorough.
Product_review: I love the Robo rock. I have looked at every brand and every review. The roomba doesn‚Äôt have consistent reviews for the price. This robo rock is amazing. It cleans well. It seems smart: it follows a pattern, it figures out how to get out of a pickle, can identity to stay away from stairs, etc. I downloaded the recommended app and can make it clean from my phone. The base is on my main floor, but I needed to clean upstairs. No problem. I just picked him up and pressed start. When I figured he did everything, I took him back downstairs. I‚Äôm so incredibly happy with this purchase. I bought this brand based on a friend‚Äôs recommendation (he is as picky as I am about buying these electronics). The price after the applied coupon was around $200 and that seems like a bargain based on the quality of work this robot puts in. My advice to everyone- take care of it. Maintain it like it says in the manual. It‚Äôs so easy to dispense the tray and clean out the rotating brush. Be good to it and I bet it‚Äôll be good to you.

Review_title: Read this if you're having problems connecting the E4 to your WIFI
Product_review: I have had the Roborock E4 in my possession for 6 hours, long enough to vacuum the first floor of my home and it's worked flawlessly during it's maiden voyage around the corners and crevices of my home. On first impression, it appears to be better engineered and out-performs my old $570 Neato D4 which died 4 days short of its 3rd birthday.

Review_title: Can't believe I lived without this machine!
Product_review: When I first opened the box & looked this robot over I was very skeptical...it looked very similar to my Roomba - it would be getting stuck every night in the exact same spots. The dust bin looked like I'll never be able to get all of the dirt out because of the lip. The mop attachment is so small I figured I would be spending my day refilling it. BUT!!! I wouldn't trade this machine for anything!

Review_title: Keep looking -  wouldn't be my first choice
Product_review: ¬†I had reviewed this product previously before making it my primary robot vac. Since, I've come to learn that this machine lacks in so many ways. However, I'll start with the positives, which are just a few. I like how it follows a continuous pattern rather than zigzagging through the house. It has a great battery life. And, the reason I purchased it, was the mopping option. Now calling it mopping is a far stretch of the imagination, but it does allow you to run a wet cloth across the floors while also vacuuming. This is a nice feature with all hard floors. What I don't like: It does not pick up near the amount of debris as my other robot and there have been times that I look at my floor after running it that it looks untouched. I detest the just cup. It doesn't have a full opening on any side so the dust never completely empties. It's like one of those maze games to move it in the right direction to get it all emptied. I also have a huge issue with this robot getting stuck at the threshold. My other robot powers over everything - this one barely makes it over and sometimes does not. I contacted customer service to inquire, I suspected I may have a defective machine. I was told to clean the wheels which I did and just a few cleanings afterwards the problem began again. Then I was told to use a a mat at the threshold. When I told them I did not want a mat I was simply told to reset the vac. At that point I decided it wasn't worth it to continue to interact with customer service and my best move would be to advise other buyers to beware. I definitely wouldn't purchase this vac again, not even to have the wet pad/mop feature and I strongly urge you to keep looking.

Easy setup. Great on getting pet fur off carpets and floors. Keeps dusty dirt off floors. Easy to maintain (cleaning sensors, emptying dust bin, cleaning brushes). Due to the low clearance of my kitchen cabinets, it does get briefly stuck each time it's used - the top of the unit has some awful scratches from that. Hopefully, future models will be scratch-resistant. I have experienced Wi-Fi connection issues but, I just repeat the Wi-Fi setup and it works again. I would buy this again. Yes, I would recommend this product.

Review_title: Five-star product, a five star price
Product_review: The E4 does all of these things well:

Review_title: Can't believe this little vaccum can handle the dog hair! IT DOES!
Product_review: This is possibly the BEST money I have ever spent in my entire life! I have 2 German Shepherds. The saying with Shepherds is, "They only shed twice a year but both times lasts 6 months"! Truer words were never spoken! Keeping ahead of the hair is a nearly impossible task. I use to swiffer 2-3 times a day and vacuum every other day. Plus run around with a wisk broom and dust pan for the hair that escaped the swiffer and vacuum. With the Robovac I pick the dog's beds up beofre I go to work (the dogs go with me daily) and once I'm at work I start the Robovac from the app on my phone. I come home to no hair! It covers my entire living room floor; in thr corners, along the baseboards, under the front of the couch and chairs, under tables etc. It literally gets everywhere. I empty the dust bin when I come home in the evening and its ready to go the day. I have not used the dust mop pads with it yet. I'll update my review when I do. I'm considering taking down the baby gate that seperates the living room from the rest of the house so it can get those areas also. This vacuum will also vacuum the thick mat I have the dogs water bowl sitting on. When I comes to the steps down into another part of the house it turns itself around to avoid falling off the step. Of course I do still have to vacuum the rest of the way under the couch and chairs. Due to their height, the Robovac can't get all the way under them, but it has definitely cut my floor sweeping in more than half. I use to think there was no way a little vaccum like that to handle the hair. I came across the Robovac on one of Amazon's daily deals and thought "A that price why not give it a try". I'm so glad I did! I don't know how I ever did without it now. I highly recommend this product.

Review_title: Seems OK except it is not connecting to Alexa
Product_review: I got this robot vacuum because it specifically said you can control it with Alexa. I have followed the instruction manual and the associated app (Mi Home). When I ask Alexa to detect the device using "Other" (per Mi Home instructions), "Vacuum", and "Switch" (because some folks said they connected that way), Alexa just says no device found.

What differentiates this model from the other low cost vacs is its cleaning pattern. Most of them go straight until they hit something then turn in a random direction like a drunken sailor. In theory, they cover every inch of ground, but that's rarely the case. The E4 uses a 'back and forth' pattern - it goes straight across the room then makes a U-turn when it gets to the other wall (or an obstacle) and moves over one width. It doesn't miss areas like the other ones do.

The suction power has been great. I am giving 3 stars because it never cleans the whole 2nd floor. Even when all the doors are open. I have to physically take it into a room and shut the door behind it to get it to clean that room. It also has a super difficult time finding the docking station.

I vowed to never ever ever own a robot vacuum. Ever. The joke is on me because I bought one. And then a second. We‚Äôve had this for just over a week and run it every single day, twice a day. I don‚Äôt know where it is finding dirt. But man!!! It‚Äôs finding dirt!! I‚Äôm actually truly disgusted that I thought my floors were clean. Since we did hardwood floors on one entire level I have hated walking barefoot on and dreaded putting the baby down unless I had just mopped and vacuumed but now I don‚Äôt mind him crawling around because he‚Äôs not covered in crumbs all the time.

Review_title: Works well despite the app and wifi not connecting
Product_review: As a standalone piece, this thing is awesome. It can go deal with changes in carpet to flooring no problem, the suctions is fantastic, the filter is easy to clean and the docking station is small enough to fit up against any wall. I am only disappointed in the model not connecting to wifi and therefore being unable to use the app. It would be cool to schedule cleanings and have the product go to different rooms in the house, but without the app this isn't possible. I certainly will purchase another one in the future and make sure the compatibility is a priority. I am very impressed with this lightening deal.

Review_title: Unhappy with purchase. Poor battery life.
Product_review: Poor battery life. It took 2 charging to vacuum

Review_title: . I would purchase it more of a namebrand product.Difficult to connect up to Wi-Fi
Product_review: May be a good vacuum but we were never able to get the software to link up with our Wi-Fi even after Assistance from Customer Service. They don‚Äôt own their own app Phone app. I think that makes a big difference company should have their own app. They use a Home app somewhat like Google home.
For a product that is "so advanced" you would think that the wifi setup would be easier. I did everything, followed all of the instructions both on the app and machine and no luck. Oh well!

This vac does not clean every room and it continually cleans the same areas over and over again. It skips rooms and doesn't clean a complete room. I have moved it to several locations and no matter where it is inconsistent and does not take clean large parts of a room. The area is 1200 sq feet of carpet, so not a large area. It stops periodically saying there is something blocking it and there is nothing there. Customer service has been prompt in answering my emails and offered a few suggestions (like moving it to a different room) but to no avail. In fact, it is getting worse. I'm very disappointed.

I hate this vacuum and wish I could return, but I missed the window. It got stuck on stupid many time and would only go through my living room. A few times it would reach my kitchen and dining area. Sometime I would have to joystick through the app to get it to go somewhere else. Also the times it did get stuck numerous times cleaning the living room, it never really fully picked up my dogs fur well from the area rug. Even when ran daily, I would still see fur loose on the surface. I have one Medium size Pug/Beagle dog and he sheds a ton, I need something that can defur my house daily.

Review_title: Why dont more people have these things (right over a full one inch transition like nothing)
Product_review: I bought the roborock e4 (Belvedere) for my mother after i literally, meticulously watched about 150 video reviews on robot cleaners. I am beyond impressed it has totally surpassed all expectations in a large house that is all maple floor after sweeping it still gathered two full containers (which is one of the largest collectors on any vac), with 3 large long hair dogs it picks up hair great, and dog food great with out spilling the bowls of water. The add on moping system where my expectations were low , turns out works amazing looks as if it were mopped regular and mind you this was the first use of the mop when floor was full of prints. Also even though the water tank looks small it still had water after 60 m2 of cleaning. Granite it does not have all the bells and whistles but it does have plenty, though it may not have no-go zone, is a little piece of magnet tape really that hard im certainly not complaining, with tons of power settings, i heads right back to its dock when done or low battery and then will begin right where he left off. The navigation is incredible; makes clean back and forth sweeps and knows where it has been and has not. The dogs were not afraid after the first minute either (another surprise). And my favorite bit is he actually went over a full 1 inch transition to get in the kitchen like nothing, never in a million years did i think it would. All in all this machine is amazing, great with pets, mopping option worth it, plenty of features and all for 188.99 plus call it 40 for the mop and 15 for two extra washable / durable pads, there is really no other choice and have looked at many. -Kamron :) p.s. same motor and guts as the s4.

Review_title: Just because it's a robot doesn't mean it's smart
Product_review: We named ours Wall-E. He does his best, but sometimes I think having one little rotary brush isn't enough and that he works too hard. He often gets stuck under the coffee table or kitchen counter and makes a horrible noise, I can only imagine what it sounds like to the downstairs neighbors. I haven't figured out the app yet, I got confused by what I was supposed to do but I'll try again soon. One thing I would like is for there to be a notification beep or something that tells me when the canister is full.

This was a total impulse buy and I wanted to love it so bad. I recently developed a shoulder injury. With a lab puppy and three kids I vacuum a couple times a day sometimes with my cordless. I needed a break though and I was hoping this robot would be the answer to my prayers. Here's the deal when it worked it worked nicely. Not as good as my regular vacuum but I was happy enough. Here's why I returned it....it kept getting confused and going back to the hub. So it would vacuum one room, get stuck then go home. Or it would only clean a portion of the living room and then go back to the hub. I will give it credit for not falling down my exposed stairs and when it did clean it picked up a lot. For the price though I needed it to work properly not just 20% of the time. Return was fast and easy.

Review_title: I want to love this but too many issues
Product_review: I really want to love this little vacuum but I wish I would have purchased a different model. The first time I used it, it worked great. As I continue to use it, it seems to get worse. It makes more and more random patterns and the lines it leaves are not straight, they are crooked. The bigger issue with this is when it comes in contact with walls; since it does not go in a straight line, it misses sections. Not very good for people with OCD either. It does not do a great job on lower pile carpets. It also will slow down for some objects but for others it will crash right into. It will randomly stop and just start spinning around all confused and then go off in a different direction. Placing it in front of the dock and telling it to go home, it will wander around and then finally decide to go home. This morning it had been charging all night, I went to use it and it wouldn‚Äôt turn on. Placed it back on the dock, it made its little jingle and turned on with 98% battery. I have had this over a month and am unable to return or exchange. I will reach out to the company and see if they have any recommendations!

Review_title: Does exactly what we hoped it would.
Product_review: We ordered this product as an Amazon prime day deal almost reluctantly. Our situation was that we own two cats and a dog and have quite a challenge keeping up with the shedding and dust bunnies. Our upper floor of our split level home is laminate flooring, and this vacuum does great at cleaning up the hair and dust. Seriously, our floors have never been cleaner. I set up a schedule with it, and it runs each night for just over an hour. This unit would not let me integrate it with Alexa, but it still does the job I bought it for faithfully each day. I have not at all used it on carpet yet, so I can't comment on it's carpet performance yet, but we will likely get another one for the lower level eventually. Highly recommend for hardwood or laminate floors.

I should have read other reviews first. Many could not sync with their wifi or had a very hard time. After an hour I had enough and packed it up for return. If you like your sanity fo not buy this product.

I was very excited to find this online one weekend on sale! However once it arrived extremely disappointed that I was unable to get it connected to my wi-fi after watching videos, reaching out to support, and using the directions on the app. I did everything except call my internet provider to change my router settings which is a hassle and I shouldn't have to do. It said it would be easy to use with my Echo which is another reason I bought it but thats not the truth. The suction would've been great but at this price point if it doesn't have a remote and I can't connect it to the app Im not going to continue to bend down to manually hit the button. Even my last robovac had a remote that you could program and it was $99. I would not recommend this vacuum.

This is my first vacuum robot and it works really well, and I'm happy with the purchase. I see no need to schedule it because it's just me here and I plan on using just a few times a week. There are some issues and things you need to know, though. This particular model uses a less functional software app called Mi Home. You cannot map your home and then control areas with it. While it may have an optional mop feature, I don't know how you would tell it which areas to mop and which to vacuum. You need to temporarily get everything off the floor and place things you want it to vacuum under out of the area or out of reach. You might move dining room chairs out of the room temporarily for it to really clean that area well. Loose cords can get wrapped around the brush so you need to tuck those away, too. You can control some things through the app but not everything. It can do the whole home and find the rooms on its own, but I've started putting it in a room and then shutting the door so it only does that room. It will try to go under everything it can. It may leave very light scuff marks on doors and walls as it needs to experience those boundaries to help with its navigation; it can only figure out where to go and what to maneuver around by lightly bumping into it and moving alongside it. I haven't tried to wipe off the scuffs yet because they don't look that bad and I don't want to do it every time. I saw one video where someone temporarily put a piece of cardboard over a part of a wall it didn't want the robot to scuff.

I recently injured my back and sweeping and mopping are now off of my to do list. It used to be one of the chores I didn't like to ignore. There are three adults at home and before anyone gets huffy, we all have physical challenges. Paying someone is an option, but we are not to the point of having daily care. Much less expensive if a robot vacuum will fill in the gaps.

This is my third robot vacuum in 5 years. My first was a Shark that got ruined by running over my dogs diarrhea, yeah thats a funny story. And my second was a Eufy that kept stripping the side brush gears. And now this Rockstar, the Roborock E4! This by far is far superior to both of my previous units. To start, the price was $199 (cheaper then both of the other models). One of my favorite things is that it leaves straight parallel vacuum lines, now my wife thinks I've been running the upright vacuum everyday, lol. Now it doesn't have a mapping system like the higher end models but it does have a laser eye on the front that pretty much works the same way as a mapping system. The battery time is massive at 3hrs! To clean my whole first floor, living room, dining room, kitchen, computer room, bedroom and two bathrooms it takes around two hours. So the battery is perfect. I watched a video about the E4 and it has the exact same suction power, battery run time, dust storage capacity as Roborocks most expensive units at $500. The only difference is the mapping system and wet mopping (which gets bad reviews). All in all, at $199, this vacuum is fantastic and I would HIGHLY recommend it!
I also have a Roomba 600 series for many years and I say it's one of the best things I've bought. How RoboRock e4 compares:

Review_title: No so smart for a smart robovac and extremely loud
Product_review: We purchased it as a replacement for our simple Shark Ion. I was very excited to have a vac with a navigation system and a mop. Oh my, the moment I turned it on I wanted to return. It was so loud even on their ‚Äúsilent‚Äù mode. If you are used to watch movies while robot cleaning the house- forget about it, you won‚Äôt be able to hear anything. The navigation system left much to be desired. Honestly I didn‚Äôt see a huge difference in movement pattern between my ‚Äústupid‚Äù old robovac and this smart one. Another fail is the design of a dust bin. It has so many crevices and corners you won‚Äôt be able to clean it properly. On top of it it stuck on my only carpet in the apartment unable to move through the pile(it‚Äôs a middle length pile). I didn‚Äôt want to try mopping not to get upset even more so I just packed and sent it back the next day. I really wanted to upgrade my old robot but now I don‚Äôt see the point if the differences are minuscule and in some case the new one performs worse.

I have owned several Neato Robotics auto vacuums and liked them but they didn't get in the corners very well and they seemed to have trouble navigating certain areas. They always get stuck under the couch and I had to put magnetic strips to keep it from even going under the couch. I have always had to use my extended warranty on the Neato because they did go wonky on me.

Bought this little guy because it was fairly cheap (around $250) and had great reviews. Well, after I bought it, i was able to get my iRobot 960 to work again so I did some testing of my own. (I'll try and update this with a few pictures I took). I let this vac go first and vacuum up then I would run my Rumba960 and my Rumba would come back with a bin full of stuff that was bigger than the E4. I have a Shiba and he sheds like he is trying to supple the birds of the world with enough hair for a nice cozy winter. The E4 did about as good as the Rumba960 regarding pet hair, where is came up way short was in the dirt. My Rumba been had at least 3 to 4 times more dirt in its bin than the E4. I couldn't notice any difference on the floor (rugs mostly and some tile in the kitchen), but the difference was in the bins. The E4's bin was easy to get out of the vac, but I spilled in on more than one occasion once it was out. It was a lot cleaner, less messy vs the Rumba but the Rumba never spilled it and the bin was a little bit bigger.

Review_title: A robot vac that can handle open concept
Product_review: Here's the situation. I have an open floor plan which appears to mean utter and total confusion for these robot vacs. The last one I had literally got so befuddled, it would just stop in the middle of the room for no reason over and over then would clean the same three foot by three foot area before the front door ten times over while missing entire rooms.

Okay I waited to submit a review until I have had Robuddy (that‚Äôs my pet name for him) for a month. Honestly it has changed my life in a subtle but impactful way in the one month we‚Äôve been together. I use him every day downstairs and a few times a week upstairs.. we have four furry pets including outdoor cats who spend lots of time inside and let‚Äôs just say I don‚Äôt want their tiny hopping bitey friends to overrun the place. Enter Robuddy! But that‚Äôs not how he‚Äôs changed my life that just why I bought him. So he‚Äôs changed my life because it gives me SO much pleasure to look at my clean floors every day. Way more than anticipated. The family (including two teens) helps keep the floors picked up for him and he has inspired me to clean other parts of the house too! I even bought a dustbuster so I can keep the carpeted stairs (ugh) as clean as the rest of the house. And I can get the tiny corners that Robuddy can‚Äôt quite get. He is quite big, like a foot or so in diameter, but so agile for his size - he just goes right under shelving and dressers and cabinets and beds. I have to block him from some under-areas where I keep stuff. heh. Sometimes I just stand and watch him work. The first few days I was distracted nearly the entire two hours he was cleaning and did not consider the time wasted. I mean the way he moves back and forth so neatly and sometimes goes in straight lines alll the way down a hallway and sometimes stops in the middle of the room and changes direction but there‚Äôs some sort of genius method to the madness because he always comes back and gets the spots he missed! So as distracting as he is I always get a little thrill coming home to clean floors with him sitting quietly in his dock. Once the cat knocked over a house plant and there was sooo much dirt on the carpet! I set Robuddy to spot-clean and he did amazing. I didn‚Äôt even feel like I needed to go over his work with a regular vacuum - that thing is going in the trash. Oh and he‚Äôs easy to empty the dustbin which did every day at first but I now do every other day or so. Yes, he‚Äôs my best purchase robot friend who does my work for me.

Review_title: Great vacuum and value for the price.
Product_review: I've been using the vacuum daily for a couple of weeks now and have been very happy. Based on the vacuum app I have about 650-700 sqft. Of tile floor that gets done. The vacuum normally still has 60% power left minimum. Since I have 2 dogs and 2 cats I don't use it for rugged areas because I THINK it would fill quickly. Although at this point I may add a room or 2 with carpeting to the daily routine. I don't really have any issues with the vacuum other than the alexa skill doesn't seem to work well but to me that's not surprising for Alexa.

Review_title: Customization is limited. Cleaning is ok.
Product_review: I have hardwood floors that were just refinished and wanted something to help keep dirt off floors between cleanings.
Easy yo use, fast charging, low noise

Review_title: It does better than just bouncing around
Product_review: What I wish I knew before purchasing: it does not use the Roborock app. You use a different Chinese app that I didn't try after reading all the permissions it required. So I am using this by just pushing the button and letting it go. I wanted something that wouldn't collect hair on the brush. I also thought the mopping feature would be great to have. For comparison, I've owned a Roomba 690 for a few years. This collects less hair than the standard bristle brush Roomba 690 uses, but this E4 still required me to clean the long hair from the brush. The Roomba 690 also bumps into things rather hard, this one is more gentle on the baseboards. The suction is very good. In a room without many obstacles, it cleans in straight lines instead of bouncing from one thing to another like the Roomba 690. It does have trouble mapping out furniture and such. It will miss sections and gets lost, but I have not used the app. The mopping feature is pretty basic. I'm not sure if it's worth the extra price. Overall, it's a good budget unit if you want something that's a step up from the first ping-pong robot vacuums. The Roomba is still hard to beat with its cleaning power however.

Revised review (prior review panned the vacuum): I had posted a 1 star review, complaining that linking the Xiaomi Mi Home app in the Alexa skills menu failed to give me voice control over this device (you set up the vacuum on your iPhone using their Mi Home app). Upon seeing my review, a Xiaomi representative emailed me privately, professionally, politely, to correct my user error. In fact, I had linked to the wrong app! Xiaomi provides a separate Alexa skill called Roborock Home that you must link Alexa to, using your Mi Home logon credentials. Now Alexa does in fact link to this robot! So, apologies to Xiaomi. I want to also point out other reviews I found here complaining that the device cannot be controlled by Alexa--it's not intuitive how to connect it, but once you figure it out the linkage does exist.

I did a great deal of research before settling on the Roborock E4 and this unit is as great as they say. I needed a vacuum to keep up with our two dogs that shed 365 days a year as well as my hair, I shed a lot too. The reviews said the E4 had the best brush to prevent tangling, and they were right. I‚Äôve been using the unit for a month now and haven‚Äôt had to remove anything from the roller. Another pro it is has a large dust bin that can hold the whole hairy mess on the first floor of the house. Finally it is relatively ‚Äúsmart‚Äù. It does ‚Äúmap‚Äù the room so it knows where it has been and where obstacles are, it doesn‚Äôt just bounce around until the power runs out, it actually tracks back and forth so it knows when it‚Äôs finished. It also comes with an app to schedule cleaning, but I haven‚Äôt used it. There is an optional mop system too, but I haven‚Äôt purchased that‚Ä¶still considering. I charge it after every cleaning so it‚Äôs never run down. To clean the first level of our house takes an hour and a half and it does it on one charge. It can also go over the fray of our Asian area rugs without jamming, which was pleasantly unexpected. I highly recommend this vacuum! I only wish I had bought it sooner.

Years ago we had one of the R***ba original robotic vacuums and one of the same company‚Äôs mopping bots, as well. They were great, but after several years, they both failed and the company, having been sold off, hiked prices and, in our experience, lowered quality. We‚Äôve been looking for good replacements ever since. This Roborock is the best we‚Äôve encountered. It simply does what it advertises. the vacuum successfully deals with multiple carpets with fringe and doesn‚Äôt get stuck under furniture. It edge cleans better than any robot vacuum we‚Äôve had, and the mop feature doesn‚Äôt leave trails of water. I wish it had a spray/scrub/squeegee function, because a damp microfiber isn‚Äôt real mopping. However, this does a very good job of keeping up our hardwood kitchen floor and stone bathroom floors between moppings - and that includes dealing with a lot of pet and human hair. It‚Äôs also not as loud as brands we‚Äôve tried/returned and its battery duration between charges is quite good.
Hi, I couldn‚Äôt find a way to reach the seller, I decided to write a review here.

I originally had my doubts and it seemed a little stupid compare to my Eufy before this. But it vacuums much better, learns as it goes, vacuums without missing areas, slows down before it hits things, the battery runs longer and doesn't get pet or long hairs stuck in the brush like the Eufy seriously did. I got a great deal for this when it was on sale at $229, but even if it'd been higher I'd be happy with it,

Review_title: Inexpensive and does the job but not flexible, a bit flawed
Product_review: Cons:
Never connected to WiFi. Robotics sent return label and I am currently waiting for replacement. Will update review once I get new one.

I love how it knows when it's on carpet and increases the vacuum suction and then reduces on hard floors. You can change the vacuum on the app 3 different levels. Very easy to work with. Unlike some robot vacuums this one allows you to scedule as many days a week as you wish. I can't believe they make a robot vacuum that only allows for everyday only.

Review_title: Not near as nice device with lots of caveats lots of them
Product_review: Bought this and only drawback is that it does not seem to have a way to tell it to clean only one room or certain rooms. This makes a house with multi surface floors kinda pointless if you want to mop a tiled kitchen but not mop your carpet. Also had to take off the rubber spinner as it tangles up in the carpet. But its one screw so not huge deal. Had i known about the not able create room borders i would have bought a different one as i want a mop feature to instead of having the extra accessories i paid for just sit there. Remote control joystick has way to long of a delay to use it manually as well.

Review_title: Best bang for the price currently
Product_review: Likes:
Do not buy. I purchased this after reading a ( yes one) from vacuum robot wars that the E4 was the budget S5, it‚Äôs not.

The roborock has surpassed all our expectations. We previously had two roombas, both of which have long been broken. With two cats though, we really need something to run regularly. So far, this product has been absolutely fantastic, even without all the high-tech, fancy gimmicks. It navigates wonderfully, cleans great, and most importantly, is way more affordable than most robot vacuums.

¬†I am so excited about this thing! It does a great job of daily cleaning. It is a task in itself to monitor the robot, but far easier than vacuuming and sweeping. For purposes of my review i have the S4 model and i bought the optional mopping attachment (this was far cheaper than the upgraded models that include a mopping attachment). This was reviewed on a 1600sq ft home (half tile/ half carpet)

Review_title: Not worth it! Do your research and get a better product
Product_review: I‚Äôve had this thing for about 4 months now and I really wanted to like it. I wish I would have done more research and got a better product that actually worked.

¬†The thing I like most about my Roborock E4 is the fact it manipulates and tricks me into picking up and putting away the things left out on my floor. It does this by sending alerts to my phone while I'm at work that I am not going to have a nicely vacuumed home awaiting for me to return because I lacked at putting my s**t away. It also achieves this when I'm home by mesmerizing me with it's abilities to vacuum up all the dirt and debris in a flawless zig-zagged pattern from my vinyl wood floors. In excitement and politeness for it to do it's job, I quickly remove all random objects from my floors that may come across it's path. If I don't, it yells at me in it's deep robovoice to get off my lazy butt and help get it's wheel unstuck from whatever random object that got in it's way.

Review_title: Over all a good product with some worrisome problems
Product_review: This was my first time getting a vacuum robot, so I wanted to get something inexpensive to see if it actually works in my apartment. I was amazed at how much it picked up! Between my roommate and myself, there are 3 cats and 2 dogs, so lots of dirt and hair in the carpet. I am so happy I decided to buy this as a Christmas present for myself.

I can‚Äôt get this to connect to my Alexa to work right at all. I purchased this because I‚Äôm constantly running the sweeper every single day 2-3 times a day. I have two small boys. I wanted to spend less time cleaning/mopping. I wasn‚Äôt aware the mop system had to be purchased separately. I haven‚Äôt purchased it yet to try. I‚Äôm very disappointed in the sweeper itself. The battery doesn‚Äôt last long at all. It takes way too much time as it‚Äôs constantly going over the SAME exact spots. I have to remove it from the dock, put it in my kitchen and start it so it‚Äôll sweep the kitchen. It‚Äôs honestly a pain in the ass when it was suppose to be helpful. I‚Äôd recommend a different brand like Shark (I‚Äôve heard many good things about those).

Review_title: Excellent robot vacuum for the price!
Product_review: I'm in love with this vacuum robot. Excellent price for this item. Runs perfectly between hardwood floors and light carpets. Doesn't work in high pile carpets; the vacuum evades them. Does a great job in corners and tiles. It's not noisy and don't get trap because the sensors helps the vacuum to get out of difficult places. The dust bin is big enough to hold the dust of 2 or 3 cleanings. The filter is washable. The mop option requires to buy the attachment for this function.

Review_title: Cleans well, but has some negatives
Product_review: I got this on a Black Friday special about $100 cheaper than the current price. So I'm happy to keep it, but would not be nearly as happy had I paid full price.

She's not quite Rosie rhe Robot, but there's not much better than having something vaccuum for you! (I usually swiffer mop a room as it's vacuuming another!) I still break out the real vacuum a few times a month to get in the places Roborock can't, but OH MAN, DO I LOVE THIS THING! In turbo mode, it gets everything up, including all that fine, tiny pitbull hair, and the longer kitty hair. I don't think it's as powerful as my upright or my dirt devil stick vac, but it's no big deal, because it just keeps going all around the room and eventually gets 98% of the dust and dirt. I got this brand because my friend got the waaaay more expensive roomba and loved it. I just couldn't justify spending that kind of $, so I started hunting for the best less expensive alternatives. And here we are. Although it doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the other brand, it has everything you need to get the job done. It finds it's way back to the base most of the time, and rarely ever gets stuck (one time out of the 20+ times I've run it). I like that there's a spot-clean option that wil clean in a small area 8f you put it just where you need it. I also like that you can start it cleaning by just touching a button on the unit and do not have to use your phone if it's not handy.

Review_title: Great vacuum for the price - not a random path vacuum
Product_review: Previous vacuum we had was an ecovac. I thought it was the most awesome robot vacuum until we recently got this. We liked this so much that we actually bought a second one for the upstairs instead of having to carry one upstairs/downstairs for cleaning like we did with the ecovac. First cleaning, and the bin was overflowing! Cleaning path is actually uniform as if you were vacuuming yourself, unlike the random path that our previous vacuum did. We run downstairs in the middle of the night every day and each time the dust bin is becoming less and less. Unlike the first cleaning when the bin was literally overflowing! What really sold us on getting a second one was its mapping feature. It actually maps out the area it cleaned and it is accurate! For the price, I did not hesitate on getting another one for the upstairs. Works with Alexa, but I have it on schedule to vacuum downstairs and upstairs when we aren't around. For the price, you can get 2 of these for the price of 1 popular robot vacuum. The dustbin could be easier to clean, but I'm ok doing a follow up vacuum to clean the filter after I empty it out. For the time and convenience and result this little robot provides in keeping our floors clean, I don't mind the extra effort in cleaning the dust bin. Great product, there might be better ones out there but for the price, I would not hesitate getting this one again.

My house is mostly hardwood floors with some rugs and this thing does great on them. I'm still amazed at the amount of dust and dirt it picks up everytime I empty the waste bin. My floors even feel noticeably cleaner on my feet, which is all you could ask for out of one of these things.
I waited to review .

Review_title: Good Robot for cleaning dirt and dust off your floor if mopping is really not what you wanted üëç
Product_review: Edited: Customer is nice and fast response üëçüëçüëçüëçüëç

I bought this one to replace a dead S5 thinking it would do okay. This e4's navigation abilities are terrible compared to the S5. That said, it does as good a job at cleaning as the S5 and with the larger bin, can clean better for longer. Where the e4 really breaks down is in the navigation around obstacles where it can fit under part, but not all, of the obstacle. The sensor at the nose of the robot ends up under a portion of the obstacle, the robot backs up and jams itself under the obstacle, starts to make terrible noises while spinning its wheels, and eventually gives up with an error. If this only happened once per cleaning in might be tolerable, but it gets stuck on half of the furniture in the house. It almost never properly completes a cleaning. Worse yet, when I un-jam it and place it down 6 feet away, it goes right back to the obstacle and gets jammed again.
For starters, this should be better than the Eufy I bought because I bought these about 4 years apart and the technology alone has improved drastically.

Review_title: Do not buy this if you have any high pile rugs or carpet!
Product_review: I wanted to love this vacuum. I bought this mostly for the route planning function. I had a Shark robot vac that would bounce around from wall to wall and it always made me wonder if it was getting every area of the room.
I needed a low-end robot vacuum for my basement. I got this one for less than $200. Didn't have high hope on this one. It certainly doesn't exceed my expectations.

Review_title: Does the work for me- just what I needed!
Product_review: I‚Äôve been using the Roborock for a week now. I didn‚Äôt get the app running yet, because my

Review_title: BUYER BEWARE!! Horrified with this vacuum! Destroyed two expensive wool rugs!!
Product_review: I don‚Äôt even know where to start with this review.

What works: suction is good, will miss some larger flat objects, moves from hardwood floors over throw rugs well, coverage is good, it is actually interesting to watch it work, whatever algorithms they used are very efficient. Picks up dog hair well.

I bought this recently after checking to see if Roborock has an Alexa skill. It does. The problem is the written instructions. In the box, they tell you to download a software MY home that is not Roborock. I went thru the whole process connected it to wifi and then tried to connect it to Alexa. After numerous frustration attempts and not finding the model e4 on the software, I read that the software should be connected to Roborock Plus . Downloaded it got it connected to wifi tried Alexa discovery and manually would not connect. Gave up and returned it the same evening it arrived.

I got this little Jewel of a vacuum during one of Amazon's deal of the day. I only had a couple of hours left to purchase it. So I read as many reviews as I could. So far after having it for about 6 months it's still working great! Sometimes it can't find its way home but you just pick it up and put it in the laundry room and push the button. And I don't know how I live without it with having cats and their cat litter getting everywhere no matter how much you sweep. Just make sure that you empty and clean the filter and cut any strings from the rollers and wheels. If you take care of it it will take care of your floors.

Review_title: 1st Impression, should have got one sooner
Product_review: Out of the box, charged to 30%, but I couldn't wait. Just push the button and it goes.

Review_title: My best friend is a vacuum.
Product_review: I have always wanted a robot vacuum. My husband told me they were a waste of money. So we compromised and we got a robot vacuum. Unless he plans to vacuum every day, I win this argument. Our house is two adults, a 4 year old, and a chocolate lab. We live on acreage and never take our shoes off when we come in the house. Everything is a disaster.

Review_title: Watch out for furniture damage, low mopping function in high traffic areas and failing sensors
Product_review: **Update: Don‚Äôt buy this! Terrible customer service and it lasted only a few weeks!

Review_title: Join the clean floor with minimum effort club
