Product_review: I put off getting a robot vacuum for years, and now realize how silly it was not to jump on the wagon. For the price, this is a great little vacuum, and having clean floors without having to sweep or lug out the vacuum is revolutionary.

This stinks compared to their E25 the previous generation. This one rubs hard against my walls when it turns and has paint on the sides to prove it. My old robot doesn't damage my furniture or walls but this one does. This one also likes to get stuck, going over the same area 10 times, has worse wifi connectivity, has lower speaker/voice quality, and has lower grade mapping. I am unable to view a map of the robot as it is moving, only after it cleans. On the previous generation, I was able to track the robot live. My old robot is 2 years old and works better than this one which is brand new. This is an absolute piece of junk.

Cleans up rooms well and quickly. We had a roomba a few years ago, I like the navigation much better with the e4. The e4 goes in straight lines not random angles like the roomba. You can even do a single room diagonally like you might do your lawn. Also we are very satisfied for the price, but know that the mop function is basically a damp mop which will keep itself wet with a reservoir. If you want a zamboni mop you'll spen alot more $. We are happy with the mop feature!!

Original configuration was a little difficult and tedious, but once configured, this became my best friend. I work 2 jobs, so it's nice to simply pick up cables and let the vacuum go. It cleans well, but I use it multiple times a day sometimes just to make sure things are getting clean. Not much more to say, it cleans my floors nicely. Spot cleaning is nice for getting under benches or chairs, just move them for a couple minutes, spot clean, put them back. Easy.

For the price range this is a great vacuum. I researched these vacuums for weeks trying to decide which one to buy. I would‚Äôve loved to buy a $1100 unit, but let‚Äôs be realistic here, middle class can‚Äôt afford something like that. Anyway, after much internal debate I decided on this guy I named s3xxy Rexxy. So far I have been impressed with the bang for my buck. I have 2 adult boxer dogs and am happy with the performance with pet hair. Does it have all of the bells and whistles of the more expensive models? No, but the suction is great, and it moves in straight lines. Truly that‚Äôs all I need. This unit doesn‚Äôt allow you to map certain rooms and schedule them, that is a feature really would like to have. You can schedule a cleaning, and it will clean everything it has access to, not just a specific area. It does great on both hard floors, carpet, and (non tasseled) rugs. The ability to purchase the separate mop attachment is a bonus as well.

Review_title: Goes right under the bed - goodbye dust bunnies!
Product_review: I have owned this for less than a week, but I love it so much! I have 4 dogs and a cat and they all shed like crazy. I mean CLOUDS of hair. I was losing the battle because I simply did not have the time or inclination to vacuum my entire home top to bottom up to twice a day to keep it under control, but that's fine, because now I have this to do it for me!

Review_title: Mopping function does not work well on floor tiles
Product_review: It has good suction and works well as a vaccum cleaner. Mopping function is ok on hardwood but on ceremic floor tiles, it gets stuck in the middle of the floor with no obstructions. I raised the concern to the customer service, shared videos and got a confirmation that it seems to be skidding on tiles and it won't work. They offered me to return it as it was still withing 30 days of purchase or a $30 refund as a compensation. If mopping is an essential feature you are looking for this is not for you.

Review_title: This won't work if your carpet is not SUPER tight low pile
Product_review: I wanted to like this since the price was pretty reasonable but I think it's almost absurd that it won't actually vacuum carpet. I have very low pile carpet - but there is some pile. In fact, I would not even rate my carpet as being "medium pile" and yet this unit constantly got stuck on it. It's weird. I actually bought 2 - one for upstairs and one for downstairs and they both had the same problem.

Review_title: So good and such nice lines !
Product_review: Love this thing! I bought it a couple of months ago and wanted to write an accurate review so I waited.

I‚Äôve used this 3 days in a row it‚Äôs awesome. I have a tile, hardwood, carpet main floor with 2 young kids. I have made sure to have toys and stuffed picked up before we start it but it transitions seamlessly between floors. It does NOT do good with my 2 area rugs that have fringe and I pick those up now too. It did great with my rug without fringe but longer then today it got stuck on that so I‚Äôll pick that up to probably. It‚Äôs still worth it to just take 2 second to pick those up and have the vacuum run around the house. It leave the prettiest vacuum lines on my carpet and it goes back and forth in lines like advertised. I was amazed at how much dirt and dust I emptied out of the canister. I did use it on my upstairs all carpeted second floor. It did a great job, however it kept going under the beds and if you have anything under them it gets stuck. I don‚Äôt see myself using it upstairs at all, but if you don‚Äôt use storage under the bed then it worked really good in my guest room! Also as I‚Äôm typing this review we are watching a movie, we have the vacuum running and it‚Äôs not horribly loud. It‚Äôs just so nice to turn it on and let it run while we can relax. It‚Äôs still not perfect and it probably does miss spots in my house but I‚Äôm thoroughly satisfied that I got a ‚Äúlower end‚Äù model at a more affordable price point.

¬†So far so good with the Roborock E4. Installing the app and setting it up on my Android phone was easy enough. After it charged to 100%, I let it rip. It does exactly what is in the description. It comes off the dock and runs a straight line across the floor until it bumps into something. then it turns left, moves a few inches and comes back toward the dock. It does this zig zag motion until the entire house is vacuumed. It's logic is good and it doesn't miss many areas that I've noticed. My entire house is hardwood with one very plush area rug in my living room. I knew it wouldn't work but I tried vacuuming the plush rug. It automatically increased its power and suction but took forever to find its way off. Now I roll the rug up and put it on the couch when the Roborock is running. Based on what I saw it will work fine on low or medium pile carpeting. The logic it uses intrigues me. It knows where it left off so once it finishes circling my kitchen island, it continues without a hitch. My house is one story with 2 BDS and 2 BTH. It takes about 90 minutes to run its routine and it automatically returns to the dock. Cleaning the debris collection box is simple. I keep a clean house normally so it mainly picks up dust, cat hair and stray cat litter particles. Don't leaves toys or power cords laying around because they will get caught in the unit. I don't feel it's too noisy as I can talk on the phone while it's running and hear just fine. I'm very happy with this purchase and would recommend to friends.

I was in desperate need of a vacuum that would help manage the dog hair situation in my apartment. I have a German Shepherd mix that sheds like crazy. My old vacuum was a budget purchase that helped, kind of, but never really made a significant impact. I spent a day researching robo-vacs and landed on this one. If you don't need a self-emptying canister, Lidar mapping, or any other bells and whistles, this vacuum is a great option. My floors are finally the level of clean I've been hoping for with a slightly more expensive machine, but not one that breaks the bank. I hope this one lasts a long time, but just to be safe, I also purchased the extended warranty based on prior experiences with other brands. Regardless of the add-on, the price was reasonable considering this little guy will handle 90% of the vacuuming duties all on his own.

Review_title: Leaves black marks on white trim
Product_review: I wanted to love this. In fact, I did love it until I realized that each time it was vacuuming it was leaving black streak marks all over our brand new white floor trim. Our home is less than two months old and I had to go around on my hands and knees and scrub nearly all of our trim. In some areas the scrubbing did not work and I had to paint it. Incredibly frustrated needless to say. What good is a vacuum that cleans your house, only to leave black streaks all over the floorboard. Unfortunately I‚Äôve missed the return window and am now stuck with the vacuum and can‚Äôt use it. I suppose it would be fine if you have dark wood trim. I am Extremely frustrated I spent so much money and can‚Äôt use the vacuum.

Review_title: Give it a chance... fantastic once you figure it out!
Product_review: I have to admit, I'm a little bit embarrassed about how much I love this little bot, which I've nicknamed The Mystery Machine a la Scooby Doo.

This is my 3rd robotic vacuum and by far the best, Had a Roomba, but after a year or so, would just sit there spinning, changed the sensors, then it just spun the other way, trashed it. Next i had a Neato vacuum, much better than the Roomba basically because it had a pattern to vacuum where as the Roomba was all over the place But the batteries died, replaced them, worked for awhile then battery problem again, trashed it. Now this vacuum is way quieter seems to have a plan where to vacuum and does a great job. So far so good.
Love this little robot!

Review_title: We‚Äôll worth the time and money
Product_review: I‚Äôve looked at robotic vacuum cleaners for several years but never could come to spending the money on one. I recently purchased a home that has hardwood floors and travertine tile with only a few rooms with carpet. I decided I didn‚Äôt want to dust mop vacuum nearest much so I found this device during prime day. At first I was leaning towards a rumba but when I looked at the specs on this thing and the price point I didn‚Äôt think I had a whole lot to lose. I paid $199 for it on prime day and it‚Äôs one of the Best Buy‚Äôs I‚Äôve made a long time. Vacuum cleaner Sweeps about 2000 ft.¬≤ of my downstairs in 1 hour and 45 minutes. It really is thorough in it‚Äôs cleaning and I like seeing the vacuum path marks in the carpet. It looks very professional!

4 or 5 stars on the vacuum. I was impressed how it covered all areas, including under beds which are tough for me to hand clean. It's fun to watch. I knew the first vacuuming would fill the dust container, and it was a pleasure to see how much it picked up, including the many tiny pieces of fine-particle dust that are visible on wood floors. The cat is a little cautious but maybe I can train her to sit on it for the ride of her life. ;-) Zero stars to the phone app. It is the WORST app I've ever used, and I'm an advanced computer user who runs a business with many programs and apps. I gave it 2 hours and gave up. The app is not intuitive at all. Even when it tells you to go on to the next step, it hangs, and you have to go back and redo a step. I think this is common in Chinese software. Lord knows how many times the instructions have been translated and re-translated. Chinese hardware can be very good, but the apps are worthless. At least I can push the start vacuum and the home button by hand.

Review_title: This is one of the best purchases I've ever made
Product_review: I'd give this little vacuum cleaner 100 stars if I could! I've been using a stick Dyson for years now, coupled with frequent steam cleanings. (My floors are mostly travertine and hardwood with a few area rugs.) I thought I was doing a decent job. But the first time I used this little gadget the dustbin was filled with cat hair and kitty litter dust. Second and third times too! It seems that the little whip cords that stick out the side of this machine beat dirt and dust out of carpets much more effectively than mere suction will do.

Review_title: Incredible upgrade from Eufy random pattern robot
Product_review: This does a much better job of thoroughly cleaning when compared to a 2018 low priced random pattern robot. It also gets stuck way less often. It cleans where I want it to every day with a minimum of fuss. We have three large area rugs: a cheap low pile ikea rug, a deep shag, and a hand loomed Persian. We also have four furry pets. It keeps all the rugs looking and feeling persentable. I suppose the occasional deep clean would be necessary if we were the kind of people who lolled on rugs but for now the robot is good enough.

I love this vacuum. A friend of mine has the same vacuum but a more expensive model and was raving about it. I was going to buy the expensive model but this one was on sale so I thought I‚Äôd go ahead and try it out. I‚Äôm so glad I did. This little guy has almost all the same functions/power that the more expensive model has. I can program it to clean or can start it using the app. It picks up even the smallest bits of dirt. It‚Äôs easy to use. I do recommend getting the optional mopping system if you have hardwood floors. My only problem with this vacuum is that it can‚Äôt sweep my very high-pile shag rug. But for regular carpet, tile, hardwood, etc. this is perfect ! I love it so much that I‚Äôm going to buy a second one for my upstairs.

We purchased another robot vacuum before this one and after reading some tech site reviews and talking with my sister in law, decided to purchase this and see how it compares. I have to say, I love the suction and how well it cleans. I also love that it maps out the house and I can see where it cleaned. I love that it cleans in straight lines‚Ä¶something I didn‚Äôt think I cared about but did after the previous robot vacuum did not. I will say, make sure you have ALLLLL your items off the floor - cords, toys, etc. It does not discriminate and will suck up everything it can. I also noticed it is not a fan of floor fans and will get stuck on them. However, I love the battery life. Our home is 1411 sq feet and it can clean the whole house on one battery charge. If it does more deep cleaning and runs out of battery before it‚Äôs done, it has no problem finding the docking station to charge and then it resumed cleaning where it left off once it charges to 80%. I would say all around, great purchase and has given me one less thing to worry about every day. I would buy again!!
Update: broke after a week and a half of use. The company won't replace it because I bought it from Amazon instead of directly through them.

I like the fact that I rarely have to vacuum the house. In fact, my floors are cleaner since we got the Roomba than they have been in a long time. We are getting older, 79 and 80 respectively, and this is making my life lots easier (and cleaner.)
¬†Works great! Problem is 10 times tried to get it to hook up to my wi-fi to no avail. See product support couldn‚Äôt even get it to work. Sending back.

¬†This little gal (we named her Rosie, as in The Jetsons) has been a game-changer for us. With 2 dogs, there is hair everywhere. We have a tile floor, with a throw rug. This lil thing cleans it all up. I'm surprised when I open the dirt bin how much hair and dirt it collects! It easily transitions from the rug to tile. It is a bit noisy, but not close to how loud a regular vaccum can be. The app could be much better, but it does the job. Overall, I've never owned a name brand robot vaccum, but why spend that much if this gal does the job?

Review_title: Not what we Needed but Might Work for You
Product_review: I have a 2300 square foot home and this robot wasn't able to clean it effectively. It had a lot of trouble finding the kitchen (only about 20% of the time). Also, it would clean and then re-clean rooms several times, while completely skipping others. It also had a really hard time finding its way back to the charging dock and frequently got stuck under out kitchen table.

Review_title: When it works, it‚Äôs good. Constant connectivity issues.
Product_review: When it works, it works pretty good- the issue is that the connectivity is awful and it constantly disconnects from our WiFi network which nearly makes it useless. I have to reset the connection manually so often (which also isn‚Äôt perfect and takes a few attempts usually). I have a ton of other smart devices in my home that work just fine.

We like this cleaning robot very much. It leaves our floors dust free and it is strong enough to remove even the tiniest cat hair. We just received the mopping system and haven‚Äôt tried yet but I‚Äôm pretty sure it will only enhance the experience. Excellent customer service. I definitively recommend this product to others and will come back for part replacement as needed.

I love this thing! I had a Roomba in the past and wasn‚Äôt impressed with it at all. We paid A LOT for it and it got stuck places, the bristles on the brush broke off, it rarely found it‚Äôs dock on its own, the dust bin was hard to empty, and it was always stranded on the edges of our area rugs. It was just a letdown overall. I missed having a robot vacuum after it died and did a ton of research and landed on the Roborock E4. I love this thing! It has NEVER not found its dock after cleaning, it does a very thorough job of cleaning, even without LIDAR navigation, and the dust bin is large and can last several days without emptying (and I run it multiple times a day). I also like that the dustbin is easy to clean if it gets gross. The machine itself is sturdy and durable. I was hesitant to buy a vac from a company I had never heard of, but I‚Äôm so glad I did. I like this little guy 10x more than my Roomba at a third of the price. Would definitely recommend.

4.5 stars. Great price. Have it running 3-4 days in a row now. Took a little bit to connect to the WiFi but once connected it‚Äôs been great. Set up a schedule. First couple passes picked up a lot of dirt. Filled it up. Just completed this morning‚Äôs route and very little dust now. It got stuck a couple times early on in tight spots that my old robot vac always got stuck on too. It did suck up phone cable this morning but that‚Äôs more my fault for leaving it out. It has been able to find the charging base itself after missing it once early on. The MiHome app is pretty thorough. Shows you the cleaning routes, time in use, sq meters cleaned, battery levels, maintenance schedule for the various parts. Many more options and info than I really need. Main thing is it cleans well. Got it for $200. Not the fancier lidar models but I think it‚Äôs doing quite alright without it and I saved that $300-400.

¬†I am so disappointed. I have waited a long time for this purchase, but it is being returned. It does not have mapping, despite the pictures shown. I can‚Äôt get it to connect to the app for anything. I consider myself tech savvy, so it‚Äôs not user error.

Review_title: Worst robo-vac ever - Buy anything else
Product_review: This is the worst robovac I have ever used. First, their remote "app" is completely worthless...so buy one with a physical remote. Second, it only cleans 12 mins. and then announces it has finished cleaning and docks itself...while the floor still has dirt on it. It has caused me to slam my fist on a table no less than three times...and I just started using it this week!!! I bought this to replace a $100 older model, thinking spending more meant better...WRONG! I'm going back to my old model and selling this piece of junk on virtual marketplace for whatever I can get for it.

Review_title: Love our "Cupcake", even though she's dumb.
Product_review: After our original robot vacuum bit the dust, I searched for a more affordable option and found this item. It shipped quickly and was easy to fire up. "Cupcake", as my 7 year old named her, is awesome. She runs a solid 3 hours over rugs, hardwood, and tile. I foster dogs and for the past week have had 4 in my care. Cupcake kicks butt when it comes to keeping my floors clean of pet hair, dander, dust, and legos from my children's carelessness. The filter is easy to empty and clean out.

I love being able to come home to a freshly sweet carpet every day. It's really cut down on the cat hair and dust in my house. I also love the ability to attach a mop head and let it mop around the hard floors. I usually fill it with HOT water to clean better and clean the cloth a couple times and change out the now-cold water for hot to really get the floor well mopped. Still easier than doing it myself!

Review_title: Not a Smart robot for a Smart home
Product_review: It‚Äôs a decent robo vacuum. I had a roomba, but my Great Dane ruined it. I wanted to try something a less expensive just in case it happened a second time. I really like this little vacuum. It picks up a good amount of dirt and dog hair which is important with two dogs and a toddler. I think I read a review that it was quiet, but I don‚Äôt agree with this. It‚Äôs just as loud and annoying as my roomba was. I‚Äôm giving it such a low score because I cannot get it to connect to WiFi. This is really important to me since sometimes I don‚Äôt have my phone and would like to be able to tell Alexa to send it home, or to be able to start it before I get home. It shouldn‚Äôt be that hard to connect it to WiFi and have the app work. I‚Äôm very disappointed. I would send it back, but I‚Äôve been using it for a week. We just moved and didn‚Äôt have WiFi until two days ago. I‚Äôve reset my phone, deleted the app, turned off the vacuum.. everything. Really need to fix their line up and their app.

I was a bit skeptical about whether this or the Roomba or whatever would really work. I have two dogs and live on a farm, so you can imagine all the dirt that gets tracked in my house. We put down new flooring so I wanted something to help keep things cleaned up. After some research, I decided to give this a try. I am in love with it. I scheduled it to run every day and it finds and cleans every inch of my house that it can physically get to. Even under my bed and couch. It does get stuck under the edge of my dishwasher occasionally, but I block that off every morning so that it can't get under the edge. That really is my only complaint so far. I've been using it for over two weeks and I'm thrilled. I love the app too. Definately worth the money. We have the mopping accesories too. It does make a difference in keeping the floor looking better between my more heaving moppings.

Well this was our second robot vacuum cleaner after the first (cheaper) one really malfunctioned. This Roborock was better, but often got lost, couldn't return to charging base, missed areas, and didn't know which room it was in. I could not deal with this self-proclaimed artificially intelligent cleaner guy too long. As I started to lose my patience, we decided to return it. After returning to self-vacuuming, I have just started looking for a superior robot vacuum cleaner again. My extensive research is leading toward Roborock S6 Max that uses lidar along with artificial eye (camera). It is supposed to be very good.

I had been researching these mobile vacuums for several months and saw this brand that did not rate all that bad.. Then I saw a review on Amazon somebody wrote their mother came over to their house and said that this mobile vac was better than her Rumba.. And I thought well It's probably a planted review but the price was good so I got one. Best decision ever. The suction is fantastic And has accidentally picked up things I thought would have broke it . Picked up hair combs, plastic from a box wrapping and various other things it didn't slow down. I was so impressed. And then I have this ledge between hardwood floor and the kitchen and thought I'll have to pick it up and put it on one side and put it on the other. It's quite amazing it comes up on it and doesn't get over it the 1st time and it spins around and gives it another try and it just keeps spinning until it gets to a place that he can haul itself over it and thick area rugs. I think it puts Rumba to shame. I call him Roco.

It works fine, BUT it doesn‚Äôt work at all with Google Home. If you search online, you will find long forum discussions about this issue! It is very well known and Xiaomi is totally aware of it. But this is still advertised as compatible with Google Home, it is simply not.

We have a long-haired cat and a giant rough collie: hair builds up in the house every single day. And I have asthma...We've never been able to get ahead of it all with regular vacuuming. With Covid, we're no longer having the housekeeper come in, and being older, knew we had to do something. After a good deal of research, we selected the E4, and are so very happy with it. It has amazing suction, goes up onto our thicker living room carpet with ease, has cleaned way under furniture that likely has never been reached w regular cleaning. The house smells so good! The pattern it makes takes a while to trust, but it makes its way back to every inch of every room...and to its charger. We wish the roller brush was a little easier to clean, but have been told there is an upgraded brush available with screw off end caps that will improve that process. It's odd to feel actually kind of fond of this thing: it has made my breathing so much better. It's a good choice and we recommend it.

Review_title: Good vac BUT....Models with mapping and no-go zones much better.
Product_review: While this vacuum does a good job cleaning, I do regret not spending the extra $$ the first time around and getting one with mapping. Setting up the magnetic strips (not included) to keep this E4 from going into and (sometimes) getting stuck in unwanted areas offset the convenience of using a robotic vacuum. I wound up purchasing a Roborock S6 Pure that had mapping, multiple maps, and no-go zones. A much better experience than this E4. This E4 is now relegated to the finished side of the basement where it has no obstacles and is gets around with no problems. Unless you have wide open spaces with no obstacles and no places it can get stuck, spend the extra money. Not Roborock's fault, I just didn't know how much better it would be with a model with the mapping features.

Review_title: E4 model is Alexa ready but hard to set it up
Product_review: Sucking power is very good. Picked up all the dirt and hairs on the floor. Very hard to get the Mi smart home app to find and connect to this model of Robotic vacuum cleaner. After many tries and attempts, I was able to get my cellphone connected to this device. This E4 is not Alexa ready. Alexa skill only recognized Roborock skills that connects to Roborock app, unfortunately doesn't support e4 model. Misleading ad on Amazon. That's why I gave 3 stars instead of 5.

I bought the vacuum along with the accessory mop feature. The vacuum is pretty good but don't have any wires lying around or its liable to drag them with it. maintenance seems pretty easy too. If you have dark surfaces it will crash into them at full speed. Anything sitting just a bit over its operable height will scratch the top of the robot and may damage whatever it ran into.

Review_title: Horrible customer service and horrible vacuum that won‚Äôt last 10 months.
Product_review: Absolutely worst product you can possibly buy. The vacuum doesn‚Äôt even last a year. Mine started having an issue at 10 months. It stopped going over tiny little surfaces between my kitchen and living room so I called support and for weeks they sent me through a loop. First they wanted a video which was reasonable so I did that. Then they didn‚Äôt believe me on my measurement of the surface and said it was over an inch so I sent them a picture to show them it was only .4 inches. Then they told me to clean the wheels which I do already so I did and then that whatever I use to clean the surface was causing it. Funny I used the same thing to clean the surface which is just vinegar for the first 8 months and it didn‚Äôt have an issue. After that they wouldn‚Äôt contact me back. I called customer service probably 4 times to ask for a supervisor and they told me they would call me the next day. It‚Äôs been 2 months and still no one has contacted me. They told me to contact via email to get a supervisor so I did probably 6 more times with no avail. They have the absolute worst and rudest customer service of any company I have ever dealt with. My product was still right at the 1 year warranty and they lead me along to lead me out of the warranty period. BEWARE, DO NOT buy anything from this customer. Vacuum is trash and customer service is ever worse. Do yourself a favor and buy a shark or Roomba. It‚Äôs worth the extra money. Hope this helps!

Review_title: So far, so good 2,200 square foot house and 5 pets...
Product_review: I have a Husky, Malamute and 3 medium hair cats, and live in dusty AZ., this little machine is a godsend!! Haven't tried the mop yet, still replacing some carpet with hardwood, and read the reviews on how it doesn't recognize differences between the two. It does know the difference between various types of rugs and flooring. Currently I have tile, harwood and minor carpet, and rugs. Pics of cats are from different house, but so you can see their fur. Still have to clean under some area due to vacuum height, but talk about time saving as a whole !!!

Review_title: Best Overall Bang for Your Buck
Product_review: I didn't want to spend a whole lot of money on a robot vacuum, especially since I'd never owned one before and was skeptical of how well it would perform. This product blew me away! I named it Alfred and it picks up most of the dog hair, dirt, grass, and occasional cord hanging from the wall. I can't believe I've waited so long to get one. It doesn't fall off my step down into the bathroom, and it goes right over the high threshold I have in my home (my home is rented and the floors are warped to where it has a gradient, which is weird at the thresholds but Alfred doesn't flinch. I wanna get the mop extension so i don't have to sweep or mop.

Review_title: Meh Navigation and Security Risk Surprise!
Product_review: Missed part of the living room altogether. Path was a little more random than I would have liked... definitely not the long, square lawnmower rows advertised. Does a great job of actually vacuuming. But a random-path is a lot less expensive and just isn‚Äôt that much worse in terms of coverage. Well, actually, my random path vac does cover the whole room, so that‚Äôs one better than this vac did.

This is my third robot vacuum. Started off with a Deebot, which really didn‚Äôt get the job done. Then went with the irobot 960, which couldn‚Äôt finish cleaning my main floor (hardwoods) on either one charge or without requiring the dust bin to be emptied.

Review_title: Does a great job vacuuming a complex floorplan with furniture
Product_review: The Roborock E4 Robot Vacuum Cleaner, Internal Route Plan with 2000Pa Strong Suction, 200min Runtime does a good job navigating and vacuuming a complex floorplan with furniture. It transitions between ceramic floors, wood floors and carpet with no problems. I have an old Kenmore upright vacuum that indicates the amount of dirt it picks up and after running the Roborock E4 on carpet, I followed up with the old Kenmore Vac and it showed no dirt left behind. The noise level fluctuates from moderate sound on carpet (from higher vacuum rates) to almost a whisper on hardwood floors and ceramic tile. I like that it maps the floor and vacuums with 6 inch overlap. It follows up by vacuuming the edges. It finishes by heading back to the docking station.

Review_title: WON‚ÄôT WORK ON MEDIUM DENSITY CARPET!
Product_review: WILL NOT WORK ON CARPET unless the carpet is very low. I‚Äôve included a pic of my medium plush carpet for example.

We have had this little robot four months. We chose it for its ability to clean dog hair, which we have in excess, and it does ok at that. However, overall it is disappointing. Its navigation seems to depend on bonking into the walls so all of the white baseboard are scuffed now. More disappointing, it can‚Äôt navigate between rooms of it doesn‚Äôt accidentally find the door. It‚Äôs a pinball robot - bouncing from one obstacle to another.

Review_title: Does a fairly good job of cleaning
Product_review: Seems to do a descent job of cleaning for a relatively inexpensive unit. I have two old Roombas that are probably 10 years old and this cleans about the same (maybe a little better) and I do like that when it goes over a carpet the suction increases. I miss the virtual walls that the Roomba has to block off areas that do not have doors. The more expensive model has virtual walls that you can add to the programmed room map. This one does not have a map that you can see on your phone. It does connect with Wi-Fi and you can establish a cleaning program and can see its charge status and when it is docked on your phone. It may do more but that is all I have used. I went with this vacuum because of its low cost compared to others with the features I wanted.

6 month update: Pathfinding has gotten progressively worse. I've cleaned all the sensors but it it has started to run into larger and larger objects, push light objects like shoes on the floor around, scrape walls while turning, and it has begun to wedge itself under objects. It has opened my fridge several times and has repeatedly gotten stuck under a cart that has maybe a millimeter of clearance from exactly the right approach angle.

Review_title: I can‚Äôt imagine our home without it!
Product_review: Hands down, this vacuum has been a life saver. Our house is 4 floors and 3000sq feet- all hardwood and many area rugs, which means I spend way too much time vacuuming...

Review_title: Not the best robot vacuum on the market
Product_review: This vacuum says it‚Äôs good for larger homes but it always died after vacuuming half of my house. It did not map my house at all! I noticed it only would clean half of my living room, my dining room and half of my breakfast area. I had to carry the vacuum around so it would get in and out of the rooms.
I just got this today AFTER I purchased another, cheaper robotic vacuum on Amazon. This one is instantly better! Why?

I think the E4 is a good value. My only con with it is that the agitator brush doesn't like carpet. My carpets pretty crappy though. Maybe a nicer denser carpet would work better. The brush feels a lot of resistance on mine and is usually not spinning. It seems to pick up about 95% of dirt on the hard floors or smooth carpet, and about 75% on my crappy carpet. It won't replace my dyson, but does do a great job of keeping the floors looking clean between weekly dyson vacuumings. Oh and on carpet, the power is on full, so it's noticeably louder. Ours is set to run daily at 9pm after kids are in bed and things are picked up. We live in a ranch so it does the whole house minus the bedrooms at night. You will know when it's near your door

Review_title: Mapping and mopping could be improved
Product_review: See the photo. The circled area is a hallway from one room to another but robot got confused on a way back and mapped it as 2 separate hallways. I think it would improve cleaning if robot could map the perimeter first and then clean the inside of it. It also would be nice to see the line trajectory inside of the mapped area as well as real time mapping while robot is cleaning. Mopping water flow is not controlled through app, also see the picture it only snaps on one side only and I can see it break quick when it tries to climb things over and over
Pros:

I liked that this robot vacuum talked and was easy to operate with a button. I didn‚Äôt like that it constantly (every 10 minutes) stopped and asked that an obstacle be removed, despite the fact there was no obstacle. It did this over and over on my carpeted floors. A push of the button had it on its way again for about 10 more minutes. Since there is no remote control, it could not be left alone and you constantly restarted it. Not worth it! It had a strange pattern for cleaning and was slow and would not get to certain areas. We returned it and exchanged it for another identical vacuum, thinking we just got a lemon. The new one did the exact same thing. It was also returned.

Review_title: Half the price and actually better than my Roomba
Product_review: For a third of the price, I am far more impressed with this vacuum than my old roomba. It runs longer than my roomba and it gives my carpet straight up and down lines. The suction is obviously strong as it picks up everything. I actually bought this brand by accident-I came to Amazon to try the eufy but accidentally clicked the roborock. When it came I was initially going to return it for the other but thought I‚Äôd give it a test run. Absolutely love it. I run it every single day and it only got ‚Äúlost‚Äù once. My roomba was always getting lost and getting stuck under my kitchen cabinets. It does have an app to control it from your phone but I haven‚Äôt downloaded that yet.

Review_title: Should have bought one years ago!
Product_review: I have not yet tried the mopping function - so I can't comment on that.

This dude is a game changer. First off - I have 3 dogs - Let me be more specific - I have 3 Australian Shepherds - so the dog hair is REAL here. I watched a ton of YouTube reviews on different robot vacuums and was really impressed by the review from VacuumWars on this specific model and for this price I decided why not try. It has not disappointed let me tell you. The suction power is great, it‚Äôs very smart and gets every corner of the house and always manages to find its way back to the dock. I did have some problems with the app - but I didn‚Äôt buy it for the app - I can do everything I need to from the robot itself. It‚Äôs super easy to empty the trash bin, and parts to replace are affordable. I highly recommend everything about this!

This has been, by far, one of the best purchases I have made. I have bought several of these for friends and family. You do not know what you're missing out on until you buy one of these robots. If I could give it 10 stars, I would!

Review_title: Repeated errors, does not work properly at all esp. for mopping
Product_review: I tried this in my kitchen only, since it's a small space and I wanted to get a good look at what this could do. I guess the sweeping part was fine, but when it came to mopping, the thing keeps stopping and telling me "Error 8, please remove all objects." Well, the thing is in the middle of the floor with nothing around it so it's clearly malfunctioning.

Review_title: I DONT' RECOMMEND IF YOU HAVE A LONG-HAIRED DOG
Product_review: The vacuum works, but with a German Shepard and cats - the robot doesn't suck up all the hair and the suction starts to suck after a month. I have to dissemble it and clean it out almost daily because the hair gets trapped in the spinner, in the cracks of the vacuum, and also in the wheels. I love the idea of a smart vacuum but when i have to go over the floor with my normal vacuum, it defeats the purpose of having one. Also, I don't use the vacuum on carpet - just tile--- and it leaves clumps of dog hair behind because it didn't suck it up --- the pocket is pretty small too, i empty it once or twice a day because it gets "clogged", My floor isn't even dirty , its just to help suck up dog hair.

Review_title: It just works, and works well.
Product_review: This vac replaced a Neato LIDAR unit that served us well for years but was just not picking up all the sand anymore. Despite lacking the LIDAR capability, it is like a blind man with a very good memory. It logically. and efficiently cleans the entire house-all 2000+ sq ft on a single charge. The low profile allows it to clean under furniture and it will calculate a pattern that provides for the brush to clean along all walls. To be clear, our house is all hard flooring so we cannot comment on how the unit cleans carpet, but after cleaning we can feel no sand or dirt. You will need a smart phone and home wifi network to access settings for the vacuum (many settings, such as vacuum power level, cannot be changed without using the app). With the coupon, at $200 it is hard to beat.

Wanted to love this robot vac based on reviews and research, but for me it‚Äôs not hitting the mark. As for positives, there is a good amount of information provided on the app and the dust bin is pretty large. Other than that, I don‚Äôt love it.

The only negative I have to say about this product is setting it up with Alexa is not easy. I gave up on that and strictly use the app. Other than that, it does what it is intended to do. The bad reviews, in my opinion, have unrealistic expectations of a robovac. These are not designed to replace mopping and sweeping. I use this to keep tidy between cleanings. I don‚Äôt expect this to do my deep cleaning for me. This keeps me from having to daily sweep dog hair and wipe muddy dog prints. I‚Äôm ok with that.

Roborock went above and beyond to correct this mistake for me , I am truly grateful. They reached out to me directly to make sure that I was able to purchase new equipment and even provided a discount. I tried out the new vacuum today and its amazing, really great vacuum.

The app is absolute garbage. I spent an hour trying to get it connected. Ran through all of the troubleshooting scenarios online and still nothing. Reset the router, disabled all but 2.4ghz, and still nothing. I guess if you're willing to use nearly zero security on your home router this might work, but if you're buying a smart device you expect it to be smart. It's simply not the case. I'm returning this ASAP to buy an iRobot device. I know they work with normal WiFi configurations. The instructions also look like they were written by typing the words into Google translate and hoping for the best. They're close, but not quite there. Shockingly bad all around.

I‚Äôve had this product for a few days now and have had it run every day. Whenever it gets to 20% battery and tried to go home, it never gets there. It seems to almost retrace it‚Äôs steps and always dies before it can get home. The suction is good and I am happy with the results of the vacuum. But I am not pleased with the fact that it will not make it home so I have to bring it home myself every time to charge. It thinks that dying is the end of the cleaning so it does not go back out once it has fully charged. It has cleaned the same few rooms over and over as it never truly finishes the cleaning. Will be returning and finding a different vacuum
¬†This is the first robot vacuum I‚Äôve owned - the reviews always scared me away. I was intrigued by the house mapping and simplicity while maintaining good reviews.

Bought an iRobot in 2017, loved it. Found this beauty to replace the worn out iRobot. Found this on a review of good robot vacuums for dog hair. It does some hair removal from carpet, but not much. Otherwise, on tile and hardwood it gets up most of the hair, though very slowly. It will go home and charge if it has not finished running its job for the day, but it charges for many hours before resuming. We have a 2,100 square foot house. The cleaning starts at 8:30 AM, pauses for charging and then resumes at around 6 PM. If you thought this would take care of the sweeping while you were at work, you are mistaken.

Review_title: I love the robo rock, life saver with a baby who eats everything on the floor.
Product_review: The robo rock works great, it picks up all the small stuff, addresses corners and furniture really well. It also lets me know when it is time for cleaning the brushes... I just cut the hairs that are stuck with a scissors and it takes no more than 5 minutes. It also works great with Alexa. I take the dust out of the vacuum once every week and it is always full so that shows it is really picking up the dirt. I have a baby so really like the fact that it goes under the bed and furniture so I don‚Äôt have to move them.

¬†Oh my goodness, this is the first one I have ever owned and I am an absolute believer. It‚Äôs very methodical in the way that it cleans and I absolutely love the app where I can see a floor plan of where it has cleaned, I can control it from the app, I can set up dates and times when it can automatically start cleaning, and you get notifications about any issues‚Ä¶ I just can‚Äôt say enough good about it. I‚Äôm not somebody who vacuumed my house that often because it seemedclean but now that I‚Äôve been running this every other day I can‚Äôt believe how dirty things are (and were) when you have two cats in the home. Works great on carpet, laminate, and vinyl flooring. One other funny little benefits of this vacuum is it helps me keep my house more clean because I really want it to be able to run while I‚Äôm in my office working or busy doing other things. Love love love. Buy this. I want two!!!

Review_title: OK already -  MAKE SURE PASSWORDS IS .! It‚Äôs now working - It‚Äôs great!!!
Product_review: Iphone, Samsung Galaxy S8., both unable to use any WFI control. I contacted customer service a d had a vert well spoken pleasant person but the APP Mi Home simply doesn‚Äôt connect the phones and vacuum cleaner.

Wow! I do not know what I did without this! Works great over the carpet and hardwood floors. It sure is a time saver and helper. I don't have it connected to wifi so whenever I want to use it, I press the button and there are no problems. It has gotten stuck a few times but I just move it and it goes on its way.

I have arthritis and a bad back so, even though I have an excellent vaccum, it is hard to use it. I really did not have high expectations but because of the price, thought I would give it a try. I have hardwood and carpet and two dogs who shed soooo much. I didn‚Äôt know how to map the house but didn‚Äôt need to. I charged Sam (that‚Äôs his name) and sent him on his way. I followed him the first time. He vacuumed the whole house and went room to room ,under the bed, the dresser and night stands, and over throw rugs. I emptied him twice, it was full of dog hair. Now I just let him go. I highly recommend this vaccum.

We had owned a Rumba about ten years ago and weren‚Äôt that impressed with it, but decided to try again given the newer technology. We have been nothing but thrilled with our Roborock E4. At first it felt intimidating to set it up with our phones, but we soon got everything connected and ‚ÄúOur Maid‚Äù began cleaning. She follows a back and forth pattern and easily transitions from our hard woods to our carpet. The app allows you to set your suction and noise preference. She cleans VERY well. We also purchased the mop extension and it‚Äôs good for a quick clean, but would need to be changed out or cleaned frequently for deep mopping. Basically there is just a wet pad that attaches to the back side of the vacuum so it drag mops as the vacuum is cleaning. So far the vacuum has been great for dog hair too and the app will tell you when the cartridge is full. We highly recommend this vacuum!

Review_title: Best value/money cleaning robot as of May 2020; why buy top of the line? this one does it all!
Product_review: After doing some research online, I ended up choosing this model (Roborock E4). I mostly looked into Roborock and Roomba robots, and this one was by far the best bang for buck (as of May 2020; paid approximately $260, since there was some promotion due to this being a recent launch). Have been using it for a few days now, and am super happy with it. The navigation capacity works really well, even though the sensor suite isn't as powerful as compared to some of the more expensive models. Even when I leave it cleaning a separate floor (in which case it obviously cannot find the dock), it does a great job returning to the initial position. I'm super happy with this purchase. Congrats to the manufacturer for creating such an awesome product. Cleaning carpets no more!! :)

Review_title: It does better than even I expected!
Product_review: I have three Shetland Sheepdogs and a border collie/papillon mix puppy. As you can imagine, our house is overrun by fur! It has been frustrating that even though I vacuum frequently I could never seem to keep ahead of the fur! Even my Dyson Animal would not take care of it!

I chose this product because I had 3 co workers that have the same model and swear by it. They were so excited by it I was finally convinced to pull the trigger on a robot vacuum. The only thing that's upsetting is that I waited this long! I can't believe the amount of crap this thing picks up. We live in the country and have 3 dogs and 2 kids. So far no problems and it just goes about its business and helps me keep our floors clean (we don't have any carpet in the house) Very easy to use, I got it on sale and highly recommend!
I got this as a gift for my Mom for Christmas this past year, she seems to love it!

After setting up the roborock cleaner, which took a few hours, we charged it overnight and then tried to clean. The robobot just went back and forth a few inches, turned around and did the same thing again. It also could not find the dock after tellig it to go back to the dock. I definitely would not recommend this product. Buy a brand name!!

Review_title: Close to perfection, but no cigar
Product_review: There is a lot that I love about this robot vacuum, but also so much that could be improved and that is disappointing.

Review_title: It Works On My Open Floor Plan Home!
Product_review: I absolutely LOVE this vacuum. I had a Roomba, but even with the annoying battery-draining towers, it got confused and was more trouble than it was worth in my large home with open floor plan. Then it died. I was hesitant to buy another robot vacuum, but at this price point and in the hopes that technology has improved, I decided to give it a shot. Wow! My house has never been this clean. I have 3 dogs (one has long hair), two kids, and a husband who can not be trained to take his shoes off, so there‚Äôs always bits of fur and dirt being tracked everywhere and it just looks terrible unless I vacuum every day, and that‚Äôs just not realistic. This vacuum does fantastic on the hardwood floors (all of the main living areas are hardwood with a few area rugs). It does pretty well on the shorter-pile area rugs (it got tangled in my one high-pile area rug, so I just move it). I let it run every day, and it keeps everything tidy, even down the hall and into the mud room, and into the bedrooms if I leave the doors open. Even if I don‚Äôt let it in the bedrooms, those rugs are kept cleaner because we aren‚Äôt tracking stuff from the main part of the house into them. It finds the dock when it‚Äôs low on battery and then comes back out again to finish. It‚Äôs a little loud, but I‚Äôm getting used to hearing it in the background. I just put some music on so I can‚Äôt hear it. I never intended it to replace my normal vacuuming, just to keep things looking tidy in between. I actually don‚Äôt think I need to vacuum the hardwood floors at all anymore. It gets under and behind furniture and probably does a better job than I did anyway. I may get the attachment for the moping feature some day. The rugs will still need a proper vacuuming to get the deep dirt out, though the dust bin shows that it certainly is getting some of the deeper stuff out. I highly recommend this vacuum!

Review_title: I‚Äôm in love with you sweet gadget
Product_review: Where have you been all my life sweet gadget! I finally gave into the hype and bought one of these when I was frustrated with my dirty floors during FTS o‚Äôclock. I‚Äôm so happy I did! It‚Äôs like a lovable family pet that cleans. If you have any tile or wood floors DO NOT buy this without the mop feature. It‚Äôs my favorite part!

Review_title: Great for large homes and pet fur!
Product_review: I was always skeptical about robot vacuums and never thought they would get a "good cleaning"... I was wrong. I am highly impressed on the suction of this vacuum. Attached photos it got 200 minutes before battery got to 10% as it was returning itself to docking and 178 sq. Meters which is equivalent to 1,900 sq feet. And who doesn't love vacuum lines?!? I havent used the mop feature yet, I just received this 3 days ago.

Review_title: cleans well on concrete floors and rugs.
Product_review: So far this vacuum is doing a great job picking up dust, which is why I got it and it does a good job cleaning the small area rug that we have as well as the cat's litter mat. It gets under the bed which I was unable to do before. It seems to go over at least some areas, more than once so it is very thorough. When it finishes doing the floors, it goes back and does the edges of each room which is nice. We have stained concrete floors and live in the desert so this vacuum is a great help with the dust which will help with our allergies. I saw it on Amazon when it was on a special sale so I got a great price on it. I couldn't afford the 700 and 800 dollar price tag on other vacuums. I don't use the app that you can get with this. I just push the start button and it says "starting cleaning" and away it goes.

Review_title: I haven't swept in a month!
Product_review: We have had this about a month now. I LOVE it! For the price I think it is totally worth it. I have 2 dogs and live in the desert my floor constantly has dog hair and dust. Not to mention the two small kids.

Review_title: Would recommend especially if you have dogs
Product_review: This vacuum is well worth the money! I bought it May 16, 2020 and have been more than pleased! I have 4 dogs that shed a lot and trying to keep up with the hair seemed almost impossible. It is set up to run once every day and when I get home the dust bin is always full. Today I ran my actual vacuum for the first time in 2 weeks and the canister was about half full, so it‚Äôs picking up the majority of the hair. It doesn‚Äôt just randomly drive around like the cheaper robot vacuums do it maps your house to a certain extent. It gets everywhere but usually goes over the house 2-3 times, which I don‚Äôt mind. I use to come home to dust bunnies along the hardwood floors but now it‚Äôs very clean thanks to the roborock.

Review_title: Decent Vacuum when it works properly
Product_review: I got this about a month ago. At first it was fantastic, and really did a great job, however, after some time, now it starts to have all sorts of issues, it gets lost, it decides its "done" half way through cleaning despite having plenty of charge and I just had to order a package of replacement parts (filters, brush etc.) as the ones it came with didn't seem to last too long, just a few weeks of occasional use. i don't even have any pets, just regular household dust. It was great at first, but I don't think it will last too much longer. It's very expensive for a vacuum that has such a short lifespan. This is my first robot vac and it was so highly rated and on sale so I tried it...probably i made a mistake, I'll try to update this review at some point.

I do really like this vacuum. It runs for a long time and doesn't have trouble navigating the house. We have 3 dogs, 3 cats, AND a toddler and it picks up every hair and crumb! The directions were easy to follow, although it mentioned putting down the moisture pad for hard floors, that wasn't included with mine. There also was no remote, extra parts, or the mopping attachment, but I'm not sure if those were supposed to be included. Overall, this little robot is a serious trooper! I love that it talks to you as well and the timers are consistent and easy to set. I definitely recommend this to anyone who has a house that needs to be swept/vacuumed 3x a day. Save your back and buy this robot vacuum.

The E4 robovac has good suction and does a good job of covering the area it sweeps and then going back along the walls to get the edges of the swept area. HOWEVER, it will not sync with a Moto E5 Play android phone no matter what I do. In Bluetooth mode the phone does not see the E5 what so ever and, if I force the E4 to connect by brute force, it says "connected but no internet" even though the phone connects via wifi to the internet with no problem. The bottom line: the E4 works manually and does a reasonable job of cleaning the floor and exploring for rooms to clean but it "sucks" (pardon the pun) when it comes to connecting with an android phone which has been noted in other reviews.

Review_title: One of the best purchases I have made! Great with pet hair!!
Product_review: This robot vacuum is AMAZING!!! ü§© So VERY helpful with decreasing the amount of hair and dirt on my floors. I have 2 cats (1 long hair and 1 short hair) and 1 Alaskan Malamute large dog that requires continuous grooming as he sheds hair like there is no tomorrow. As expected, I still have to dust and get the deep corners and under furniture but it prevents me from having to vacuum every day. You can also schedule it to vacuum while you sleep, so you wake up to less hair! I have rugs and hardwood floor, it gets it all and adjusts its suction to what floor it is on. One of the best purchases I have made!

Review_title: I would get the next version up
Product_review: So I have this as my second vacuum, and I have the V6 model for home
Update: this thing is garbage. Misses spots everywhere, random cleaning patterns and DAMAGES MY HOUSE!

Review_title: Great for a budget robot vacuum! Definitely recommend!
Product_review: This is my first day using this vacuum. But it picked up about 80% of the debris on my floor. My floors were nasty, so I‚Äôm not surprised that some stuff was left behind. But I know that if I run this every day, that my floors will be perfect. It made its way around my whole house on its own, and never went to the same spot twice. It was very thorough in making sure it got everywhere possible. This was all without the app, because I couldn‚Äôt get it to connect to the WiFi. But I only run it when I‚Äôm home since I have a large dog and two cats who all like to pee on the floor, so this doesn‚Äôt bother me. I just turn it on and go about my day. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a budget robot vacuum. Definitely lives up to the good reviews.

If you have kids and pets and have the means to splurge on this, absolutely do it. I have a cat and a toddler with another baby on the way and this is a sanity saver for my husband and I. This little engine that could is impressive with it's cleaning skills and my cleaning standards are quite high. I have watched it several times to see if it would miss areas, especially as it manuevers around furniture, etc, and it has yet to miss a single spot. Just make sure you move cords, pick up toys, etc before you start it. The suction is powerful and this little overachiever will find things you didn't know were there....like items put behind your couch by your toddler.
Update, the robot still cleans but I noticed the damage it is causing to the wall skirting and it started to bang against the furniture, not worth the money.
Old model without good mapping software

I thought robot vacuums were a waste of money. Then I bought the Deebot 500 because it was super cheap. I was surprised by how well it worked, but I needed something SMARTER. So, I returned it, did my research, and spent the extra $100 on the Roborock E4. I was not disappointed. This is the only robot I found under $450 that goes in a straight line Z pattern instead of bouncing around wildly, changes suction power when it comes onto carpet, and remembers where it left off if it has to recharge in the middle of the cleaning job.

Review_title: Great purchase on Amazon Deal of the Day!!
Product_review: I have a blind husband and four cats, so I was always worried about getting one of these and having something get sucked in that shouldn't be. I don't know how, but that doesn't happen. He (we named him Vic the Vacuum) can go over the cords that are under my adjustable bed with no issues. He even vacuums the base of the cat towers. I have a 2,700 square foot home and he did almost the whole house in one charge. Also, the cats stay out of the way but aren't scared of it like the are the big noisy push vacuum.

Review_title: Big suctions and better than my expectation
Product_review: We were very skeptical at first, since it was on sale and I decided to give it a try. first time after we ran one cycle, we were so shocked at how much dust it was in the bin, I consider myself very clean, I vacuumed everyday and we never wear shoes inside the house, but this machine cleans so much dust under the sofa and bed, somewhere that my vacuum was hard to reach unless I move the furnitures out which is impossible thing to do. Noise is not as bad as I thought, now I ran this machine once a day and I only need to do touch up with my vacuum once a while, my house is definitely cleaner(I can tell by the water cleanness when I mop the floor). Extremely happy with the investment, the only thing I will do on my next machine is to buy with lidar function, it will help to clean the house faster. But again with under $200, I am very satisfied with the purchase!

We've had this for a month now. We live with 3 cats in a 2 bedroom apartment. They all shed and track litter everywhere, but we only have had to run it daily for our floors and carpet to always look guest-ready. For a quick top to bottom maintenance cleaning, it's nice to be able to quickly dust off surfaces before the vacuum runs, knowing it'll take care of any debris on the floor. Just be careful not to leave any cat toys, clothes or other items which can get tangled in the brushroll (some cord loops are among them). Also check for wet spots before its scheduled cleaning. I like how it learns the layout of the rooms after a few days and cleans in an organized manner. An hour of cleaning only uses up 25% of its battery, and it does the job well. This is one of the best investments we've ever made, and fellow pet owners wouldn't regret buying it!
I purchased this primarily to vacuum under the bed and the whole house. It suppposly has 200 minutes run time.

Love it. Been resistant to try one of these. Just not convinced over the years, but I‚Äôm a believer now. I still can‚Äôt connect to WiFi, But my service kind of sucks. So I can‚Äôt blame the machine. But it runs easily and methodically with push of the button. The bin is large and can do my whole floor area. Even with 2 large dogs and 2 cats indoors it has no problem. I have to raise my rugs and I run it at night. Rugs bog it down and I‚Äôm not sure if that would drain the power. My rugs are easy to shake outside anyways.

Overall - this little thing is pretty good. I‚Äôve used it for about 120 minutes and it has been quite the champ. The dust bin is a good size, the water tank - however - is this flat little structure that is hard to fumble with. That flat tank with a nice wide pad is a short fall. Generally, I am pleased with the product - but the one let down - see pic - is an app that is not only vague, but in Chinese. After restarts and reloads - no progress. Ordered a replacement and maybe that would help. When it works - it works well. This little issue, however, is a major impact.

Review_title: Very effective with dog hair.  Mopping is decent.
Product_review: Absolutely the best purchase I have made in the last several years. We have two kids and a Golden Retriever who sheds incessantly. We have laminate floors and carpet, and this does a great job for both. The navigation is fairly effective and we never notice missed spots. It picks up ALL the dog fur and dirt/grass/small yard debris, leaving the laminate floors a pleasure to walk on barefoot. It finishes with a pass around the perimeter, which is 99.8% effective. Of course because of its round shape, it won't get all the dust in the very corners, but the suction is strong enough to pull all the dog fur out of the corners, leaving next to nothing.

I‚Äôve been on the fence about buying a robot vacuum for a year now. I researched models and never pulled the trigger because of the high cost on the advanced models, and not wanting to get a cheaper one only to discover it needed the more advanced features. Well, this went on sale for $200 and I bought it. It‚Äôs not fast and efficient like some more expensive models claim to be, but it gets the job done! We turn it on when we take our toddler upstairs for bed, and it goes about its business. It bumps its way back and forth across our floor. Speed doesn‚Äôt matter to me. Having a clean hardwood floor despite a toddler, a dog and a cat is well worth it.

Review_title: Good starter vacuum if not better
Product_review: This unit has been gold for me. I live in a 1100 square foot condo with basically 4 rooms, mostly carpet. I can run it twice a day because I can. It covers most areas. Or I just lock it into 1 room. The suction power is great. Yes, I will have to vacuum certain areas at times. Emailed support over missing remote, which the unit does not come with. They emailed me right back with the download smart phone app. I am disappointed will some of the bad reviews on this vacuum. Not seeing it. Maybe some of the bad reviews are just as fake as some of the good reviews. If you are looking for a vacuum to help out during the week it is well worth the money if your home is set up for it. Now if we can get a dusting drone, I will be set.

This is my second Roborock vacuum. Both of them have had longevity issues. After a year, it would get an error every time it started, even with regular maintenance, it eventually quit working. It would almost get stuck on the base, turn a couple loops and quit. BOTH of my roborocks did the same thing! I'm done. I ordered the new roomba and so far, it's fantastic.

Review_title: Suction is great, vacs very well, but AI is awful
Product_review: I bought this for my parents for Christmas, and they loved it...because they never had had one before. I had had another of the XiaoMi (previous to being branded RoboRock) and loved it, so when this one kept missing complete sections of the house, or getting stuck when there was no obstruction, or couldn't find its dock, or re-vac-ed the same place four times (I counted!)... I knew something was wrong. In the end, I ended up returning this and buying my folks a better model. So buyer beware- this is the cheaper Roborock for a reason. The not-Lidar functionality is just rubbish.

I bought this after buying and returning a Roomba which I trialed for a couple of months. The Roomba was alright, but cost $100 extra and would get stuck sometimes when transitioning from hardwood floor onto various rugs I have around my apartment. No such problems with the Roborock E4. For $100 less, you get so many great additional features like mopping, better mapping, and better controls. The E4 can be controlled with a joystick in-app or set to do an area clean (the area in immediate vicinity to where you place the robot). None of these features are available on the Roomba in the same price range. Roborock is the no-brainer choice.

Review_title: Great power but not consistent Revised
Product_review: Update - My original review follows but I would like to brag on the customer support I have received with my issues. When I started having inconsistent issues with my E series robot, I reached out to support and they did not quit trouble shooting until I was finally satisfied. They honored their warranty and did repair a broken sensor. When the unit continued to have some issues, they explained that the unit was better suited to homes under 1500 sq ft. They upgraded my vacuum to the S series which has worked consistently again throughout my home. I highly recommend the Roborock S4 for larger homes. I am giving them 4 stars today because of their excellent service.

Same problem as all the others. Won‚Äôt connect to the app. I contacted customer support. They sent me a list of things to try to resolve the problem. I consider myself pretty good with computer's but one instruction on the list you have to be a computer genius to accomplish.

Review_title: Works as a daily lightweight vacuum.
Product_review: It has enough suction power for light daily pickup of dust and debris, works well. It does not pick up what my larger Shark vacuum does but I‚Äôm ok with that. I live in desert AZ and we get lots of fine dust snd this works great. I just take out the shark once a week for my carpets and areas robo rock can‚Äôt reach. I am very pleased. It took three dock relocations before I found the ideal place so that it now will clean my whole house. Previously it did not and had a hard time finding the dock when it would finish its cleaning. I am happy with the purchase.

Review_title: Super great for the money and really easy to clean/detangle
Product_review: Bought this on a whim during a lightning deal and I am so glad I did. Keeps my living room (which has vinyl plank) and kitchen (tile) clean and doesn't damage curtains/rugs etc. (I have a jute rug though and it picks up some of the natural fibers/grit in the rug). Extremely easy to clean out/take apart which I appreciate, as I usually have a ton of hair that wraps around the wheels/agitator of other vacuums and it can be a pain to cut out. With this, you can remove both the dust bin and the roller/agitator that sweeps up gunk - you can also unscrew the side brush for further easy detangling. Love it!!!

Not so thrilled with this vacuum... first turnoff after unboxing was that it looked as though it had been used. But that was the least of my concerns. Second turnoff was the app to download which was clearly a Chinese app and looked very sketchy. Couldn‚Äôt get it to work with Alexa, and the vacuum simply missed a bunch of spots as I watched it work several times in a row. I went against my better judgment and should have bought the iRobot.
I love this vacuum cleaner, it does a superb job of cleaning, and battery life is great!

¬†I have a dog, a cat, and 2 small children. Pet hair, crumbs, and dirt are never ending in my house. I decided to finally try a robot vacuum since most of our floors are hardwood and the broom just wasn‚Äôt cutting it. I was SHOCKED at how well this vacuum cleans my floor. It‚Äôs great because my kids love watching it work so now they help pick up their toys, shoes, etc. off the floor so they can start the vacuum. I‚Äôm also amazed by how much the dust bin holds. The only downside is that it can‚Äôt do stairs üòÇ I plan to purchase another one. So I‚Äôll have one for upstairs and one for downstairs

Just have a little patience. I read the reviews and even made a spreadsheet to determine which model in this price range ($240-270) was best. The suction on this thing is far superior to other models of similar cost. And it have carpet boost!! But, you have to have a little patience because the first few times it runs, it is learning your house. So the vacuum runs around, testing boundaries and mostly cleaning but also looking lost and covering the same area multiple times. On the fourth day, it cleaned efficiently and got back to its dock quickly. (Yes, I have less than 4 days worth of patience.)

Review_title: Robot is fine, but the App has died, robot unaccesible as a result.
Product_review: All,

Unbelievable! It was able to clean the entire first floor (approx. 1200 square feet). And let me tell you...trust it to do the entire floor...just when you think it "forgot" to get a section...it will do the whole thing. Love the "Z" pattern too! This was an upgrade from my Deebot 500...which was good...but this does the entire first floor on one charge. Love it!

Review_title: Easy to use, quiet, and a great price!!
Product_review: So easy to use and relatively quiet. I am able to watch TV watch being annoyed as it works. My only complaint is that it gets stuck in places and cannot return to base. In fact, it‚Äôs never returned to base after each cycle because it seems to get stuck in one location or another. I always have to pick it up and return it to its base. Despite this, I really love it and it‚Äôs definitely saved me a lot of work ‚Äì especially from having to clean under furniture that I cannot easily reach. In addition, the price is amazing for The product. No reason to buy a Roomba when this product is just as good if not better!

This vacuum is one of the best purposes I‚Äôve ever made! I bought a house with a bunch of wood floors and with my cat, I just couldn‚Äôt keep up, cleaning all the surface area. This little guy is a smart vacuum. It‚Äôs not very loud, strong suction, large dust bin for its size, love that I can use an app to control it. The most impressed I was with it was when it went back into my closet to clean! It has turbo (pick up speed over carpet) which is impressive too. I don‚Äôt know how it compared to a Roomba, but the price was excellent for the quality and Roomba are really expensive. Absolutely love it.

Review_title: Works well enough, attempts to harvest personal data
Product_review: Does an adequate job, requires unwarranted access to wifi and personal data in order to schedule cleanings

The machine has been run 13 times and done pretty good. With two dogs and tile everywhere I was constantly sweeping. Download app, press clean and away it goes. To start bumped pretty hard into Stuff a few times but I‚Äôd say camera works pretty well at avoiding that. Once it knows the machine is good at knowing where the stuff is. Just watch the path first time make sure it gets over and under everything alright. He got stuck under dishwasher and bar cart so just needed to adjust those barely. Every time the machine is done the dust bin is full. I love it.

Very impressed with this robo vac for such a low price. The batter life is incredible. I think the specs say 90 minutes but mine has lasted well over 2 hours on a single charge. I have hardwood and carpet and it does a great job on both. We have two long haired dogs and a cat so picking up pet hair is a top priority. This does a great job. The hair doesn‚Äôt constantly get wrapped around the main brush like another brand that I‚Äôve used. You do still have to untangle the hair from the brush occasionally but not often. Overall very happy with this purchase. I bought another for my upstairs.

¬†I was very hesitant on buying a robot vacuum but I must say this vacuum is the best. I also bought stop strips so it will avoid certain areas and extra filters. I have a dog that sheds quite a bit and the vacuum cleans it up easily. I'm pleasantly surprised how well it cleans.

Review_title: Roborock E4 does it all ! 1 less chore to keep up on ! Highly recommend this robo vacuum!!
Product_review: Love love love üíï this Roborock E4 vacuum! Picks up scattered cat litter after they do their business and run out the crap shack. The vacuum picks it up without issue on hard wood floors. On day one it mapped out my house which I could see and follow on the Mi Home app. Easy to hook up to Wifi with the instructions provided. Recommend the app so you can program the robo v to clean any time of the day you choose and if you want to play with the routes you have a joystick to tell it where to go, but I love watching it does it‚Äôs own thinking and mapping out the room. Almost like it has a personality while it does it‚Äôs job. No more coming home everyday to manually sweep and / or vacuum because this Roborock gets it done for you. Highly recommend! Right now there‚Äôs a great deal on it too price wise. Highly recommended!!!

I adore this robot. I have it scheduled to begin cleaning one hour after I start working. Every morning when I hear it start up, I scramble from my work station to pick up all the socks and cats it may menace. It doubles so nicely as a work break.

Review_title: Download Mi Home app, not Roborock app
Product_review: Used like 4 times for the first week already. Perfect for my two small bedroom apartment. Two stories, but I have no problem carrying it up and down the floors (carpet upstairs, hardwood downstairs. It detects ‚Äúcliffs‚Äù so no need to worry about falling)

I like that it‚Äôs quite. I like that it has no problem going from tile floor to area rug with no problem and that it switches over higher suction. It has a nice long battery life. My husband like that he can see a map of where it‚Äôs vacuum and read the error codes on his phone. To me a that‚Äôs a fun extra that I‚Äôm not interested in. We have only had it a few days but have ran it every day. It seeems to be getting smarter. Two things I don‚Äôt care about it is we have sliding doors and when they are open it drives itself over the edge and the recorded voice is all the way up and she‚Äôs still very quite.

I was skeptical!! I‚Äôve wanted a robot vacuum for a while and finally took a chance. It seems to get more up than I expected, it does take longer than I expected also, which is why I‚Äôm glad I can turn it on while at work and not have to listen to it. It is a little loud but not as loud as a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù vacuum cleaner. I haven‚Äôt used the mop function yet as I have area rugs and don‚Äôt feel like pulling them up but I love the vacuum function! Photo is from one vacuum and I consider my house clean!

Love this vacumn! Has a basic GPS so it knows where it's been unlike most that just ping pong around until the battery dies, going over the same place repeatedly and missing other spots. Sent back a Roomba that wouldn't go on my area rug due to a few black stripes in the pattern, sent that one back and got this for half the price and it works flawlessly. The only negative with this brand is that you have to use the mihome app if you want to control it with your phone, and the app is total garbage. Constantly boots you out and loses your device. Hopefully they eventually come up with their own app.

I got this for Christmas and it is by far my favorite thing. We have a ton of sand coming in the house as we recently built and still don‚Äôt have rock for the driveway. I was worried the vacuum wouldn‚Äôt pick it up but it does. I also have a girls with really long hair so I was worried about being able to clean out the roller. I can‚Äôt tell you how many vacuum belts I‚Äôve broken because of that. This think is soooo easy to clean. The brush comes all the way out so it easy for me to cut the hair from around it. I have had some difficulty using the app but I‚Äôm not all that worried about it right now. I like running it while I‚Äôm home just in case it runs over little toys left behind by my 8 year old.

Honestly, just don't waste your money on this. I have no idea if it is the brand or just this model, but this thing has been a disappointment for the last 10 months that I've owned it. It disconnects from the wifi randomly, doesn't clean the whole house consistently and returns to the dock after only 1/2 finishing one room. It is completely unreliable. The actual vacuum function when it is cleaning seems reasonable, but overall I would never recommend this to anyone. Unfortunately I wasted $300....don't make the same mistake. I'm sure there are similar robot vacuums in the price range that would be a much better buy than this.

I don‚Äôt usually write reviews unless something is terrible or more than I expected. This vacuum is THE. BEST. THING. EVER!
