We bought a roomba like 5 years ago, but returned it because it was stupid. Went over the same spots 20 times, while simultaneously dancing around visible debris. I was hesitant to buy another one, but I‚Äôm a busy mom with a toddler, golden retriever, and 2 cats.... needless to say our floors need to be cleaned daily. The Z pattern of this machine in a huge improvement over the random pattern systems. It‚Äôs methodical, and hits every inch of the floor without wasting time going over the same spots many times. It also has multiple suction levels you can set. Some reviews complained about setup being difficult. I had no problem. I did however watch a YouTube unboxing video first in preparation for setup being difficult, so maybe that helped? It also has the ability to work as a moping system if you buy the attachments. It‚Äôs in my list to purchase. Overall this is my favorite purchase to date and believe everyone needs one!

This product simply NEVER stops! It is supposed to clean a regular house, but it easily tackled a dance studio of over 5,300 square feet! The programming is tricky, so be careful to follow instructions. The mop will keep a hardwood floor clean, but won't tackle tough spots unless you tell it to spot clean. Purchase freely. It will do far more than you ask of it.

Review_title: Great for Daily Dirt and Litter
Product_review: This vacuum is great for cleaning up the daily dirt in the house. I've got tile that's dark and light patterned which in the dark, the vac sometimes detects as cliffs. Keeping the lights on in the darker areas of the house and opening the curtains seems to solve it pretty well. The z pattern sort of works but it definitely gets a bit lost sometimes, though it usually finds its way eventually and does manage to vacuum everything.
I've been using the robot for about 2 months and I'm very happy. First we have two levels hard floors home and two kids of 2 and 5 years old.

Great vacuum. I already had a Roborock S4 for downstairs and opted for the E4 for upstairs. The mapping feature was not that important for the upstairs application, but it makes a huge difference downstairs with all the furnishings, rugs, etc. Unless you have a nice open area, and mapping is not relevant, the E4 is great. Otherwise spend the extra $100 and go for the S4.
I wish I could return this item and get money back.

The Roborock E4 is NOT supported by the Roborock app, but will run using the MiHome app. However, MiHome vacuum is NOT an Alexa skill - and will NOT control the device. I bought this vacuum specifically because the description states it works with Alexa, and it DOES NOT. The vacuum itself is a quality product - but I was attempting to run all my ‚Äúsmart‚Äù devices in my home through a single source (Alexa). I am so disappointed because other than the deceptive product description, the vacuum itself is fantastic.

This thing works pretty well when there is nothing in its way. I even removed all my dining chairs and rawhide rugs to give it an easier first clean, but it still had issues. I have. 1300 square foot 1929 bungalow with hardwood floors. I would expect it wouldn‚Äôt be a difficult home to navigate, but I kept having to pick it up as it got stuck. I‚Äôll give it another couple tries before I send it back. Once it‚Äôs on track it cleans fairly well but did miss a few clumps of dog hair.

Cleans amazing. Gets lost and cleans the same spot over and over. I still haven‚Äôt been able to connect to my phone, although I wouldn‚Äôt trust it to do anything without me here anyway. It does clean really great though so I‚Äôll give it that. My friends come over and talk about how great it cleans compared to their brands. I just wish it had more order to its cleaning plan if that makes sense.

Review_title: My animals are skeptical... but I love it.
Product_review: I‚Äôm so happy with this vacuum! It‚Äôs really effective. I bought this because I have a German Shepherd mix and a fluffy cat, so our floors are often covered in cat and dog hair. I can‚Äôt vacuum every day, but the floors need to be cleaned every day. The vacuum gets our whole home in a little over an hour. It cleans in a linear fashion and leaves pleasing lines on our carpet. I have to dump the dustbin after every clean, which is satisfying when you see how much animal hair it cleans up.

Fast delivery and nice unit. Have had for a few weeks and the battery lasts long enough to do our ranch house where we let it run. The dust bin is showing it is picking up a lot of dust and debris. Unit is quieter than our older Neato and runs longer. I like the APP so we can see what it did and now long it ran. The Wifi drops every once in a while so I have to reboot the router and then it will auto reconnect, not sure if its my router or the vacuum.

¬†I've had this robot vacuum for 2 months now, and it's been great. It can clean the vinyl plank, tile, and rugs in my open living room, dining room, and kitchen without any problems. It can also easily climb over our large transition pieces. It's relatively quiet and takes about an hour to clean a 900 square ft area. Most of the time it can find its way home. It occasionally gets stuck on the corner of my sofa, but overall I'm very happy with it.

Review_title: Add Roborock home to your Alexa App
Product_review: Overall really impressed by the movement and power that comes from this vacuum. It definitely picked up a bunch of dust and hair that I never knew existed (my fianc√©e and I clean every Sunday too). What was misleading was the mapping apparently the e series is not a part of the roborock app and has a separate app called mi home. Although that would have been a nice feature for $213 including tax not really gonna fret over it. If you want to add Your e series robot to Alexa download the roborock home app instead to connect the device. Happy dust hunting in your home.

Review_title: Great vacuum but nearly useless with little remote control and NO mapping features
Product_review: First off, I love this vacuum as a vacuum, and I'm not happy I have to return it and upgrade to the S-Series, but that's how happy we are with the basic cleaning features. I owned a Roomba years ago, and enjoyed it, but when it died I let it go because it was a good experience but the little bin that was hard to remove and it's mindless approach just made it not worth the work. This E4 is light-years beyond that unit, and we've enjoyed it so much we'll stick with Roborock and spend the extra $ to get what we need.

It works great when you leave it alone & let it do it's job. The remote with app is kind of difficult to control though. The general clean (the default choice) covers the entire floor, room to room. It can't clean the corners due to its round shape but it covers 98% of the floor space & cleans well.

Review_title: Seriously manufacturers, just throw a remote in the box!
Product_review: I am in hell trying to set this up. It‚Äôs not connecting through the phone and the Wi-Fi so the only thing It will do is spot clean which means it runs around in circles for a few seconds and then just goes off. Day 3 of trying‚Ä¶.I have never been so miserable in my life trying to make something work. Even if it does now and everything gets fixed, I‚Äôll hate it for a long time because of this misery. Total opposite of the purchase plan. Waiting a long time for this machine. Gutted.

Review_title: It sucks up more fur in one run than I swept up in 4 weeks of sweeping.
Product_review: This vacuum works well and doesn't have a problem with our two area rugs. With two fur babies and a bad back it does well enough to keep me from sweeping every other day. It gets stuck going under our sectional and we move our dinning room chairs if we want the entire area rug vacuumed. It sucks up more fur in one run than I swept up in 4 weeks of sweeping and the noise level compared to a regular vacuum is nothing. I have a hard time opening the box that collects the dust and fur due to arthritis, others may not have this issue.

It does the job, you do expect more from it since it's advertised that it can do much. The remote control is too glitchy, it lags when you press the button and sometimes it just does not work. Have thought much about returning it because of this; I also purchased a Coredy robot and its remote on the app works flawlessly with its immediate response. I thought since this is more of a "well known" brand it would perform better, but a little disappointed there. It has gotten stuck under the cabinets at times, the Coredy knows how to get out of the situation. Maybe I should spend a little more and get a "better" performing robot. I will definitely update this review if I do.

Waited to review this till after 6 months of use. Actually has been more than 6 months. The unit stops in the middle of a room and asks to clear obisticles but there's nothing remotely close to the unit. It only cleans 1/4 of the room and says it's finished cleaning and going back to the dock. There are a lot more issues but these to us were enough. We clean the unit after every use so it's not a matter of maintenance, the unit just isn't worth the money. Buyer please beware, this review is not an emotional one, but one of facts.
I purchased this vacuum to help me keep up with the amount of dog hair in our home. I just don't have the time to sweep daily and I was hoping this vacuum would help.

Review_title: It‚Äôs not worth the wifi headache
Product_review: I followed the instructions and was not able to get it to work. I tried several times to get it to connect with wifi.. Very frustrating ..uugh

¬†I was skeptical when I bought this, however, it was one of the best purchases that I've ever made. This little vacuum does a great job. It gets pretty close to the edges and transitions well from rug to hardwood. I like that it doesn't clean in a random pattern line some robot vacuums. I would advise doing a quick walk through of the area that is about to be cleaned and pick up any obstacles that could cause it to get stuck. I like to put my kitchen chairs up to get a good clean under my table.

Our first vac was a 700 series Roomba. The Roborock is soooooo much quieter. It is easier to clean the than Roomba. The battery runs for a very long time almost to long! E4 is very gentle when it ‚Äúruns into‚Äù legs of tables unlike the Roomba. Cons: Have to go online to get directions for use and programming. The directions to program are so confusing that I have elected not to program an auto start.There may also be a way to program it to run in only a certain area, but again the directions are so confusing that I didn‚Äôt program that feature. Works great for the money, wish I understood the programming instructions better to get full benefit of all features. I would buy this again.

Review_title: THE BEST THING I'VE EVER SEEN!!
Product_review: WOW!! It's Amazing, it Truly Is! This is OUR BEST CLEANER WE HAVE!! One, it does ALL the work for you. Go do something else for a change!!! 2. It gets up more dirt than our larger vacuum cleaner!! 3. It's so thin, it cleans all under beds!! Where most vacuums never go!! You wouldn't believe how much this little guy picks up. It goes from our hard wood floors to carpet with no problems! Heck YES I RECOMMEND THIS!! GET IT. IF YOU HAVE DUST ALLERGIES LIKE ME, THIS IS FOR YOU, SERIOUSLY!!

Review_title: Great little robot, including for dog owners!
Product_review: This robot is awesome for the price! After having tried two others over the last few years (one much more expensive ...), which constantly got stuck on rugs and in corners, I was pleasantly surprised with this one. It's smart enough to try various movements to get unstuck from rolled up rugs or electric cords. The suction is decent and manages to clean up dog hair reasonably well (including a Husky Malamute mix hair...). Where another robot I had in the past would constantly get hung up on rugs, this one is heavy and large enough to crawl on top without much difficulty. It also has enough of a mapping function to not miss areas, despite furniture and dog beds in many places. All around, I am very happy with this robot!

Review_title: Mop stopped working after two months
Product_review: As a vacuum, this thing is amazing. Having cats in the house, it drove me crazy to clean daily because of all the lingering fur... but not anymore.

Review_title: Great value, quality cleaning job, gets lost and scared sometimes
Product_review: Overall, we're really happy with this purchase! We have all hardwood floors and two cats and it keeps everything clean: it easily goes under chairs and beds no problem. The battery life holds out longer than two hours, which is about how long it takes to clean our 1200 sq ft house. The dust bin is easy to remove and the app is really intuitive. Sometimes if it gets stuck or you have to pick it up and put it somewhere though, it re-sets its cleaning map and gets very confused. It also doesn't actually learn your layout, so a lot of the time spent is bumping into things every time, and sometimes it gets lost and calls for help (but don't we all do the same thing at some point or another in the godforesaken world?). It's not super loud but can be a little distracting if you're in the same room and trying to work. More distracting than a cat, but less distracting than a child. If it's more than 10 feet away from the dock when it's done cleaning you will definitely have to help it along: ours is slowly gaining confidence, though. Easily transitions from hardwood to rugs and the suction on it is really impressive: it easily picks up large particles like cat food (Rachel Ray Nutrish is its favorite...the salmon kind). Overall, would definitely recommend this for someone who wants a good robot vacuum/family member without spending over $500.
The vacuum itself is very good for the price, but there's a thing that prevent me from loving it completely: No Google Home integration whatsoever? Come on!

Review_title: Worked well for about a week.
Product_review: I really love that I don't have to vacuum with a robot vac, so I was pleased with this the first week. Although it did look really banged up after the first time I used it...it bumps into things harder than you would think. This is the 2nd week I've used it, and I've noticed a steep decline. The suction doesn't seem to be as good, I have to switch to the remote control to get it to go over places it missed, it get's lost when returning to the base, error code about the wheels being blocked (they weren't), and do not trust this to not fall down stairs even though it's supposed to sense that and avoid it. Thankfully, I caught it before it fell. I do like that it goes in a more logical pattern than some of the cheaper ones, but I wouldn't recommend this for the price. It's probably worth it to spend a little more to get a much better bot.

So far I love it. Our dog is not so sure though. but I just want to let people know that if you have a Google 5 GHz mesh Wi-Fi it works just fine. I'm not sure why some people say that it only works on 2.4. I didn't have any issues connecting and my phone clearly states that I'm on a 5 ghz wifi right now. I noticed that it created its own Wi-Fi network and it connected to that. Not exactly sure how that worked but maybe that's the reason.

I love this product and it has great suction power. Makes my carpets look beautiful all the time. I think this is my all time favorite Christmas gift I have ever received. I would say the one difficulty for this product is getting it to go where you want it to. I have a sleigh bed and it does go under the bed. We did order the magnet strips (but that gets expensive). We used the bed legs to hold down the magnet strips, but if you have other areas that it can go under, it could present a problem. Most of my home doesn't have furniture that the vacuum can get under.

The robot vacuum runs on the Mi Home app which is terrible. I‚Äôve had the vacuum for 4 months and the vacuum will not run according to schedule of it is disconnected from WiFi. The problem is that it disconnects all the time and requires extensive troubleshooting to reconnect. A terrible App completely reduces this robot vacuum to the most basic version. I can only manually press the button now to run the vacuum. I regret buying this product.

Review_title: Won‚Äôt vac area rugs with black patterns!
Product_review: I wanted to like this. The idea of SOMEONE ELSE vacuuming? Yes please. And every day? My dream come true. I have hardwood floors and 3 pets. This thing was great at that. I was impressed. But the second it hit my dark doormat and black patterned area rug, it freaked out. Wouldn‚Äôt vacuum. And apparently was so distraught that it barfed the contents of its dustbin all over the rug. I‚Äôm not even sure how it did that! I went online for a hack and tons of other people had this prob. I covered the cliff sensors as they reco‚Äôd. And then it wouldn‚Äôt vac at all and kept telling me to clean the cliff sensors. I finally gave up and sent it back. Other than that it was incredibly easy to set up and did a nice job on hardwood.

Review_title: Vacuum works great, but they sent me the wrong unit.
Product_review: Update: This vacuum worked great for about 3 months. Then it just got confused. Started charging for 10 minutes then leaving the dock. Then it would clean for about 3 minutes then just stop. I am returning it for a new one.

I‚Äôve had the Roborock E4 for almost 1 month so far & I love it! It vacuums in straight lines, great suction power & easy to clean. The app is easy to use as a remote & Alexa can start/ stop the vacuum. I have 1 young child, a dog with short hair & a wood burning stove that puts a lot of dust in the air. I use it every day or every other day to pick up hair, dirt & dust.

Review_title: Pretty good for the price. Could not use with Alexa, but could link to Google Home.
Product_review: First ran the vacuum without WiFi. Cleaned fairly well, but the without WiFi it's inconvenient to control. Tried to link to Alexa for hours, but unsuccessful. Although the manual does not mention Google Home, I found it easy to control with Google Home and Mi Home. Can monitor the vacuum and control easily. Even got voice control to work with Google. Can also see a map of cleaned area after cleaning session completes. Looks like will run for about 2 hours on a battery full charge. The dustbin filled up when the battery was at 52%. Cleaning is often and a little painful. Full charging is fairly slow (3-4 hours). I love to watch it vacuum....it's pretty smart. Goes under most items, but not all. I haven't tried mopping yet.

I‚Äôve had the Robo for about 3 weeks now. I have to say I am completely satisfied with the job it is doing on my dark kitchen floor. I use it almost everyday and it does an efficient job. I followed it around the first couple of times. It got wedged under the dishwasher so I put a rolled up rug under the dishwasher. It works fine on low pile rugs. I was a little worried about the edges of my oriental, but it‚Äôs fine. It can‚Äôt handle the higher pile rug in my dining room. It gets clogged with fuzz so I vacuum that myself. All in all, very pleased.

Review_title: Her name is Roxxy. She. Is. Dope!!
Product_review: First off. Her name is Roxxy. Second. She‚Äôs the best. The family has been enamored by our little robo buddy. She talks. And obeys. She comes out at 9 am Monday Wednesday fri. And 9 pm sat and sun. She starts out with. ‚ÄúStarting cleaning‚Äù and ends with‚Äù cleaning complete, going back to dock‚Äù and I get a text on my phone. It watch. Love it. We‚Äôve followed her about. And she goes EVERYWHERE you‚Äôll allow. Nvm ever gets stuck. And the app tell you how she‚Äôs doing as far as maintenance. We bout the 15 dollar extra parts pack. With rollovers and filters. By my estimates. I won‚Äôt need to buy parts for at least two years. I‚Äôm thinking of getting one for upstairs. But I caught it on sale ($188) and really don‚Äôt want to buy another at 269. Buy am thinking about it. If I do. Her name will be Rosie.......Roxxy is super quiet. Barely louder than a normal vac. If that. And she‚Äôs SMART! We watched her navigate the world with amazement. If you want a great vac that won‚Äôt break the bank. Get it. My only issue. Is I can‚Äôt get google home to play nice on my iPhone. Lol. Imagine that?

Review_title: It is possible to feel pity for an inanimate object?
Product_review: After the cheap little Eufy robovac had an unfortunate accident I decided it was time to upgrade to something more advanced. After hours of research and the Prime Day offers I came upon the Roborock vacuums. Great packaging and everything seemed to be in order.

Really like the way this thing cleans my hardwood and carpets. I am old school about cleaning. But this lil bull dog goes places I can‚Äôt so I have added this to my old school cleaning. I am shocked how much dirt is pulled up by this vacuum very happy with it

I bought 2 of these at the same time, one for a relative. I had previously purchased a different brand, so was concerned that this wouldn't work as well. I couldn't believe how well it works! While it doesn't have the ability to map your area, it is very thorough. It goes back and forth, overlapping where it had just vacuumed. It also has a few brushes that stick out a little for corners. It spent an hour in our bedroom, with alot under the bed, which is where I never vacuum. Cleaning it out is very easy. Best investment and I highly recommend. I got ours on a black Friday sale and saved $100.

Very good vacuum for the price. It will keep going over the same area multiple times, not sure of to get it completely clean or a flaw in the system but in general happy with this vacuum. They also have great responsive customer service, I asked for a couple of pieces there the manual started come with the vacuum but were not in the box and they sent it to me within a week. Thank you!

Just ran this for the first time before bed last night. It is a little noisy while in the same room. I turned it down to silent and it still made noise. I have all hardwood and tile floors so it may contribute to the noise. I woke up this morning and my floors looked so good! My dogs shed a ton and kids leave dirt everywhere. I shared a photo of the dust bin. The device was back on its charger safely. It navigated under my beds and didn‚Äôt fall down the stairs. I am so excited about this device!!

Review_title: Started off strong, but after 2 months things have changed,
Product_review: The vacuum started out really strong and was working great, but after 2 months the thing looks like it‚Äôs been through WW2 and seems noisier while operating. It has paint scrape marks all over it and the speaker goes in and out when announcing. When we first got it, it never got stuck but now it gets stuck almost every day. I come down in the morning to find it stuck under the lip of our kitchen cabinets or on our daughters play mat. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs lost it‚Äôs steam or it‚Äôs just not built for our house, but getting stuck under our cabinets seem to be the biggest issue. The little ‚Äúeye‚Äù that pops out the top always get stuck under the cabinet lips. I wouldn‚Äôt buy again.

Review_title: Not for pets who shed alot
Product_review: I bought this model based on a 10 min video comparing several different models, sadly disappointed to say the least. I have new base boards and now I have a permanent mark from the vaccum a ring around the perimeter if you will. Says great for dog hair I have 2 dogs 1 who sheds ridiculous amounts of hair he should be bald. The 1 brush just flips the hair right out the back of the unit. I have 3 cleaning times set per day to cover all the dog hair and I still have to use a dust mop after the vaccum is done. It gets caught under the couch every time it pushes it way under there, so much for it scanning the room to learn the obstacles in the way. Some days it finds home right away but other day it needs assistance.. i do like the app very easy to use, however it was a rough start to sync it to the wifi had to Uninstal it. This models doesn't come with any extra brush filter all sold separately. The back and forth pattern is great no issues there. Like the talking feature and notifications from the app. Overall I wouldn't recommend this model for people who have pets or furniture to many obstacles in its path. Also its loud you can't hear the TV while it running.

It's great to have a machine that picks up so much dirt, but there have to be others out there that work better. This one gets lost and redoes rooms, sometimes 4 or 5 times. It announces that it is low on battery power and returning to dock, but continues cleaning. When it gets trapped it has a terrible time getting itself out of the trap even--can't seem to figure out how to go backwards. It also takes a very, VERY long time to recharge.

Review_title: Terrific buy super addition to keeping my house clean.
Product_review: This is one of the best buys for my home I've made. I have wall to wall Berber carpet, vinyl flooring, linoleum flooring, and a lot of twists and turns.

I have had this for approx 2 months and keep getting more and more disappointed. The suction is not what is claimed. I have watched this vacuum roll over dog hair and the hair is still there after it goes directly over it I‚Äôve watched it roll over oatmeal that was spilled not wet oatmeal dry oatmeal flakes and watched it roll right over and leave the flakes there so to me that means there is no suction. Bummed I spent so much on something that doesn‚Äôt perform satisfactorily.

I am very happy with this item. It cleans well and the battery lasts long enough for the area that I need cleaned to be done in one pass through. The only problem that I have had is with the Alexa app as I can't seem to get this connected.

Review_title: Terrible And frightened for my family...
Product_review: I order this and it was shipped out like the picture you see this is unexceptable, I hope that we where not exposed to any germs...

Review_title: Buena pero solo como apoyo a mantenimiento de lo que t√∫ limpias
Product_review: Ayuda solamente para mantener limpio, no es un equipo para usar como sustituto de la limpieza profunda, el mapeador es bastante deficiente, como menciono, solo para mantener limpio el piso despu√©s de que una persona haya hecho una limpieza profunda, NO SUSTITUYE AL SER HUMANO, si tu expectativa es no hacer m√°s T√∫, te va decepcionar, por los costos que tienen creo que no valen la pena a√∫n pagar mas de 100 o 150 dls, pagu√© 250 y creo que fu√© mucho para la rentabilidad en el uso

When I first purchased this product and used it it worked fine. Then it would not perform like it did. It would just do irratic stuff. It would not cover the whole area anymore. Then it would just stop in the middle of cleaning.

So far so good! We've been using our little robot that I've named R2 for a few days now. The first day, it seemed confused as it was learning the layout of our home. It had difficulty learning where its docking station was. Its finally figured out most of our floor plan 5 days later and goes straight home when I tell it to dock.

Review_title: It does not pick up as well on carpet
Product_review: I have hardwood floors with one area rug in my living room & it does a great job on hardwood floor but does not pick up on area rug. I have a Chihuahua & of course I have a lot of dog hair but this Roborock does not pick up the dog hair at all on rug. This is one main reason I chose this one as it advertised it does a good job of picking up dog hair. I‚Äôm very displeased for this reason. I have back trouble and it‚Äôs very hard for me to push a vacuum cleaner so I thought this would be the answer, not so!!!

Review_title: The Energizer Bunny of robot vacuums
Product_review: We previously owned a Roomba.. but it went haywire (reprogrammed its own language and schedule.. scary AI nightmare stuff!). This roborock vacuum FAR EXCEEDS it. The run time is amazingly long. It cleans in an actual, calculated path instead of a random pattern like Roomba. It‚Äôs rug friendly and adjusts by floor texture. I have 2 pets that shed a crazy amount of fur and this vacuum handles it like a champ! VERY happy with it!!!

Review_title: My floors have never been cleaner
Product_review: I have a dog that sheds, and live on a like with sand. My floors always have dog hair and sand. My friends liked this model so much they ordered a 2nd one for their lower level, so I thought I would give it a try.

¬†This thing is the best house appliance I've ever bought. It's extremely hard for us to find time to vacuum our house. This vacuum almost didn't get stuck, and when it did it solved it by itself. It found its way through my apartment even though we have lots of furniture around. I could not believe how clean this made my floor! It's better than the handheld vacuum I have. It even worked on our rug.

having only had iRobot vacuums before, I thought to try this one out based on such good reviews. Frankly, I don't see it. The positives are it's a little quieter than an iRobot, but not really quiet overall. But I have found the electronics to be quite stupider than the iRobot series in general. It also gets stuck much more easily, and does not seem to learn anything at all. Giving this one away because I can't return it and went back to an iRobot, much happier.
Great vacuum. It has everything you'd need for a good medium segment robotic vacuum:

Was skeptical about buying one of these for my mostly hardwood/tiled floors. Surprised it works very well. Only had a few times it stopped when a small piece of tile got sucked up in the brush. Got stuck under a chair once. It really sucks up the hair from a 100 lib husky mix. I am really happy with this robot vacuum and recommend it. On a note of pure honesty my dog disagrees with every thing in this review. He is scared to death of it.

This is a great no frills vacuum. We have luxury vinyl plank flooring with area rugs and tile. All were done barefoot clean. It used half a charge to do about 1200 sq ft. Don't be afraid if it seems a little random at first. After it maps the area it gets more efficient each time. This bot does not allow room naming or virtual walls but there are walls available. I returned this model to go up to the S4 for the extra features. But if you can live without them this is a great choice.

I like this product a lot! I love the fact that my carpeting is clean - it actually does quite a good job. It's programmed to do all the areas eventually. I love when you tell it to go back to it's resting place and it does that. It's fun to watch as it rumbles around, bumps into things, but hasn't destroyed anything - yet. :-) Worth the money if you tend to forget to vacuum or you just don't like to do that chore.

Review_title: Almost works. I can no longer recommend.
Product_review: I already own a Roborock product but I decided to add the Roborock E4 because of rave reviews and a great price. It does clean very well and efficiently. It‚Äôs one of the few robot vacs that runs in a straight line pattern and that‚Äôs what got my attention. Especially at this price range. It was easy to set up and it cleans as good as my Roborock E25 on wood floors. The map will feature is only there to show you what it cleansed but is not interactive. For the price, I‚Äôm happy with how it performs.

Great suction but has the same error issue as the original mi robot vacuum. It stops cleaning with ‚Äúerror 8‚Äù for no reason every 10 min or so. Nothing is clogged or stuck in the brush. So annoying. Contacted customer service, they told me to return this one and upgrade to the more expensive version.

This thing is a game-changer! I have two very hairy large dogs and a longhaired cat. I had no idea how much hair was lying around until I got this. I have run it for the last 4 days and each day it has sucked up a small dog's worth of hair. I feel so accomplished when it completes its run and re-docks. It does such a better job than I could! This saves me at least a couple hours a week. You will not regret this purchase!

Review_title: Not even a year and it‚Äôs broken!
Product_review: So 1st off this vacuum was amazing when it worked! However it‚Äôs been less than a year that I paid over $400 and it‚Äôs already giving up. The last robot vac I had for 3 yrs, bought it used at $150 and it was still going strong when I gave it to my sister and decided to upgrade to one with mapping. Well that one is still going strong and mine has basically quit! The suction power is almost non existent! And it doesn‚Äôt follow pattern like it used to do!

I have a studio with mid tile carpet. Overall the device seems pretty dumb. I really don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs using the map, it keeps hitting the same place for minutes, after you unstuck it, sometimes it loses its position and cleans previous places it already cleaned. Even if you move it manually into a new area, it follows very inefficient route or even goes back to the closest area it already cleaned.

The Roborock E4 has been cleaning my floors for 5 weeks every day and I am impressed with it. It runs for almost two hours and only uses about one half of its battery. It picks up dirt and dust and whatever else is on the floor every time. The dust bin is large and easy to clean and the filter has used only one half of it‚Äôs life expectancy. I purchased 8 replacements for less than $20.

Review_title: Caution, do not recommend. Problems just mount up.
Product_review: Liked this for 2 days. It has decent suction and worked great for a couple days. Then the problems started. It disconnects from my home network constantly. I have to setup it up like new every couple of days. This is the only smart device in my house that has this problem. Now it is extremely loud, was quiet when I first got it. I have only had it 30 days, now when it starts up, you can hear it in the whole house. Apparently I am 1 day outside of the return, now will have to work with warranty to get it replaced. Do now buy, stick with the name brands. There are other issues but those are the top two.

This is my first robovac and I just got it yesterday, so we'll see if it holds up. So far it's awesome. It was a little difficult to connect to wifi, took a little time to troubleshoot but got it working. Battery seems to really hold up, I started at 58% and it ran for an hour cleaning my wood floors before I docked it at about 35%. Watching the vacuum run I can tell it's a smart one. It worked its way around the house without missing a spot, and without repeating rooms/areas. App allows you to set schedules and program automation, but it doesn't allow you to section off areas of the house to clean as I hoped it would. It maps out the floor after it's done so you can see if it missed anywhere. There is a remote control on the app to run it manually and also a spot cleaning feature that you can set it to do a 5' area. Overall super pleased with my purchase right now, definitely recommend this for it's price range (I got it for $190 on CybMon)
The product is decent but there is a lot of misleading information.

Review_title: Not so sure- cleans the same space
Product_review: Got this earlier this week. It's pretty nifty and it cleans well. The only thing that I'm noticing I don't like is that it cleans the same place over and over again. I have a relatively small house (1000sq ft) a normal amount of furnishings/floor items and when it cleans, it doesn't clean in the pattern described on the post. It's pretty erratic in where it cleans this leading to missing some places entirely and cleaning the same area multiple times. I'm going to see try it out for a couple more weeks, but may be returning.

The device wouldn't connect to the app at first. It asked me to add device, I do. It asks me to add room, I do. Then goes back to add device, then add room with nothing showing up from the previous time, and the loop continues. I eventually got everything to link after a while and some restarts but I would not rate ease of setup high, I think this is more of an issue with the app not the vacuum though so the manufacturer needs to work on that. The vacuum itself does a pretty good job on hardwood and tile. I don't have carpet and my area rugs are stored currently but it did get stuck on a bathroom rug and had some issues with the hardwood to tile transition strip. It did do a good job getting under the bed though which is one reason I purchased to start with.
Would not connect to WiFi

We purchased this robot vacuum after reading kits of reviews. So glad we did!!! We live in a 1400 sq/ft apartment with a dog that shed and 2 teen boys... this little robot gets the job done for sure! The ability to program cleaning times is a great feature to have the house clean when you get home from work.

My neighbor and her sister have this vacuum and love it, but our experience was very poor. First, the vacuum wouldn‚Äôt pair with either of our phones. We did all the things, would not work. Second, it does get itself stuck in ways that a less expensive vacuum never did. Third, I‚Äôve watched it roll over larger bits of crumbs... and leave them behind. It‚Äôs suction, while in theory more powerful, was comparable to a vacuum a third it‚Äôs price. It would move in a grid fashion in the strangest of areas, such as around our ottoman, but never the full room.

Review_title: It does a cleaning great job
Product_review: ¬†I bought this item because it‚Äôs hard for me to clean certain places (under the beds and sofas), and I was totally amazed by the great suction job this Roborock E4 Mop Robot Vacuum and Mop Cleaner, Internal Route Plan with 2000Pa Strong Suction does. I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking to buy a great deal at cheaper price.

Review_title: Excellent at preventing pet hair accumulation!
Product_review: I originally purchased this to try out one of the cheaper robot vacuums with the amount of pets we have. We have 5 rescue dogs and 5 cats for reference. Our vacuum goes through the main areas of the house where the animals are twice daily. For the two weeks I have had this vacuum, there has been NO accumulation of pet hair. Prior to this vacuum, we had accumulation within 2 days that needed to be swept up. I got this vacuum to help with the accumulation of pet hair and I say it works BETTER than I would have imagined. It does not map the house, but it has gotten a good idea of the main areas and goes through them all during its cleaning time. It was easy to set up, though it refuses to work with my Alexa. Despite this, the app is easy to use and I have it on a timer. We empty it out every 2-3 days and we have had 0 problems with it so far. I have not tried out the mopping aspect, but I have high hopes for this too. For pet hair, this is a great, cheap option. If it can keep up with 10 animals, I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs an excellent purchase!

Excellent product to keep house clean with little effort. I have hard floors on my house and worked excellent. Does the whole house doing an N path and aftter cleaning starts on the edges. After that, returns to the base. My house is small 60 square meters and use less than half batteries with medium suction power. Incredible the dirt that this device can grab. Not for deep clean but keeps your house clean. I recommend it a lot

Review_title: Competent vac gets the job done while I'm doing other things... Or absolutely nothing!
Product_review: As a vacuum to I'm happy with it. While it's not always thorough the first time, it has no issues if I tell it to repeat clean. As a mop, however, I should have read more about it. The instructions say I can only use plain water! How much cleaning can it possibly do with plain water? That's disappointing. I should have just bought a model that did vacuuming rather than pay more to get a model that mops as well.

Review_title: YOU BUY CHEAP YOU BUY TWICE
Product_review: ¬†Absolute trash

My dog is awesome, but he sheds like a cave yeti. This robot picks up so much dog hair that I've considered starting my own wig/toupee company. "Dang that hair looks real.. was it created in a lab?" "Nah... but it was created by a lab."

The suction power is decent it does suck up dog fur very well but it would need to go over the house 2 or 3 times for it to completely clean it. You can control it through their app but other than that there‚Äôs not much to do other than tell it to vacuum and how strong the suction to be. I use the turbo option because I have huskies and their furs are just everywhere, and let me just say that it sounds like a regular vacuum. Not quiet at all on the turbo setting. I received this product on January 17 it is now January 28 and my robot has now completely stopped working. It says it‚Äôs offline but if it was offline why won‚Äôt it let me turn it on? Does the wifi have anything to do with the power system? And I have wifi so it should be working..

The vacuum operated great when it was connected to the App. It took almost an hour to get it to connect to the app when I first unboxed it. Then it was fine for about a month. Now it will not communicate with the app. I can see the vacuum in the app but can't control it. I get a connection time out type error. I uninstalled/reinstalled the app 3 times and also removed the vacuum and re added it to the app. No success. Tons of reviews about this same problem but I figured I'd try it out anyway. Roborock needs to team up with a new app. Mi Home App is absolute garbage with the Roborock E4 vacuum! Spend the extra $25-$50 bucks and get a different brand.

I‚Äôm love with this product. I like how in the app I can program the cleaning very easily and see where it went with the map. It is very efficient and I really like the different cleaning options it has. It goes very well on carpets, even if they are a little tall. I‚Äôve been using it forever 3 weeks now, and so far, so good (except for the cat that is terrified by it).
**UPDATE** vacuum will no longer charge, rendering it useless.

The only negative things I have to say about it is that it's a little on the bigger side and too tall to fit under some things but not a big issues and it seems to have some difficulty getting back to its dock. Eventually it gets there but it takes it a while to find its way back. Overall, we are very happy with it. It seems to have a good battery life and does a really good job cleaning up all of the dog hair in my house which there is a lot of it.

Review_title: A very good vacuum for the price.
Product_review: The RoboRoc vacuum does a very good job of cleaning. My only complaint is that it gets hung up on furniture. I haven‚Äôt uses the wet feature yet so I will have to write another review later.

My most recent robot vac was a low end Eufy. It did a fine job cleaning, but it was a random pattern and would get stuck often under couch. I then saw an ‚Äúepic‚Äù deal on amazon for the roborock. It has been fantastic in its machine learning patterns. I can believe how much dog hair it picks up even though we have central vac. I have yet to see any docking problems. Big thumbs up

Review_title: great for hardwood and suitable for high pile carpets with patience
Product_review: Great battery life. The first time we had it on the carpet it kept going over the same spot infront of the couch. I think bc maybe from the weight the sensor sensed there were obstacles so it felt it was in a boxed area. We kept it anyways bc of most of our house being hardwood (its great for hardwood) our carpet is high pile threads (thick carpet) so this modle wasn't exactly the best choice. But over time it does the entire carpet now with no mess ups. I think it just needed to map it correctly. I wouldn't recommend for high pile carpets but it does ours just fine now

Review_title: Just the right functionalities I am expecting
Product_review: ¬†I have tried vacuum with random route, don't really work well, most of time spent in wrong places. This one will scan the room and vacuum in parallel lines. It can also detect stairs so won't go down stairs (see my video).

Review_title: does it come with the water tank, mop and mat or no?
Product_review: the box appears to be new when arrived however, when i emptied the contents, it appears the adjustable water tank, mop cloth, and the moisture-proof mat is missing. the manual says it includes these items on the parts list, but my box did not include them. very disappointed, we bought the E2, which is this product's little brother and it comes with all that plus an extra filter and brush. Don't understand why roborock does not include these accessories anymore.

Review_title: Don‚Äôt buy if you want it to work more than once.
Product_review: This is the second time trying to use this vacuum after purchasing it in July. The vacuum kept saying that it was stuck however there was nothing around it. This happened countless of times. Finally I tried to contact support to just return it after learning that they won‚Äôt take it back after 30 days. So I wasted $270 for a product that does not work. Don‚Äôt want waste your money and find a product that will actually vacuum your floors without being babysat like others have described.

So far it's done a great job vacuuming my hardwood floors and area rugs. It doesn't pick up all the dog hairs from the rug, but it does a better job than anticipated. I had a Eufy 11s previously, this vacuum seems to detect objects better, doesn't run into the wall or tables as much, and vacuums better in general. I added command strips to the front to help the bumper last longer since my Eufy got scratched up very easily and I think that limited the sensor's ability to detect objects.

Review_title: my first robo vacuum and doesn't disappoint!!!
Product_review: love this little robot !! very efficient and great and i got it during a sale too ~~ the only downside is the remote control but i don't use it much anyway üòÇ i love how it goes in zigzag motions and really gets every space ~ my mother loves it because she doesn't need to do the vacuuming anymore. the noise is fine and the suction power is great! i named this little robot "rocky" üòÇ awesome purchase. have this for a month already and it's super!

Review_title: Gets tangled and stuck on medium pile carpet
Product_review: I have had this since Mother‚Äôs Day and the side brush is already destroyed! I have a medium pile rug in my living room that it got stuck on and just twisted and twisted onto a piece of carpet. It was so tightly stuck that I actually had to cut my carpet! I was so thrilled to have this until this happened! Then I went online to buy a replacement part and it is $16.00 for jut one. That‚Äôs crazy since I have only had this for 1 week. I would not recommend this for medium pile carpets.

I love this vacuum. It does not replace my regular vacuum because it does not do corners or triangle type corners but it does great on a straight way. It also does under my beds. Its never been so clean under them. I found it works best to confine its space. So I only let it do one room at a time rather than giving it freedom to go whether it wants. I highly recommend it.

Review_title: Choose any new versions. This one sucks.
Product_review: I wanted to love this vacuum and was extremely exited to try. Have Tried. Really Disappointed. It gets stuck on the middle of the room where is nothing around and asks to restart. It cleans room within 45 minutes (I would clean whole house during this time, not just vacuum), it goes to the same spot 3-4 times (what for? Idk) there is 0 logic in its movements. Sending it back. Planning to get s4 or s5
I am pretty technical, the app cannot connect to the vacuum. I tried reset wifi and even uninstalling the app and reinstalling multiple times.

Overall this is a low cost model that works well for the price. I cannot review the mopping function because the water tank is NOT included. Expect to purchase the water tank separately for around $40 and I did have trouble finding it in stock. The app function is very limited, only turns the unit on or off (cannot set cleaning zones etc like some other models).

I love this thing. Most specifically, for carpeted floors. I don't think it does quite as well on laminate/wood/tile, but it is perfect on carpet. I set a schedule for it to clean my first floor daily. It's absolutely perfect for bedrooms where it can easily clean under the bed and dressers. It leaves nice fresh lines just like a regular vacuum would so the carpet looks freshly cleaned. I recommend it to everyone. Totally worth the price.

Review_title: Picks up cat hair and vacuums under beds
Product_review: We are very happy to have our new helper. It works like a drunken sailor, in a pattern that seems to make no sense, but it eventually gets it all done. You do have to watch to be sure you have blocked off chairs that are too low and picked up shag rugs. It takes a couple of uses to know what needs to be removed. After that, take a nap while your house is vacuumed. Must remove filter to dump what it picks up and clean filter and let dry before use again.

Review_title: Works well if you're not worried about it just bouncing around
Product_review: It does do the zig zag pattern which cleans well, and after a year of ownership I am noticing the flaws of this unit. The control app is okay, but very minimal. Could be better. The vaccum cleans fairly well and picks up alot of stuff, but over the last 6 months or so, I have noticed it gets stuck more and more often, to the point now where it rarely completes a cleaning cycle without getting stuck. It also has a hard time returning to its base and doesn't charge unless it is perfectly aligned on the charger which most of the time the robot cannot do on its own. It cleans well for the price, but ultimately I would recommend a more expensive unit with the laser guidance to get a better experience

This is the dumbest ‚Äúrobot‚Äù I‚Äôve ever seen. I‚Äôve had this thing for months and it does not do it‚Äôs job. I have a 2,000 sq ft house and it struggles immensely. Not once has it been able to clean the whole house AND make it back to the charging base. In fact, it struggles to even leave the room where the charging base is located. It will randomly stop and say there is an error when there is NOTHING in the way. And then you have to go re-start it just for it to have an error again within the same room. Also just does not vacuum very well. Misses a decent amount on my hardwood floors. There is no memory, which is fine, but it doesn‚Äôt even consistently move in the right direction. Lots of sporadic movements for no reason. Would NOT recommend.
It's a good buy as I got a good discount..

I can't believe I'm saying this about a vacuum cleaner, but I absolutely adore this! I live in Georgia, it's the middle of summer, and I have 4 adult rescue cats. They shed. A lot. I've only had it a week, but so far I am extremely pleased. It does the work, and I can sit down with a glass of wine and chill. If it washed dishes too, it would be perfect.

Review_title: You get what you pay for.
Product_review: I bought this robovac because, between my four-year-old, our new puppy, and a front yard packed with pine trees, our living room and front hallway are constantly covered in debris. I was sick of vacuuming and sweeping every day. However, this boy did not do the job. She left pine needles, pet fur, and other debris in the living room, and as far as I can tell, didn't even go into the hallway despite the fact that the door between the two spaces in 5+ft wide and she should have found it easily. She spent 10 minutes under the TV cabinet, TWICE, and got hardly anything else. I ran her twice, once on balanced and again on powerful mode, both times to lackluster results. Sending her back and getting a better model from a different brand.

I bought this to replace my older model Shark robot vacuum. The Shark picked up great, but never followed a pattern, and it seemed to be attracted to power cords. I had high hopes for the Roborock because it "did" go back and forth in a pattern to make sure everything was covered. After about a month, it began getting jammed in areas it never had before. (Under the front of the recliner, under the sofa, under the coffee table, etc.) It doesn't get stuck e every time, but it's becoming more frequent. I've only had this vacuum 10 months. I had my Shark 5 years. For the past few months I have been sleeping my floor AFTER the roborock runs because it barely picks up anything. It has also started randomly coming off the charger. Half the time it has to be charged up first when I'm ready to use.

Bought to replace a irobot and so far this thing blows it out of the water. The suction alone makes this vacuum far superior. Love that it vacuums in a actual pattern not some random BS. You can really see it vacuums everything. Gets stuck far less frequently than the irobot did. If my shark robot gets any worse I'll be replacing it with one of these too!

Review_title: Ok. No Alexa / Google Home. No new features.
Doesn't work well on dark surfaces
Product_review: We have a 2-story home. On the second floor, we have gray colored floors with black and brown area rugs. We purchased this product, as it has the feature we needed to not fall off the stairs. However, there was no mention, at the time of our purchase, of it not working on dark colored surfaces. So needless to say, we had to swap the one on our first floor with this one. The problem with our first floor vacuum, is the battery life. We have over 2200 sq ft on the 2nd floor. So the battery life is short. This does work great on the 1st floor because we have light color flooring. I have not used the mop feature as of yet. So my only draw back, don't buy if you have dark flooring

I tried the E4 instead of the S series after reading that the suction power, battery and main other features were on par. I have not been disappointed! The navigation is smart enough, it‚Äôs definitely powerful enough and the mopping attachment leaves my floors feeling wonderfully clean. Only negative is that I cannot set up Alexa control as this is not on the miHome app. It asks for the Roborock app instead which doesn‚Äôt seem to feature the E4 range. So that‚Äôs an app issue. But bottom line if you‚Äôre looking to save a bit of money and not splurge on the Lidar range, and want a solid vacuum the E4 is a winner! I have never had this much fun cleaning :)

Review_title: Gets pet hair and dirt left behind from other vacuum
Product_review: The picture is the first scheduled clean ‚ÄúWallie‚Äù did around my house. Mind you I vacuum at least four days a week to keep up with my dog‚Äôs shedding...but look at all the hair and dirt I wasn‚Äôt getting! I have two bedrooms, the living room, and the kitchen the Roborock has to clean and it took an hour and twenty mins. The vacuum still had 50% battery life after running on ‚Äúbalanced‚Äù (there‚Äôs four suction settings to choose from). Once cleaning was done, emptying the canister was a breeze. Just dump, rinse, let dry for 24 hrs (I stuck the canister and filter over my vent to speed up the drying time‚Äîalways make sure everything is COMPLETELY DRY before popping it back into the vacuum), reinsert the canister and you‚Äôre good to go for the next cleaning! The app gives updates on what the vacuum is doing, allows you to set scheduled cleanings, and puts the vacuum into ‚Äúdo not disturb‚Äù mode that‚Äôs customizable to whatever time you choose. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this purchase after one use. I‚Äôll do another review after putting some hours on the vacuum!

This is the first robot vacuum that I have had. Three of my daughters-in-law have them and loved how they worked. We have two dogs that shed badly and a daily vacuum is necessary. This little guy does the job. It runs in a logical pattern and covers all the floor. No need for me to be constantly vacuuming. I can do my other jobs while it runs.

i purchased this Roborock after buying the Eufy S11. I didn't care for the random bumping and pickup of the Eufy so I elevated for the extra $50 for the Roborock. This is an amazing vacuum! With the optic eye that accurately calculates the floors and picks up everything in it's way, it's amazing. We have a cat and the amount of hair and dirt that it's getting under chairs and other furniture, I am truly amazed. I don't need a robot vacuum that maps the rooms, but this one does. It gets all the corners and the edges and slows down when its approaching an obstacle. It also is able to maneuver my carpet (mid-length). Love this vacuum - I will get another for the upper foor!

Review_title: Works great, but the dock power cable doesn't stay plugged in.
Product_review: I've had this vacuum for three months now and I love it! We run it at least once a week and it does a great job on our hardwood floors and small rugs. It does get hung up on the lip between rooms sometimes, but we live in an older house so they are a bit taller.

Review_title: Several issues right off the bat
Product_review: Great vaccuum/mop combo. Vacuums and mops at the same time. Unfortunately, is not a very smart robot. Gets stuck frequently in the open air (no obstacles whatsoever), which is a downgrade from my $100 eufy vac only. Mop needs to be in ‚Äòspot cleaning‚Äô mode to be effective. For the kitchen, needs to run three times to produce a totally clean floor. Has a really hard time docking, despite 5‚Äô clearance on either side. Joystick mode/remote control doesn‚Äôt really work. If you‚Äôre patient and get to know it‚Äôs idiosyncrasies, it is a really cheap robot vac/mop combo that does the kitchen floor for you!

Does not clean as well as my old Neato. Cleaning pattern is not very organized. Will not circle around table legs and it just bumps into them and bypasses going under the table. The suction is not as good as my old Neato. It goes over my rugs, but then I can shake them out and get lots of dirt I have to sweep up. Would not buy again. You get what you pay for.

Review_title: Save your money and get a smarter one.
Product_review: Not the smartest robot vacuum made, and I wouldn't trust running it while not home, this thing gets itself stuck on everything, and when in a bind it will just go back and forth, but will not turn to get unstuck, my advice is get one that actually learns while it vacuums, this one is like having to keep an eye on a small child running through the house.

Love this vacuum. It doesn't just roam randomly. It goes in an order. I haven't had a chance to get it connected with my phone but as for it's performance, it is excellent and easy to clean. We have two dogs and a cat and this thing cleans up everything. It will get stuck in our higher pile carpet but only occasionally. Nothing to fret about.

Review_title: Much better buy than more expensive name brands
Product_review: This is our 3rd attempt with a robot vacuum. The previous two were different big name brands and this one beats them by a lot! It moves from carpet to hard floors with ease, moves in a pattern so it catches all the dirt and can do the whole 1200 sq feet of our main level with one charge. I also like the option to add on the mop function later.

I love that it cleans in a "z" pattern instead of ping ponging all over the room. This one actually gets every spot. If it runs out of time it will comeba k out and finish once its charged. Were unable to take advantage of the wifi portion since our wifi isn't strong enough but still works okay if I turn it on before bed. The only issue is its having trouble making it back to the charger where I have it. May just have to move it.

The vacuum cleans well. I would say it‚Äôs biggest down fall is it is scratching the piss out of my base boards. It will drive right up to it hit the bump stop and start spinning. And just starts scratching the baseboards.

Review_title: Internet Connectivity Issues, Algorithm Consistently Misses Rooms
Product_review: Reset Router, Connect, five minutes later, connection lost -- repeat ad nauseum, repeat ...

Review_title: Bad product. Broke in less than a year. Bad customer service. Just a bad brand.
Product_review: Didn‚Äôt last more than a year. Side brush rotor doesn‚Äôt even rotate anymore. This is my 2nd vacuum from this company and both broke so easily. Worst of all customer service is so condescending. Goes all out in every communication to tell you how the product warranty would cover this or that if I did this wrong or did that wrong. Great way to stand by your product.

Review_title: Will not download CH app but good Robo vac
Product_review: You must download MiHome app to your phone, made in Beijing CH. I just taught my Robo vac to clean my downstairs without any app. Will not put CH app on my phone. Excellent Robo vac.

Review_title: Poor performing and equally supported product
Product_review: ZERO STARS IF I COULD SUBMIT IT-Bought this product in August of 2020. It has been an extremely disappointing experience from the beginning. The manual is useless. Product description stated that you could program it which cannot be done. You cannot get adequate support for it when you request it. The only means of support is a email response with vague answers to my questions. IT has stopped working after only 8 months. I don't write many reviews but the miserable experience with this product has prompted me to submit this one. When shopping for robot vacuum cleaners, I strongly recommend that you do consider this product or any other one made by this manufacturer.
The vacuum itself worked well. The side sweepers didn‚Äôt seem to do much. It kept getting stuck under our furniture. We ended up returning it.

Review_title: Will not attach to the MiHome app or wifi
Product_review: This vacuum works well, but is pretty useless in the overall scheme of todays smart devices. MiHome App will not find the device, won't attach to WiFi...and has no instructions of how to use with Alexa. Have been on the phone with customer service 2x, but very difficult to understand and were no help at all. Only emailed me a copy of the book that came with it. Have been planning to return for refund, but am 2 days past the return window. Guess I am stuck... Any ideas of how to get the MiHome app to find it?

Review_title: My first vacuum robot and a really good one so far
Product_review: This was my first vacuum robot. I call him Wall-E like the Pixar movie and one of my favorites. This cute little robot has impressed me so far, it‚Äôs cleaned my place very well. My apartment is mostly carpet so if you have a carpet apartment this will do the job pretty well. It‚Äôs missed a small spot or two on each cleaning cycle but you won‚Äôt even notice usually. I love him going up and down in a very orderly fashion all over my apartment and he‚Äôs very stubborn to make sure no corner is left unclean. The integration with the app is flawless and it‚Äôs also shown me a very detailed map of my house. Wall-E finds the charging dock after every session or when low on battery so no issues there. Overall I would recommend this product.

Review_title: Not bad but you could do better
Product_review: I was really excited about using this vacuum and got it for a great deal on here, but it has really underperformed my expectations. We have two kids and two dogs, and therefore quite a bit of dirt and dust from outside, especially on our hardwoods. We've chosen to use it without the Wifi/app, and maybe that would make a difference, but this machine does NOT operate in any consistent pattern -- at least at my house. It does do better on carpet and with ZERO obstacles in the way, but even without obstacles it will stop mid-room and go the other way, missing major portions of the room and therefore leaving dirt, dust, etc. I thought it would circle back to get those places, but it almost never does; it will say "finished cleaning" and struggle back to the dock. All that to say, this is not a terrible vacuum, but I wish I would have spent a little more for a better product.

We have had her now for months and I love it! I have rearranged the furniture on her twice and she figures it out. My floors are clean all the time. The run time and battery are great the dust bin is a good size. Is she sucks up a charger cord for example she will stop and ask for help sometimes she gets stuck under my kitchen counters but can usually get out by herself. She handles my heavier bathroom rugs well too.

Review_title: Does not live up to the hype
Product_review: Got this product with high hopes and it has been a let down. Does work okay on carpets but not nearly well as expected on hard floors. Gets stuck on every floor rug we have and has to be picked up and moved. Seems to run a lot in the same places and misses others. Don't plan on watching TV while it is running, too noisy. When you tell it to go home it just seems to keep working for another 30 minutes. With as much as I have to fix it while running I cannot trust it to run by itself and quite frankly I could clean my own floors better in less than half the time.

Review_title: Great job on hardwood floor with pet hair!
Product_review: I did a lot of research before purchasing a robot vacuum and this one checked all the boxes for me. Affordable price for what it does. Efficient smart tracking and not random ping-ponging around. Optional quiet modes. Does great on pet hair ( I have 3 jack russell terriers). I run this little robot daily to pick up all the pet hair. Does a great job for the $200 price point. I don't feel it is lacking in any area really.

¬†Couldn't be happier with this unit. Doesn't miss an inch. Gets into hard to reach areas and can pivot around the tightest corners. (See video) He does it entire first floor in about an hour and then find his way back to the charger. I then receive a map on the app that retraces his movements. Really cool! Highly recommend!

This thing outperforms my in-laws' iRobot Roomba. The Roomba doesn't clean in an ordered way. It just seems to bounce around randomly for a while, then pushes its dock away while trying to return to it. This Roborock cleans in a logical back and forth pattern and has no trouble returning to its dock.
My wife loves our Roborock Vaccum. It has great suction and given time all the floors will be clean. My wife named her new vacuum which wsa a Christmas present - Spide.

This is - besides the horrible Alexa integration- an outstanding product. The bot navigates and maps well and can overcome most traps that disable other bots and that‚Äôs a credit to whomever developed the AI. Got it on sale. Price is good even if not on sale for a bot that works this well. Alexa integration is awful, or at least seems to be. Not much luck linking it to Google Home, either. YMMV.

Money well spent! We have 4 dogs who all shed. I've set the vacuum up to start every morning and now we have nice clean floors every day. Now if I could just get it to vacuum the furniture! The only negative thing about it is that it sometimes gets confused and seems to forget how the house is laid out which means it vacuums some areas over and over again as well as forgets where the docking station is, but these are minor annoyances that can be overcome with a little human intervention.

Review_title: No ability to map despite its description
Product_review: The E4 does NOT work with the Roborock app. It only works with the MI Home app despite what the description says. The MI Home app did not allow for mapping so I could not select rooms or areas to clean. The cleaning it did was fine but I bought it specifically for the non-existant mapping.. The Roborock website has a disclaimer that this unit only works with MI Home but Amazon doesn't have the disclaimer.

This is what happened after owning this thing for 24 hours. It sucked up stuff around my house I had no idea I was there. As long as you pick up chords and other items off the floor first, this thing will save you so much work. It does take a while though- over an hour in my house. However, that means it's being thorough!! Cleans my hardwoods and carpets equally well.

Not as good as the other well known brand. Left plenty of loose dirt and stuff around edges here and there, under cabinets, e.t.c. Haven't tried mop yet. App doesn't allow for cleaning specific areas of the map. There is no map. Can't really designate a high traffic cleaning area. I thought this was going to clean better than the pinball machine robot vacuum, but not so.

Review_title: Overall, definitely the best robot vacuum I've had.
Product_review: We really like our Roborock robot vacuum! We have had some of the competitors, and most of them simply don't navigate the space well and end up missing lots of areas. This one has been great and seems to get up a decent amount of dirt. Not standard vacuum level, but pretty good!

Review_title: How did I live without this?!
Product_review: I sweep, vaccuum, and mop regularly.....so I was absolutely SHOCKED at how much dirt and pet hair this little vaccuum was able to pick up. It maps the house and vaccuums in straight lines instead of bumping around aimlessly like other brands. I live the feature to set automatic cleans and schedulimg. I would HIGHLY recommend against other popluar namebrand robot vacs.

This is the best robot vacuum I‚Äôve ever seen. It picks up everything‚Äî- cat hair, dirt, dust, litter, etc! We‚Äôre obsessed. I love that it can be controlled by an app!!!! We had a Eufy brand before and it would just blow cat fur around and didn‚Äôt work well on our area rugs at all. This vacuum does it all!!!! I HIGHLY recommend !!!

Review_title: So far I really like this
Product_review: I've had it now for over a month and use it every morning. When I first got it, I was worried about setting it up by what other reviews said. I had no issues at all. Takes about an hour to do the area I want and only uses half the battery life, if that. I have it set on Max too! I do have issues with it getting stuck under a recliner, but I just ordered the magnetic strips which is in a roll (13ft) for only $16. Can't wait for that to come in. Based on my experience with it so far, I would recommend it.

Not only is this a fifth of the cost of a Roomba it also works faster and has just as much suction. It‚Äôs much quieter than the Roomba. It‚Äôs not as powerful in terms of being able to get up on a high rug for cleaning but that‚Äôs the only thing. Very happy with this product. The floors look polished.

This thing is serious. We have a pretty big area to cover, and though it kind of does the spaces erratically, it managers to get every single room and corner. I LOVE this stupid vacuum. It makes my life so much easier.

Very happy with roborock overall. Does a great job of getting our dog hair up but doesn‚Äôt do what I‚Äôd consider deep cleaning especially when it comes to the mop. Happily have it run vacuuming 2x a week with a kid and a 55lbs dog, mopping once a week. I will mop myself every other week for a deeper clean. It would be nice if it could just clean the kitchen and avoid mopping rugs; it doesn‚Äôt map the house but for the price point I‚Äôm satisfied with how much it helps clean

It's really nice for the price, but it is stupid. It's not like the way more expensive ones that create a map of your home and you can set no go zones. It gets stuck quite a bit, but it does well and having it take over the day to day vaccuming has be awesome. If you want a starter smart vac I reccommend. Plus I bought the mood attachment for my hard surfaces. It's just a useful tool for the low price.

Review_title: Good Robot Vacuum & Great Customer Service
Product_review: Works good and picks up just as much stuff as any other robot vacuum. Drives in straight lines rather than randomly which helps it clean faster. Had an issue where trim was being marked by the robot vacuum, but was quickly contacted by Roborock. My issues corrected and any concerns I had will were taken care of. Have since increased my review to five stars because of the customer service.

Review_title: Exceeded my expectations for my 1st robot vac
Product_review: Exceeded my expectations for a robot vac at this price point (black Friday deal for $190). Been using it for about 2 months. After fixing a few areas it got stuck (under low coffee table shelf) it is now very reliable, quiet enough (although you will not want to watch TV with it in the room) and does a good job of daily cleaning of crumbs and cat hair.

I've had the Roborock for 2 months now, no issues so far. I have all hard wood floors in my apartment (711 sq ft) & it takes about an hour to clean. Even after an hour it has about 75% battery left so should be able to handle a good sized house. It will get stuck if it sucks up a cord or shoe lace, so be weary.
If you have long hair and are tired of cutting it off other robot vacuums, this is the one to buy.

So far, it has proven to be extremely powerful & thorough. It works on a grid & senses objects, gently going around or touching before turning back into the grid. My only problem is connecting it to my WiFi. I will have to get someone who knows more about the technical end to help me there.

Once you get it paired up, and fully charged, its ready to go.. I would suggest to anyone who is reading this to check the collection bin every 30 mins or so of operation because it fills up quick! The only problem i've had so far (might be something im doing) is in my basement it does all the spaces (including the bathroom) except for a roughly 10x12 area.. Seems to ignore it. Keep up with general maintenance which is conveniently stored in the Mi Home app, and i think for the price point this Roborock E4 is a winner!

Absolutely false marketing. It markets as if it has mapping system while it cleans but it doesn‚Äôt. Nor can you feel it to clean a specific room. The only time you can see the map is after. The suction is not all that good and a little bit of elevation in the floor suck as going from carpet to hard floor and it gets stuck

The vacuum is amazing. The mop is less so. It does ok in you let it mop every day then you only need a good mopping maybe once a week. But if you miss a day or two it can‚Äôt really clean a dirty floor.

I did end up returning it because the app that it tells you to download is completely unusable and not user-friendly. It was driving me crazy. Took a while for it to learn my house and did have good suction on hard floors and high pile, soft carpet. It's good for its value but beware of the app compatibility.

Review_title: Doesn‚Äôt clean the messy areas well!
Product_review: This is an ok vacuum cleaner. There are many out there that gets the work done in half the price. It‚Äôs little on the noisy side and doesn‚Äôt clean messy areas well like kitchen. If there is stain on the kitchen floor, it won‚Äôt mop it well either. If you are looking for a vacuum and mopper for not so messy areas, it would work.

I love this little vacuum! It‚Äôs made my life so much easier!ü§ó Got or for a great price! It vacuums a long time before docking to charge! I‚Äôm always amazed at how much it picks up each time! I run it several times a day because we have small kids and it helps me out so much!

¬†Robot vacuum did not work as advertised. It could not get from my hardwood floor onto the rug. I tried to use Spot clean mode and it wandered around the house. I had to place random furniture around my rug to get it to stay on the rug but it‚Äôs still tried to go out of the area. Very sad I was hopeful, Especially considering the price

I waited 5 months to write this review. This vacuum has been amazing. I've only used my regular vacuum 2-3 times since I received my robot vacuum. And I almost never have to sweep either. This is my first experience with one of these and I expected there to be something less than desirable about it. I thought maybe it would get stuck a lot, or stop working, or not work well at all. But to the contrary, it has exceeded my expectations. It works exactly the way the ad claims. This is honestly one of the best purchases I've ever made. Highly recommend.

The way this thing is programmed to vacuum along walls is dumb and it will leave black marks all over your baseboards and door frames. I had to put felt around mine and now have to go around and scrub all of the marks off of the baseboards. Suction is good, it's but not worth the damage. My old neato did not leave hardly any marks on baseboards.
This is a great little work horse. I love that I can start it, leave the house and return to a clean house. I have laminate floors through most of the house with tile in one bathroom.

Review_title: Excellent product, does a fantastic job
Product_review: Highly recommend this product for hardwood floors, carpet, and vinyl floors. Well worth the money!!

Review_title: Does not work with Google Assistant or Alexa
Product_review: PROS: The standalone app works well and so does the robot suction - it is very strong and powerful. I have low pile and medium pile carpets and hardwood flooring and it works well with all three. It takes about 1min/ sq. metre and I have a timer set up to start cleaning at a fixed time every day. I love that it cleans in a z-pattern rather than a random pattern.

This vacuum/robot works very well. It picked up TONS of cat hair. I love how it cleans under beds and cabinets, places a regular vacuum doesn't reach easily. It switches from tile to hardwood to carpet with ease and navigates around the house pretty well. It's quite enough that it doesn't frighten the cats, but they are a bit wary of it.

Review_title: Great at cleaning, but will not connect to Alexa
Product_review: This roomba is fantastic at cleaning. However, it won‚Äôt connect to Alexa. After reading a bunch of reviews on the actual Alexa app for this ‚Äúskill‚Äù, many users commented the same thing. For me, that‚Äôs pretty much a deal breaker. We are implementing a lot of smart devices in our home to be controlled by Alexa, and since this one won‚Äôt connect, I am returning it. Still giving 4 stars however because I was impressed with its cleaning ability.

Love this Vacuum!!!! It gets caught on things which is normal for these types of vacuums, so I always just make sure things are tucked away before I start the cleaning. It is so great to keep up with animals that shed and cat litter!! my house feels so clean now :)

Got the vaccum and couldn't believe how much dirt, dust and dog hair it picks up. We programmed it to run twice a day for a while because it is so good at picking up. Imagine having a vacuum running two hours a day in your house. It does get stuck on things quite often but, still worth the investment. I'm already looking into getting a mop so our floor cleaning will be mostly automatic. It is taking about an hour for the vacuum to do a 2800 square foot home with mostly wood floors and area rugs.

Review_title: Great investment--thinking of getting a second one for the upstairs floor in my home!
Product_review: Great investment! My first and only robotic vacuum with wet vac attachment. Very pleased with it so convenient and very thorough. It's a little loud but I have bamboo floors and tile which it works great on, also works surprisingly well on my carpet which is a lower pile white shag. Love how it goes back to it's charging chamber. Works well with dog hair which is great since I have three. I use hot water and two caps of Fabulous in the "mop" chamber.
