I‚Äôve recently sent them request for assistance because the unit will not connect to the internet thus I cannot access the vacuum through the app and adjust any setting on the vacuum. I continue to get NO response from this company. The mop feature on the vacuum is worthless. It does nothing and is not worth any extra money. The vacuum itself does clean the floor well but does get stuck or confused where I have to reorientate/move the unit which becomes extremely annoying. I turn it on (and I have to do it by pressing a button on the machine since like I said it will not connect to the internet) and go to the store and when I get home, expecting a clean floor, only to discover the vacuum got itself stuck somewhere. I‚Äôve cleaned the vacuum throughly on a regular basis and do all the recommend maintenance to the machine but still have issues. I‚Äôve also reset the machine several times trying to fix the connection issue but nothing works.

Review_title: Constant Error Messages, Slowed Down After about 6 Months of Use
Product_review: We were excited to see this at such a low price last November (2020), which is about half what it's listed for currently. I would never pay almost 300 bucks for this device, though. For that, you would be better off with one of the big brand names. After using the robot vacuum two times per week for about 6 months on the bottom floor of our house‚Äîwhich is about 900sqft, half low-pile carpet and half brick. The brick area does not get cleaned nearly as well by the Roborock E4 as it does on rugs)‚ÄîI get a notification through the app within five minutes that the strainer is blocked/filter is wet. We've kept the device clean, washed the filter and let it dry for a couple of days before putting back in, and wiped off the bottom, as well as removed any debris or hair from the brushes frequently. But I have to empty the dustbin and knock out the filter about 4-5 times per use while it continues to tell me something is wrong.

Review_title: Customer Center is very, very helpful.
Product_review: Our roborock is named Ibby( I‚Äôll be back)I love having him! He goes where I have an upright vacuum that cannot go. I can control him from my phone, I can set him to work from the hairdressers.

Review_title: All you working moms, give yourself a break from the vacuum!
Product_review: I have three dogs and a newborn, so vacuuming daily or every other day was my part of my routine. For my birthday, I really wanted to try a robovac but they are a little pricey. I saw this one on an Amazon flash sale and asked for it for my birthday. (And my fianc√© bought it, YAY)

This was a Christmas present and probably my favorite ever! I will start by saying I have messy little kids and very hairy dogs so it had it work cut out for it. It did a pretty awesome just both upstairs and down and I believe it is by far the best you can get in the price range. It did well on my carpet as long as it was kept up with, otherwise it required a second pass, and did amazing on my tile. It is really good about getting out of tight spaces and working around to get EVERYTHING. It could not climb up on my high pile rug, but that was to be expected. The vacuum is great, and I couldn't believe how much it picked up even when it was run every day ü§¢. That being said I did end up returning it to upgrade to the S4 max because I wanted the ability to have it avoid certain areas and map out rooms. Overall if you don't need smart maping functions and the advanced control features this is an awesome little vaccum with a pretty good sized dust bin!

This little guy is amazing. The navigation is so much smarter than the previous generations of robot vacuums. The mopping function is amazing if you do it every day or every other day. Otherwise there‚Äôs too much dirt/dust for a good clean. The instructions say to use only water, no cleaning products. So I spray a little bit on the floor before setting this guy loose and that does it. My house has never felt so clean, I love love love this thing.

The suction power, bin capacity, and coverage of this vacuum are actually impressive. The problem is that it consistently loses the wifi signal and needs to be factory reset in order to do anything. Once reset, it will work for between 1 and 3 days and then - nothing. And I'm talking in the middle of cleaning this will happen. Then, have to factory reset, set up wifi, and redo any timers or schedules that you want to set. The stupid thing won't even charge if it loses the wifi. It has previously returned to the dock to charge, lost its wifi connection, and sat on the dock for days without actually charging. Then when I go to reset it, have to fully charge before it can clean.

After doing hours of research on the best robot vacuum under $300 my partner and I decided on this one. We named him Owen and he has not disappointed. We live in a one bedroom with some carpeting and a cat who both sheds a lot and drags litter pellets everywhere. This vacuum has made it excessively easy to stay on top of cleaning. It holds a surprisingly large amount in the dustbin and the battery life is great. The fact that it goes in a predictable pattern is really nice, and there is even a joystick feature on the app where you can tell it where to go. Sometimes if something is in it's way it will skip a room, but this is easily remedied by clearing the path and restarting the vacuum. Only downside is that our cat is still mortified every time we turn him on.

We got it as a Christmas present to outselves. We are trying to use it now and it won‚Äôt set the App up to use it. Have a few hrs of trying many different things I started reading about the App. The App has bad reviews and most negative. We will next call but if that doesn‚Äôt do it we will return. The bad thing about returning is got it on sale day before Christmas. It was on sale so if I wanted to exchange nothing is on sale now.

Review_title: This is very reliable and just all around really great.
Product_review: I have had a version of this Roborock vacuum for about a year and a half, use it sometimes every day.

Review_title: Great in comparison to my other robovac but...
Product_review: I cannot get this to connect to my internet for the life of me. I would like to get it integrated into the app but no matter how close I am to my router it says "bring device closer to router" and times out when it's trying to get connected. If someone has found a solution to this that would be great!

Review_title: Doesn‚Äôt work like it claims to.
Product_review: This automatic floor cleaner machine gets stuck on everything. It fills up so fast and doesn‚Äôt pick up the bare minimal on hard floors. One little hair ball and it‚Äôs full. I would of been better off sticking with a broom.

Review_title: A little dumb, but gets the job done
Product_review: I went in thinking that the navigation for this unit would be a little bit better as, it has trouble finding its home and sometimes cleans over one room multiple times while not going down a hallway to get to other rooms (without giving it an hour to do so), but the suction power and cleaning capability are bar none. Just don't expect this to rival the smart mapping of the S6.

After going through about a quarter of a relatively featureless room, this machine stopped with "remove obstacle" error. This has been repeated throughout several tests I did in two different rooms. I also did not find its way back home properly when it stopped cleaning due to low-battery. Very disappointed about the quality of navigation, which is critical for any robot cleaner.

Review_title: It works exceptionally well.  Love it!
Product_review: We have two dogs. No more tuff's of fur anywhere!
Bought this as a housewarming gift for son and his wife. They have dark wood floors so need this vacuum on a daily basis. They love it, can't stop raving about it.
Worked fine for two months, then it became erratic in performance. Would not recommend.

It gets confused. I find it going back and forth in circles. Doesn't clean up against walls. Misses Alot of spots. It needs another side attachment to get dirt on other side of unit. One side attachment doesn't cut it. Buy something else.
My only complaint - the vac cannot find its way back to the dock. Otherwise, love the little guy. Seriously consider if you have dogs.
Terrible company Terrible customer service Terrible product .
I got this for Christmas and it‚Äôs absolutely changed my
The performance for the price is a great deal. Vacuum is solid and dependable.

Vacuum was great when it was working. My dock stopped charging the vacuum so I contacted the company. They wouldn‚Äôt do anything about it and wanted to charge me $120 to ‚Äúrepair‚Äù my vacuum. Oh well I‚Äôd rather go a different brand.

My Robby is meticulous and very thorough. He reaches all nicks and crannies without assistance. He stays on course and does not get stuck or deviate from his goal. My bare feet are loving the clean surface throughout my house. Best invention ever!!!
¬†1 month in and working great so far. Very happy with it.
I can control it with Alexa, really like it a lot.

Review_title: Works great, but can be easier to pair.
Product_review: Works great. However it was very difficult to pair it with the app. Wasn't easy to pair with Alexa either.
Love our "rosie" she cleans well and is quick. Would buy again!
Excellent , I am so happy

Review_title: Has almost totally taken over all vacuuming in our house!
Product_review: ¬†Wow have robot vacuums come way down in price and way up in features. I have used some of the "dumber" random bounce navigation robot vacs in the past and those work fine in smaller areas but if you want multiple rooms cleaned, they just don't cut it. Because of their random nature they are way more inefficient and usually unable to get back to the dock to charge. But this Roborock E4 is amazing. The fact that it can map out where it has been means it knows where the dock is and how to get back to it. This alone is what sets it apart from other vacs in this price range. Also, because of the way it maps it can clean in a much more structured way like a human would. It systematically goes back and forth making it's way across the room getting every inch. Even when it doesn't seem to finish one room before it moves onto another don't worry because it will get back to it before it considers itself "done". It also appears to do a perimeter pass as a final step to make sure it's gotten everything. How do I know? When it's done you can see the cleaning history and view a map of what it cleaned. It's crazy that they are able to have it work like this on a vac w/o laser navigation and at this price point. The only thing it can't do that the higher model one‚Äôs w/laser nav can do is setup "no-go" zones. It supposedly has Alexa support, but I couldn't test that as I have an all Google house. Google assistant is not supported at this time but hoping it will be at some point as some of their other products do. I also have an E3 and I would say the claims of it being 10% faster and more efficient are true. The app is also easy to use. It comes with a moping attachment that you fill with water and connect to the vac. It will then mop as it vacuums. The only issue with this is if you have rugs that you don‚Äôt want if mopping over you can‚Äôt stop it from going over those because it does not have the no-go zone feature of more expensive robo vacs. The dustbin is huge for robo vac standards and the brush never seems to get anything tangled in it. The suction is also really strong. Overall, for the price this thig is amazing. Because it can plan it‚Äôs path and then find it‚Äôs way back to the dock to charge it is head and shoulders better than the random navigation vacs normally in this price range. Definitely worth it!

Review_title: Not Quite to the level of a "Smart" Vacuum
Product_review: We have been using Eufy 11s vacuums at two different locations for a few years. The Eufy 11s vacuums proved to be good vacuums with strong suction but they don't have navigation and basically bounce around the rooms randomly until they run out of battery power and then they find the charging station to recharge. This method works but some areas are cleaned too much and others are sometimes missed.

Review_title: Roomba 675 and Roborock E4 Comparison! Roborock wins hands down!!
Product_review: Not bad overall! Both are in the same price range. The Roomba 675 pros: good quality, well packaged, great on carpets due to the dual brush design, easy to clean, very user friendly app, and it easily got over my doorway saddles which are about 3/4 in high. Cons: Its quite loud if its on hardwood, on carpets its fine. Very poor suction on hard surfaces, but it does eventually get the job done just takes a bunch of passes. Doesn't clean as efficiently in a pattern as the Roborock, it just bounces around. If it gets accidentally bumped while charging, it doesn't return to station as easily and quietly as the E4 does. Battery life much lower compared to the Roborock E4 about 2x. In conclusion its really not a bad robovac. I managed to get the Roborock E4 on sale off amazon for $180 and it performed better than the Roomba in my opinion. The roborock does feel a bit cheaper in quality but not by much. The app is a bit harder to use, but it has 3x the suction and nearly 2x the battery life. Also, due to the gyroscope built in, it actually cleans more efficiently in a pattern, rather than just random bumping around. In conclusion I stuck with the Roborock E4 and returned the Roomba 675. But if you have alot of carpeting, the Roomba 675 wouldn't be a bad choice. Hope this helped if you are in between those two.

I love this little guy! I‚Äôm so happy I finally caved and got one for myself. I have six animals - 2 dogs, 4 cats and felt like I was constantly sweeping the dang floors. I have some degenerative disc issues that prevent this from being something I‚Äôd like to do often as it needs doing (relatively pain free, anyway). Now, I just run this little dude when I get home from work. I‚Äôve used a Roomba brand at my office and can say this one is way smarter, had better suction and a larger dustbin.
I bought 2 of the E4 robots to replace an "uncoordinated" Deebot, which drove me insane, as there was no cleaning pattern.

I got this and used it once. It‚Äôs on the dock and won‚Äôt charge now. It‚Äôs literally unusable. This is the worst thing I‚Äôve purchased off Amazon in some time. Completely disappointed. Also, messages their support and no one has responded at all.

Review_title: I like it but it has cons
Product_review: So I have had this vacuum for a good 9 months now and I never gave it a review but I decided now is the time I give one, first off, this vacuum does go on a random track instead of what is advertised, I have to pick it up just to get it to get the other side of my living room which isn‚Äôt even big but then it misses things because it doesn‚Äôt clean in that ‚ÄúS‚Äù pattern like it says because for some reason mine vacuums in a random pattern. Then I always get the filter warning of it being wet or needs to be cleaned literally after I have already cleaned it. And it also gives me an error that there are objects in the way when there isn‚Äôt even anything around the vacuum. I do still really like this vacuum as it was relatively inexpensive for what it does and what‚Äôs on the market and I like that I don‚Äôt have to vacuum myself which I hate doing! But I do find some cons in it which is why I won‚Äôt give it 5 stars. I also bought the mop attachment which literally says not to use cleaner in the mop canister or it could ruin the plastic so I don‚Äôt know how effective it is at cleaning (I spray my floors with cleaner now because of that warning)

I can only comment on the installation and setup of this item, which sucked. It may be a perfectly good vacuum, as several other reviewers say. Unfortunately, I never got that far despite spending an entire afternoon trying to get my Roborock E4 working.

Review_title: Great performance with plenty of battery power
Product_review: I am very happy with the performance of my Roborock vacuum. This unit is a vast improvement over my previous robot vacuum ‚Äì one that ping-ponged around the room and would only last 45 minutes before depleting the battery. I returned that other robot vacuum and purchased the Roborock vacuum for not much more money. The Roborock cleans each room in a predictable back and forth pattern, with more than enough power to clean each area of my home ‚Äì even after an hour of cleaning, the unit still had about 50% battery remaining. It also does a much better job of cleaning up the long hair from my girlfriend than my previous unit. I clean the filter after each use (about twice a week, sometimes more) although could go longer between cleanings.

Review_title: AMAZING SUCTION, BATTERY LIFE & PATTERN MEMORY!!
Product_review: ¬†I wish this Lil vac came with a separate remote control. But that's my only wish for this Lil vac.

Review_title: Not worth the price for lasting so little
Product_review: So I have a E4 and a E25 from roborock. After my robot dying in the middle of my room everyday for a few days, without going back to the dock to charge, I decided to contact customer service. They said it was very likely either the motherboard or battery with an estimated of $120 cost for the repair and it was out of warranty (only for 1 year and it‚Äôs been a little over 2). So really. I understand it is an estimate but either way. I‚Äôm not only upset about the fact that in less than 3 years the unit is already malfunctioning almost to the point it‚Äôs useless and should be thrown in the trash, but that I would have to pay for the cost of repair. Finally, if that isnt enough, the estimated price for repair is almost like buying a new unit. And by the way, I have an ILife as well and when I had to replace the motherboard, they covered all the costs of repair with a fantastic customer service help even though it was way past the warranty time - guess why? It shouldn‚Äôt be acting that way already and they admitted.

Review_title: Decent vacuum but mop function disappointing
Product_review: ¬†This is a decent vacuum but I expected more from the mopping option. Here are the pros and cons

This is so far a great robot vac for the price range. I had no issues connecting to my phone or wifi. It can sometimes get stuck under the fridge door or the edge of my couch but I run it while I'm at home since I have pets and have heard horror stories of robot vacs dragging pet accidents around the house. I do run it daily and have to empty the bin about every 4-7 days. The battery never gets too low and it cleans approx 67m2 in about 80min or less. It does sometimes get what I think is lost but I do move things around so it could just be the software remapping the area. Would recommend this vaccum.

I love this vacuum. I have only had it about a week, but I really do love it. It keeps my hardwood & stone floors clean. I purchased it because my wood/stone floors show so much more dirt and grime than my upstairs carpet. I really needed something to tide me over between vacuums. This did the trick. It took about 3 times for the mapping to actually map all the different rooms, but once it did, it easily navigates all the areas in my house. It ever learned to go between and under the bar stools at by breakfast bar rather than just around them. The suction is good and cleans everything very well. I just now purchased the separate water tank and mop cloths and will update the review once I use them. The app is good. The remote doesn't work very well, so I just let it clean using the automated mapping. It is an excellent value over more expensive brands and a great beginner robot vacuum.

Bought this vacuum cleaner few months back and waited to write the review. I really love it as it cleans well and reaches place where regular vacuum can't. I can use this regularly any time without exhausting myself, that's for me is value of money. That being said I do not have kids or pets, so I can't tell if it's effective for them. I use it mostly on alternate days and that keeps my apartment clean. I love how I don't have to worry about switching modes from carpet to hardwood or vice-versa. I don't think using it regularly made any changes to my electricity bill. So all good stuff.

For the price I paid, this is a decent little vacuum. I just wish it wasnt so dumb. His name is Carl. And while he has become a part of our family, Carl is very special. He does clean well when he isn't stuck. And there is the problem. If there is a place he gets stuck, you can move him to the other end of the house and before you know it he has migrated right back to that spot. When his wheels become suspended, or he gets under furniture, he doesn't go the other way. He will try and try again like the little robot that could...Except that he can't.
I am so disappointed. Day 1, I was excited and optimistic. Now it's day 5, and I'm regretting throwing the box away so soon because now I don't know how to return this piece of junk.

Review_title: Takes 7 hours to vacuum one room
Product_review: ¬†I‚Äôm an experienced robot vacuum owner. My previous one quit working after 7 years and is no longer available. I believed the ratings of this one and took a chance. If I had not been caring for a family member this would have been returned in the allowed time frame. The purpose of a robot vacuum is to vacuum. Period. I can vacuum faster but I desired a device that could complete the task while I was elsewhere in the house. The video shows the vacuum in my front room that has a clear area. The half of the room to the right that has been vacuumed took 90 minutes. Yes, an hour and a half. I took the video 49 minutes ago and it has cleaned about another foot. Yesterday, on a full charge, it took 7 hours to vacuum the master bedroom. As an experienced owner, I knew to have things picked up and moved out of the way. I have no idea why this highly rated device is disfunctional. I‚Äôll keep looking on Woot or eBay for someone to sell the old Neato model that I had.
updated one additional star 1/24/21: the suction is great and it has an extra large collection bin. still other things disappointing remain as below.

Review_title: You won't believe what's in your carpet!
Product_review: So yuck! This definitely pulls out stuff you don't know is there!. The image above was just after a very short run of less than 5 minutes. I had it running at max suction. I have 2 dogs and questioned if they would be unsettled by this robot but they pay no attention to it. Even on max suction it run pretty quietly. Now it does seem to get a bit confused when returning to the dock, but maybe that I moved it while it was running. You can see the lines where is has ran on the carpet just like when you use a regular vacuum. I would have to say I'm delighted with this purchase should help to keep the dog hair down between regular vacuuming. It was easy to set up on wifi and is easily controlled through the app. I would definitely recommend this to anyone interested in a robot vacuum.

I loved the suction and how much dirt and dog hair this unit picked up. (I have husky's so there is A LOT of hair) However, this unit was always confused and never could figure out which way to go. More often than not, I would find the bot cleaning the same 2 ft section over and over and over and over again, humping the wall or showing an error because it thinks there is something blocking its path (when there was NOTHING around). I literally would have to restart the unit 20 times (using the app - which was handy) until the battery would eventually need to be recharged. Also, the poor little bot could never find its way back to the dock. I used this unit for two full weeks hoping it would figure out its new home.....but nope. Only 1 time did it find its own way home. (Even a blind squirrel finds a nut once in a while) I have medium pile carpet and perhaps that was part of the problem. It seemed to do okay on my kitchen tile. It never stayed in my kitchen though.....It would always b-line for the living room just to work in a small random section of carpet. As badly as I wanted this to work......little bot is going back.

Review_title: Love it! Makes a mom's job a little easier!
Product_review: I've only had this vacuum for a few days (about a week) and I love it. I had a shark robot previously that I disliked but this one is great! It's so quiet and changes suction between carpet and tile. It takes a little bit for it to get it's pattern down but it does eventually. We probably have too many things in the way which is most likely the reason for that.

Review_title: Disappointed said it would work with Alexa but it does not.
Product_review: Works nice but does not do what I expected it to do I wanted something that would interact with Alexa and it doesn‚Äôt it does hook up to my phone with an app but as I said it does not work with Alexa as they said thinking about sending it back it does come with the mop attachment have not used them yet but as I said I am very disappointed in this.

Review_title: It works!  I would buy this one again.
Product_review: NO issues with function. Cleans way better than me.... Dust bin is hard to empty and fills fast. To empty, you need to pull a filter out and there's no easy way to grasp the filter to remove it. All of these types of things have small dust bins, but at least make them easier to empty then.

Review_title: Had trouble pairing it to phone
Product_review: I have yet been able to pair this vacuum to my phone. I even moved it right next to the wifi and it still doesn‚Äôt connect. I tried different areas in my house, I tried googling what to do and nothing. So right now I just turn the vacuum on and it vacuums whatever it wants. It also bumps against everything and got very scratched up on the first use, so I doubt I can even return it.

This is the 4th or 5th brand I have tried and it works the best. It sits higher than most so it can't go under some furniture and gets wedged from time to time, but it runs on the schedule I set and eventually finds the charging station. I sometimes have to tell it to start the clean cycle again because it will think it is done cleaning way to early. With the app, I can control it remotely and getting status notifications is nice.

Review_title: Works well until something goes wrong
Product_review: Our first few cleaning sessions with this robot vacuum were promising. It handled hardwood floors, tiles, and a low-pile rug easily, and apart from some issues with the app (especially the necessary permissions), we were happy with its cleaning abilities and overall usability.

I have an S6 pure as well as this E4 and am very impressed with its abilities. Even though it does not have the lidar, it does work like a vacuum with one. The mapping is very efficient and does not go over places more than once. Its very thorough and picks up everything from the floor. It returns the map of the area it cleaned right after the cleaning cycle. The cleaning time is also almost close to the lidar models(may be about 10% longer). The battery life is also great. Overall I highly recommend this vaccum. Its a great deal for the price.

I have to start out by saying mine came in the mail damaged. The front was all scratched up and when I tried to use it, it would just go in circles instead of the zig-zag patter it is supposed to go to complete the room cleaning. I was upset with that right off the bat. I contacted customer service and they told me there was nothing they could do for me. The reasoning they gave me for this was because my rugs were too thick apparently. In the description of the item it said that the vacuum does well with medium pile rugs, which is what I have and the reason I went with this vacuum. They told me, if I wanted to use it in specific areas in my house just to download the app and map out where you want the vacuum to go. Alright, I thought at least I would still be able to use it. But, once I downloaded the app and started it up... I found out that the app no longer supports this vacuum anymore. I tried reaching out to customer service again with no response. Now, I have a 10 lbs paperweight. Not impressed.

Review_title: Perfect Vaccum with only one issue....
Product_review: Let me start by saying that for its price, this is an amazin vaccum, it cleans good, it mops good, and it does keep the place clean. The only problem i had with it is that the cliff sensors would trigger when in seeing a dark or black pattern in the carpet, i thought the vaccum was bad in the beggining due to it always being stuck in the middle of the carpet due to the black patters, but once i seperated the black carpet from its path, the roborock did shine cleaning in intelligent patterns not missing a spot and mopping the floors clean (although you would have to buy the mopping module seperately). I think if you have a carpet with dark or black patters that you would want the roborock to clean, then maybe you should look elsewhere, but if you have light colored carpets or none at all then this roborock is the best in this price range. Oh and also the roborock does not get tangled with hairs, but it does get tangled with small wires so keep that in mind! Overall i recommend this vaccum and i don't regret the purchase!

This is my first robot vacuum and I'm glad we bought this one. It's a lower model but is great. It has powerful suction power and transfers from my wood floor to carpet with no problem. It does my 1st level in 2 cleanings. Once the battery gets to 20% it goes to the charger to recharge and finishes. I haven't figured out its mapping but it does repeat areas that it's already vacuum on the 2nd pass but it does vacuum all areas. One set back is that on my carpet in the basement , which is a little thicker it does seem to have trouble and complains that objects are in its way when it's in the middle of the floor. Yet and still great vacuum!
The product is good and initially i was impressed with the same.

I love my new robot. He cleans my house and doesn‚Äôt complain! The only weird part was the app. You have to agree in the terms of service not to disrupt the social order of Chinese society to use the app. So...that‚Äôs something

This vacuum cleans my entire 1300 foot small home in under 90 minutes. Has not gotten stuck yet and always finds its way home. The bin fills up completely. Cleaned under my bed which hasn't seen a vacuum in years. Finds every room and remembers. Wish it was a little quieter however. Scheduling is easy with the app.

Review_title: Did not work right out of the box
Product_review: I was so excited to try this robot vacuum. I charge it up and it worked great for 60 seconds. First error. I reset it as the instructions said and it worked for 30 seconds before the same error happened again. I did this off and on for an hour. After doing some research, it seems it's a problem. I am packing it up and sending it back.

does not map so is most useful if your home is wide open and you'd clean it all at the same time. Can close bedroom doors if you don't want it in there. Love that it does not bounce around hitting things to change directions, just keeps going back and forth and you can see where it's been.

It didn‚Äôt get anything within 4‚Äù of the wall. Nothing under the couch edges or counter edges was touched. It turned around in the middle of the room for no reason and skipped half of each room. And out of 9 rooms in my house it only went into 4. Someone help me, I want this to work.

All of the these chinese robo vacs dont want to play nice with wifi. This vac seems to he no different. Either the app cannot see the vacuum or the vacuum cant see the wifi router. It is always a problem. Going to return this one and get another roomba. You get what you pay fot i guess.

Very happy with this purchase. We have two roombas and this one beats them both in terms of battery life suction power and ability to clean. what I don't like about the Roomba especially not the high-end model ones are that they're very random and they're cleaning algorithm. And this particular robo Rock has the same cleaning method as the higher end ones like the six Max but for less than half the price.

Well I just started using the Roborock E4 and it has shut down around 10 times for no apparent reason. I've tried a couple Roombas, never experienced that, forno reason anyways. Probably will be sending it back unless it gets considerably better over the next week. It never leaves a very small area also, like 10 square feet. Pretty bad!

Really great little vacuum! I didn‚Äôt know the vacuums spoke lol so this one does and announces the things it does. I even linked it with Alexa and had Alexa start the vacuuming process. Review_title: A great buy for a lower price
Product_review: Second robot vac, started off with the DEEBOT 900 series, which has fared me well. That vac was always a nightmare to pair with wifi, and generally was a bit aggressive with cords and stuff, although it's a workhorse and was worth what I invested.

Its cleaning effect is very good, especially on carpets. It can be cleaned very clean. It is easy to use, and it can be used when the phone is connected. The noise is not too loud. I use about 3~4 times to replace the garbage

Does exactly what it's supposed to do. It does seem to get to the whole house in about 2 to 3 hours. I like that I get alerted if there is an issue, like full dust bin or hair wrapped around the beater. I am only running it about once a week. I have areas that need daily vacuuming, but since the robot won't go directly to that area, I just sweep by hand. Rather than having it run for 2 hours before it gets to the one area that needs attention.

This is my first robot vacuum, and I've been really happy with it overall! It works great in our house (1800 sq feet, no carpet, no pets). We tend to run it around the whole house once a week, and it cleans well enough that I don't run our upright vacuum at all except for our area rug. I genuinely feel like the robot vacuum makes my life easier.
